    An Antony were nature's piece 'gainst fancy,
    Condemning shadows quite.

  DOLABELLA.
 He'll lead me, then, in triumph?
  DOLABELLA.
 I know't.
 Which is the Queen of Egypt?
  DOLABELLA.
 It is the Emperor, madam.

  CAESAR.
 Sole sir o' th' world,
    I cannot project mine own cause so well
    To make it clear, but do confess I have
    Been laden with like frailties which before
    Have often sham'd our sex.
 Cleopatra, know
    We will extenuate rather than enforce.

    If you apply yourself to our intents-
    Which towards you are most gentle- you shall find
    A benefit in this change; but if you seek
    To lay on me a cruelty by taking
    Antony's course, you shall bereave yourself
    Of my good purposes, and put your children
    To that destruction which I'll guard them from,  
    If thereon you rely.
 Here, my good lord.

  CLEOPATRA.
 Speak the truth, Seleucus.

  SELEUCUS.

  CLEOPATRA.

    The ingratitude of this Seleucus does
    Even make me wild.
 O slave, of no more trust
    Than love that's hir'd! What, goest thou back? Thou shalt
    Go back, I warrant thee; but I'll catch thine eyes
    Though they had wings.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CAESAR.
 Therefore be cheer'd;
    Make not your thoughts your prisons.
  
    Our care and pity is so much upon you
    That we remain your friend; and so, adieu.
 Exeunt CAESAR and his train
  CLEOPATRA.
 Finish, good lady; the bright day is done,
    And we are for the dark.

  CLEOPATRA.


                      Re-enter DOLABELLA

  DOLABELLA.
                Exit DOLABELLA
    Now, Iras, what think'st thou?
    Thou an Egyptian puppet shall be shown
    In Rome as well as I.
 The gods forbid!  
  CLEOPATRA.

  IRAS.
 Go fetch  
    My best attires.

                                       Exit IRAS.
 Here is a rural fellow
    That will not be denied your Highness' presence.

    He brings you figs.
                     Exit GUARDSMAN
    What poor an instrument
    May do a noble deed! He brings me liberty.
 Avoid, and leave him.

  CLOWN.
 Ay, ay; farewell.

  CLOWN.
 Very good.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.
         Exit

             Re-enter IRAS, with a robe, crown, &c.

    Yare, yare, good Iras; quick.

    Now to that name my courage prove my title!
    I am fire and air; my other elements
    I give to baser life.

    Farewell, kind Charmian.
 Dost thou lie still?
    If thou vanishest, thou tell'st the world  
    It is not worth leave-taking.
 Poor venomous fool,
    Be angry and dispatch.
 As sweet as balm, as soft as air, as gentle-
    O Antony! Nay, I will take thee too:  
                               [Applying another asp to her arm]
    What should I stay-                                   [Dies]
  CHARMIAN.

  FIRST GUARD.
 I partly feel thee.
 Approach, ho! All's not well: Caesar's beguil'd.
 All dead.
 Thyself art coming
    To see perform'd the dreaded act which thou
    So sought'st to hinder.
 Bravest at the last,
    She levell'd at our purposes, and being royal,
    Took her own way.

    This was his basket.

  CAESAR.
 O noble weakness!
    If they had swallow'd poison 'twould appear
    By external swelling; but she looks like sleep,
    As she would catch another Antony
    In her strong toil of grace.

  DOLABELLA.
 Take up her bed,
    And bear her women from the monument.

    She shall be buried by her Antony;
    No grave upon the earth shall clip in it
    A pair so famous.
 High events as these
    Strike those that make them; and their story is
    No less in pity than his glory which
    Brought them to be lamented.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.
 This is it, Adam, that grieves me; and the spirit of  
    my father, which I think is within me, begins to mutiny against
    this servitude.


                           Enter OLIVER

  ADAM.
                                           [ADAM retires]
  OLIVER.
 Shall I keep your hogs, and eat husks with them? What
    prodigal portion have I spent that I should come to such penury?
  OLIVER.
 O, sir, very well; here in your orchard.
 Ay, better than him I am before knows me.
 He was my father; and he is thrice a villain that says such
    a father begot villains.
 [Coming forward] Sweet masters, be patient; for your father's
    remembrance, be at accord.

  ORLANDO.
 My father
    charg'd you in his will to give me good education: you have  
    train'd me like a peasant, obscuring and hiding from me all
    gentleman-like qualities.
 Is it even so? Begin you to grow upon me? I will physic
    your rankness, and yet give no thousand crowns neither.

  OLIVER.

  OLIVER.
 She is at
    the court, and no less beloved of her uncle than his own
    daughter; and never two ladies loved as they do.

  OLIVER.
 I am given, sir, secretly to understand that your younger
    brother, Orlando, hath a disposition to come in disguis'd against
    me to try a fall.
 To-morrow, sir, I wrestle for my credit; and he
    that escapes me without some broken limb shall acquit him well.
 And so, God keep your worship!
 Exit
  OLIVER.
                       Exit

, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.

DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.

  ROSALIND.

  CELIA.
 Herein I see thou lov'st me not with the full weight that I
    love thee.
 If my uncle, thy banished father, had banished thy
    uncle, the Duke my father, so thou hadst been still with me, I
    could have taught my love to take thy father for mine; so wouldst
    thou, if the truth of thy love to me were so righteously temper'd
    as mine is to thee.
 Marry, I prithee, do, to make sport withal; but love no man
    in good earnest, nor no further in sport neither than with safety
    of a pure blush thou mayst in honour come off again.

  CELIA.
 'Tis true; for those that she makes fair she scarce makes
    honest; and those that she makes honest she makes very
    ill-favouredly.

  ROSALIND.
 Indeed, there is Fortune too hard for Nature, when
    Fortune makes Nature's natural the cutter-off of Nature's wit.
 Mistress, you must come away to your father.

  CELIA.

  ROSALIND.

  TOUCHSTONE.
 By our beards, if we had them, thou art.
 But if you
    swear by that that not, you are not forsworn; no more was this
    knight, swearing by his honour, for he never had any; or if he
    had, he had sworn it away before ever he saw those pancackes or
    that mustard.
 One that old Frederick, your father, loves.
 By my troth, thou sayest true; for since the little wit that
    fools have was silenced, the little foolery that wise men have
    makes a great show.
 With his mouth full of news.
 Then shall we be news-cramm'd.

  CELIA.

  TOUCHSTONE.

  LE BEAU.
 There comes an old man and his three sons-
  CELIA.
 You must, if you stay here; for here is the place
    appointed for the wrestling, and they are ready to perform it.
 Speak to
    him, ladies; see if you can move him.
 Young man, have you challeng'd Charles the wrestler?
  ORLANDO.

  CELIA.
 Shout]
  FREDERICK.
 No more, no more.

  FREDERICK.

  FREDERICK.
 What is thy name, young man?
  ORLANDO.
 I am more proud to be Sir Rowland's son,
    His youngest son- and would not change that calling
    To be adopted heir to Frederick.

  ROSALIND.
 Gentleman,        [Giving him a chain from her neck]
    Wear this for me; one out of suits with fortune,
    That could give more, but that her hand lacks means.

  CELIA.
 Will you go, coz?
  ROSALIND.

                                       Exeunt ROSALIND and CELIA
  ORLANDO.
 Albeit you have deserv'd
    High commendation, true applause, and love,
    Yet such is now the Duke's condition
    That he misconstrues all that you have done.

  ORLANDO.

    But I can tell you that of late this Duke
    Hath ta'en displeasure 'gainst his gentle niece,  
    Grounded upon no other argument
    But that the people praise her for her virtues
    And pity her for her good father's sake;
    And, on my life, his malice 'gainst the lady
    Will suddenly break forth.

The DUKE's palace

Enter CELIA and ROSALIND

  CELIA.
 They are but burs, cousin, thrown upon thee in holiday
    foolery; if we walk not in the trodden paths, our very petticoats
    will catch them.
  
  CELIA.
 But, turning these jests out of service, let us talk in
    good earnest.
 Doth it therefore ensue that you should love his son dearly?
    By this kind of chase I should hate him, for my father hated his
    father dearly; yet I hate not Orlando.

  CELIA.

  FREDERICK.

    Let it suffice thee that I trust thee not.
  
  ROSALIND.
 She is too subtle for thee; and her smoothness,
    Her very silence and her patience,  
    Speak to the people, and they pity her.
 She robs thee of thy name;
    And thou wilt show more bright and seem more virtuous
    When she is gone.
 Then open not thy lips.
 You, niece, provide yourself.

    If you outstay the time, upon mine honour,
    And in the greatness of my word, you die.

    Prithee be cheerful.
 Know'st thou not the Duke
    Hath banish'd me, his daughter?
  ROSALIND.

    Shall we be sund'red? Shall we part, sweet girl?
    No; let my father seek another heir.
 Alas, what danger will it be to us,
    Maids as we are, to travel forth so far!
    Beauty provoketh thieves sooner than gold.
 Now go we in content
    To liberty, and not to banishment.
                    Exeunt




<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.
 Now, my co-mates and brothers in exile,
    Hath not old custom made this life more sweet
    Than that of painted pomp? Are not these woods
    More free from peril than the envious court?
    Here feel we not the penalty of Adam,
    The seasons' difference; as the icy fang
    And churlish chiding of the winter's wind,
    Which when it bites and blows upon my body,
    Even till I shrink with cold, I smile and say
    'This is no flattery; these are counsellors
    That feelingly persuade me what I am.
'
    Sweet are the uses of adversity,
    Which, like the toad, ugly and venomous,
    Wears yet a precious jewel in his head;
    And this our life, exempt from public haunt,
    Finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks,  
    Sermons in stones, and good in everything.
 Indeed, my lord,
    The melancholy Jaques grieves at that;
    And, in that kind, swears you do more usurp
    Than doth your brother that hath banish'd you.

  DUKE SENIOR.
 Wherefore do you look
    Upon that poor and broken bankrupt there?'
    Thus most invectively he pierceth through
    The body of the country, city, court,
    Yea, and of this our life; swearing that we
    Are mere usurpers, tyrants, and what's worse,
    To fright the animals, and to kill them up
    In their assign'd and native dwelling-place.
 I'll bring you to him straight.
 I cannot hear of any that did see her.

  FREDERICK.

Before OLIVER'S house

Enter ORLANDO and ADAM, meeting

  ORLANDO.

    This is no place; this house is but a butchery;
    Abhor it, fear it, do not enter it.
 Why, whither, Adam, wouldst thou have me go?
  ADAM.
 What, wouldst thou have me go and beg my food,
    Or with a base and boist'rous sword enforce
    A thievish living on the common road?
    This I must do, or know not what to do;
    Yet this I will not do, do how I can.

  ADAM.

    At seventeen years many their fortunes seek,
    But at fourscore it is too late a week;
    Yet fortune cannot recompense me better
    Than to die well and not my master's debtor.

The Forest of Arden

Enter ROSALIND for GANYMEDE, CELIA for ALIENA, and CLOWN alias TOUCHSTONE

  ROSALIND.
 O Jupiter, how weary are my spirits!
  TOUCHSTONE.

  ROSALIND.
 Well,.

  SILVIUS.
 Alas, poor shepherd! searching of thy wound,
    I have by hard adventure found mine own.

  TOUCHSTONE.
 I remember, when I was in love, I broke my
    sword upon a stone, and bid him take that for coming a-night to
    Jane Smile; and I remember the kissing of her batler, and the
    cow's dugs that her pretty chopt hands had milk'd; and I remember
    the wooing of  peascod instead of her; from whom I took two cods,
    and giving her them again, said with weeping tears 'Wear these
    for my sake.
 Who calls?
  TOUCHSTONE.
 And to you, gentle sir, and to you all.

  ROSALIND.

  CORIN.


  JAQUES.

  JAQUES.
 My voice is ragged; I know I cannot please you.
 More at your request than to please myself.

  JAQUES.
 He is to
    disputable for my company.

           Here shall he see
           No enemy
           But winter and rough weather.
 I'll give you a verse to this note that I made yesterday in
    despite of my invention.
 And I'll go seek the Duke; his banquet is prepar'd.

                                                Exeunt severally




SCENE VI.
 Yet thou
    liest in the bleak air.

The forest

A table set out.


                         Enter JAQUES

  FIRST LORD.
 He saves my labour by his own approach.
 A fool, a fool! I met a fool i' th' forest,
    A motley fool.
 Fie on thee! I can tell what thou wouldst do.
 Of what kind should this cock come of?
  DUKE SENIOR.
 Art thou thus bolden'd, man, by thy distress?
    Or else a rude despiser of good manners,
    That in civility thou seem'st so empty?
  ORLANDO.

  DUKE SENIOR.
 Sit down and feed, and welcome to our table.

  DUKE SENIOR.

  ORLANDO.

  DUKE SENIOR.
 Go find him out.
 Thou seest we are not all alone unhappy:
    This wide and universal theatre
    Presents more woeful pageants than the scene
    Wherein we play in.
 At first the infant,
    Mewling and puking in the nurse's arms;
    Then the whining school-boy, with his satchel
    And shining morning face, creeping like snail  
    Unwillingly to school.

  ADAM.

  DUKE SENIOR.

            Then, heigh-ho, the holly!
              This life is most jolly.

    Heigh-ho! sing, &c.
 I am the Duke
    That lov'd your father.
 Give me your hand,
    And let me all your fortunes understand.
 SCENE I.
 But look to it:
    Find out thy brother wheresoe'er he is;
    Seek him with candle; bring him dead or living
    Within this twelvemonth, or turn thou no more
    To seek a living in our territory.
 O that your Highness knew my heart in this!
    I never lov'd my brother in my life.

  FREDERICK.

    O Rosalind! these trees shall be my books,
    And in their barks my thoughts I'll character,
    That every eye which in this forest looks
    Shall see thy virtue witness'd every where.

  TOUCHSTONE.
 No, truly.
 Truly, thou art damn'd, like an ill-roasted egg, all on
    one side.

  CORIN.
 Those that are good manners at the
    court are as ridiculous in the country as the behaviour of the
    country is most mockable at the court.
 Why, do not your courtier's hands sweat? And is not the
    grease of a mutton as wholesome as the sweat of a man? Shallow,
    shallow.

  CORIN.

  TOUCHSTONE.

  TOUCHSTONE.

  CORIN.
 Wilt thou rest damn'd? God help thee, shallow man! God
    make incision in thee! thou art raw.

              All the pictures fairest lin'd
              Are but black to Rosalinde.

  ROSALIND.

                If the cat will after kind,  
                So be sure will Rosalinde.

  ROSALIND.
'
  ROSALIND.
'
  CELIA.

  CELIA.

  CELIA.
 Orlando.
 Alas the day! what shall I do with my doublet and hose?
    What did he when thou saw'st him? What said he? How look'd he?
    Wherein went he? What makes he here? Did he ask for me? Where
    remains he? How parted he with thee? And when shalt thou see him
    again? Answer me in one word.
 It is as easy to count atomies as to resolve the  
    propositions of a lover; but take a taste of my finding him, and
    relish it with good observance.

  ROSALIND.
 It may well be call'd Jove's tree, when it drops forth
    such fruit.

  ROSALIND.

  ROSALIND.
 And so had I; but yet, for fashion sake, I thank you too
    for your society.

  JAQUES.
 God buy you; let's meet as little as we can.
 I do desire we may be better strangers.

  JAQUES.

  JAQUES.
 Rosalind is your love's name?
  ORLANDO.

  ORLANDO.
 What stature is she of?
  ORLANDO.

  JAQUES.

  JAQUES.
 Will you sit down with me? and we two will rail against
    our mistress the world, and all our misery.
 I will chide no breather in the world but myself, against
    whom I know most faults.
 The worst fault you have is to be in love.
 I am glad of your departure; adieu, good Monsieur
    Melancholy.
- Do you hear,
    forester?
  ORLANDO.
 Very well; what would you?
  ROSALIND.
 And why not the swift foot of Time? Had not that been as
    proper?
  ROSALIND.
 By no means, sir.
 I'll tell you who Time ambles withal, who Time
    trots withal, who Time gallops withal, and who he stands still
    withal.

  ORLANDO.

  ORLANDO.
 With this shepherdess, my sister; here in the skirts of
    the forest, like fringe upon a petticoat.

  ORLANDO.
 Your accent is something finer than you could purchase in  
    so removed a dwelling.
  
  ORLANDO.
 A lean cheek, which you have not; a blue eye and sunken,
    which you have not; an unquestionable spirit, which you have not;
    a beard neglected, which you have not; but I pardon you for that,
    for simply your having in beard is a younger brother's revenue.
 But you are no such man; you
    are rather point-device in your accoutrements, as loving yourself
    than seeming the lover of any other.
 That is one of the points in the which women still give
    the lie to their consciences.
 But, in good sooth, are you he that  
    hangs the verses on the trees wherein Rosalind is so admired?
  ORLANDO.
 Yes, one; and in this manner.
 Will you go?
  ORLANDO.

The forest

Enter TOUCHSTONE and AUDREY; JAQUES behind

  TOUCHSTONE.
 When a man's verses cannot be understood, nor a man's
    good wit seconded with the forward child understanding, it
    strikes a man more dead than a great reckoning in a little room.
 No, truly; for the truest poetry is the most feigning,
    and lovers are given to poetry; and what they swear in poetry may
    be said as lovers they do feign.
 Do you wish, then, that the gods had made me poetical?
  TOUCHSTONE.

  AUDREY.

  AUDREY.
 I am not a slut, though I thank the gods I am foul.
 [Aside] I would fain see this meeting.
 Horns? Even so.

  JAQUES.
 I am
    very glad to see you.

  JAQUES.
 Will you be married, motley?
  TOUCHSTONE.
 As the ox hath his bow, sir, the horse his curb, and
    the falcon her bells, so man hath his desires; and as pigeons
    bill, so wedlock would be nibbling.

  JAQUES.
 Go thou with me, and let me counsel thee.
 Come, sweet Audrey;
    We must be married or we must live in bawdry.

    Farewell, good Master Oliver.

The forest

Enter ROSALIND and CELIA

  ROSALIND.
 Do, I prithee; but yet have the grace to consider that tears
    do not become a man.
 But have I not cause to weep?
  CELIA.
 As good cause as one would desire; therefore weep.

    Marry, his kisses are Judas's own children.

  CELIA.
 An excellent colour: your chestnut was ever the only colour.

  CELIA.
 Nay, certainly, there is no truth in him.
 Yes; I think he is not a pick-purse nor a horse-stealer; but
    for his verity in love, I do think him as concave as covered
    goblet or a worm-eaten nut.
 Not true in love?
  CELIA.

  ROSALIND.
 O, that's a brave man! He writes brave verses, speaks brave
    words, swears brave oaths, and breaks them bravely, quite
    traverse, athwart the heart of his lover; as a puny tilter, that
    spurs his horse but on one side, breaks his staff like a noble
    goose.
 But all's brave that youth mounts and folly guides.
 If you will see a pageant truly play'd
    Between the pale complexion of true love
    And the red glow of scorn and proud disdain,
    Go hence a little, and I shall conduct you,
    If you will mark it.

Another part of the forest

Enter SILVIUS and PHEBE

  SILVIUS.

    'Tis pretty, sure, and very probable,
    That eyes, that are the frail'st and softest things,
    Who shut their coward gates on atomies,
    Should be call'd tyrants, butchers, murderers!  
    Now I do frown on thee with all my heart;
    And if mine eyes can wound, now let them kill thee.

  PHEBE.

    But, mistress, know yourself.

    Cry the man mercy, love him, take his offer;
    Foul is most foul, being foul to be a scoffer.
 Sweet youth, I pray you chide a year together;
    I had rather hear you chide than this man woo.
 He's fall'n in love with your foulness, and she'll fall
    in love with my anger.

  ROSALIND.
 If you will know my house,
    'Tis at the tuft of olives here hard by.

    Will you go, sister? Shepherd, ply her hard.

  PHEBE.
 Ha! what say'st thou, Silvius?
  SILVIUS.

  PHEBE.

  PHEBE.
 I would have you.
 So holy and so perfect is my love,
    And I in such a poverty of grace,
    That I shall think it a most plenteous crop
    To glean the broken ears after the man
    That the main harvest reaps; loose now and then
    A scatt'red smile, and that I'll live upon.
 Not very well; but I have met him oft;
    And he hath bought the cottage and the bounds
    That the old carlot once was master of.

    It is a pretty youth- not very pretty;
    But, sure, he's proud; and yet his pride becomes him.

    I'll write to him a very taunting letter,
    And thou shalt bear it; wilt thou, Silvius?
  SILVIUS.

The forest

Enter ROSALIND, CELIA, and JAQUES

  JAQUES.

  ROSALIND.
 Yes, I have gain'd my experience.
 And your experience makes you sad.
 Nay, then, God buy you, an you talk in blank verse.
 Nay, an you be so tardy, come no more in my sight.
 I had
    as lief be woo'd of a snail.
 Ay, of a snail; for though he comes slowly, he carries
    his house on his head- a better jointure, I think, than you make
    a woman; besides, he brings his destiny with him.
  
  CELIA.
 Then she puts you to entreaty, and there begins new
    matter.
 What, of my suit?
  ROSALIND.

    Am not I your Rosalind?  
  ORLANDO.
 The poor world is almost six
    thousand years old, and in all this time there was not any man
    died in his own person, videlicet, in a love-cause.
 But these
    are all lies: men have died from time to time, and worms have
    eaten them, but not for love.

  ROSALIND.

  ROSALIND.
 Yes, faith, will I, Fridays and Saturdays, and all.
 And wilt thou have me?
  ROSALIND.

  ROSALIND.
 Why then, can one desire too much of a good thing? Come,
    sister, you shall be the priest, and marry us.
 What do you say, sister?
  ORLANDO.
 Pray thee, marry us.

  ROSALIND.
 Will you, Orlando, have to wife this Rosalind?
  ORLANDO.
 Why, now; as fast as she can marry us.

  ORLANDO.
 I will
    be more jealous of thee than a Barbary cock-pigeon over his hen,
    more clamorous than a parrot against rain, more new-fangled than
    an ape, more giddy in my desires than a monkey.

  ORLANDO.
 A man that had a wife with such a wit, he might say 'Wit,
    whither wilt?' ROSALIND.
 And what wit could wit have to excuse that?
  ROSALIND.
 Marry, to say she came to seek you there.
 You shall never
    take her without her answer, unless you take her without her
    tongue.
 I must attend the Duke at dinner; by two o'clock I will be
    with thee again.

  ROSALIND.

  ROSALIND.
 I'll go find a
    shadow, and sigh till he come.

  CELIA.
 Which is he that killed the deer?
  LORD.

  JAQUES.
 Yes, sir.

  JAQUES.


                      Enter SILVIUS

  SILVIUS.
 'Od's my will!
    Her love is not the hare that I do hunt;
    Why writes she so to me? Well, shepherd, well,
    This is a letter of your own device.

  ROSALIND.
 Come, come, you are a fool,
    And turn'd into the extremity of love.
 Why, she defies me,
    Like Turk to Christian.
 She Phebes me: mark how the tyrant writes.
 Call you this railing?
  ROSALIND.
'
  SILVIUS.
 Call you this chiding?
  CELIA.
 Alas, poor shepherd!
  ROSALIND.
 West of this place, down in the neighbour bottom.

    But at this hour the house doth keep itself;
    There's none within.

  CELIA.
 About his neck
    A green and gilded snake had wreath'd itself,
    Who with her head nimble in threats approach'd
    The opening of his mouth; but suddenly,
    Seeing Orlando, it unlink'd itself,
    And with indented glides did slip away
    Into a bush; under which bush's shade
    A lioness, with udders all drawn dry,
    Lay couching, head on ground, with catlike watch,
    When that the sleeping man should stir; for 'tis
    The royal disposition of that beast
    To prey on nothing that doth seem as dead.
 And well he might so do,  
    For well I know he was unnatural.
 But, to Orlando: did he leave him there,
    Food to the suck'd and hungry lioness?
  OLIVER.
 Twice did he turn his back, and purpos'd so;
    But kindness, nobler ever than revenge,
    And nature, stronger than his just occasion,
    Made him give battle to the lioness,
    Who quickly fell before him; in which hurtling
    From miserable slumber I awak'd.

  CELIA.
 'Twas I; but 'tis not I.

    Brief, I recover'd him, bound up his wound,
    And, after some small space, being strong at heart,
    He sent me hither, stranger as I am,
    To tell this story, that you might excuse
    His broken promise, and to give this napkin,
    Dy'd in his blood, unto the shepherd youth
    That he in sport doth call his Rosalind.

                                               [ROSALIND swoons]
  CELIA.
 Many will swoon when they do look on blood.
 Look, he recovers.
 I would I were at home.
 Be of good cheer, youth.
 Well then, take a good heart and counterfeit to be a man.

  CELIA.
 Come, you look paler and paler; pray you draw homewards.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.

 SCENE I.

  AUDREY.
 A most wicked Sir Oliver, Audrey, a most vile Martext.
 Cover thy head, cover thy
    head; nay, prithee be cover'd.
 Five and twenty, sir.
 Wast born i' th' forest here?
  WILLIAM.

  TOUCHSTONE.
' A good answer.
 Faith, sir, so so.
 I do, sir.
 I will deal in poison with thee,
    or in bastinado, or in steel; I will bandy with thee in faction;
    will o'er-run thee with policy; I will kill thee a hundred and
    fifty ways; therefore tremble and depart.
 Trip, Audrey, trip, Audrey.
 It
    shall be to your good; for my father's house and all the revenue
    that was old Sir Rowland's will I estate upon you, and here live
    and die a shepherd.
 Wounded it is, but with the eyes of a lady.

  ROSALIND.
' For your brother
    and my sister no sooner met but they look'd; no sooner look'd but
    they lov'd; no sooner lov'd but they sigh'd; no sooner sigh'd but
    they ask'd one another the reason; no sooner knew the reason but
    they sought the remedy- and in these degrees have they made pair
    of stairs to marriage, which they will climb incontinent, or else
    be incontinent before marriage.
 I will weary you, then, no longer with idle talking.

    You are there follow'd by a faithful shepherd;
    Look upon him, love him; he worships you.

  PHEBE.
 Good shepherd, tell this youth what 'tis to love.
  
  SILVIUS.
 And I for Ganymede.
 It is to be all made of faith and service;
    And so am I for Phebe.

  PHEBE.
 And I for Ganymede.
 And I for Rosalind.
 It is to be all made of fantasy,
    All made of passion, and all made of wishes;
    All adoration, duty, and observance,
    All humbleness, all patience, and impatience,
    All purity, all trial, all obedience;
    And so am I for Phebe.
 And so am I for Rosalind.

  PHEBE.
 If this be so, why blame you me to love you?
  ROSALIND.
 Why do you speak too, 'Why blame you me to love you?'
  ORLANDO.
 To her that is not here, nor doth not hear.
 [To SILVIUS] I will help you if I can.
 [To
    Silvius] I will content you if what pleases you contents you, and
    you shall be married to-morrow.

  ORLANDO.
 To-morrow is the joyful day, Audre'y; to-morrow will we
    be married.
 Here come
    two of the banish'd Duke's pages.


                            Enter two PAGES

  FIRST PAGE.
 We are for you; sit i' th' middle.

  TOUCHSTONE.


               Enter ROSALIND, SILVIUS, and PHEBE

  ROSALIND.

  ROSALIND.
 I do remember in this shepherd boy
    Some lively touches of my daughter's favour.

  ORLANDO.

    But, my good lord, this boy is forest-born,
    And hath been tutor'd in the rudiments
    Of many desperate studies by his uncle,  
    Whom he reports to be a great magician,
    Obscured in the circle of this forest.

  TOUCHSTONE.
 Faith, we met, and found the quarrel was upon the
    seventh cause.
 How seventh cause? Good my lord, like this fellow.

  TOUCHSTONE.

  TOUCHSTONE.
 According to the fool's bolt, sir, and such dulcet
    diseases.

  JAQUES.
 Can you nominate in order now the degrees of the lie?
  TOUCHSTONE.
 O, sir, we quarrel in print by the book, as you have
    books for good manners.
 I will name you the degrees.
 The first,
    the Retort Courteous; the second, the Quip Modest; the third, the
    Reply Churlish; the fourth, the Reproof Valiant; the fifth, the
    Countercheck Quarrelsome; the sixth, the Lie with Circumstance;
    the seventh, the Lie Direct.
 All these you may avoid but the Lie
    Direct; and you may avoid that too with an If.
 I knew when seven
    justices could not take up a quarrel; but when the parties were
    met themselves, one of them thought but of an If, as: 'If you  
    said so, then I said so.

    [To ORLANDO] To you I give myself, for I am yours.
 If there be truth in sight, you are my daughter.

  HYMEN.

            Here's eight that must take hands
            To join in Hymen's bands,
              If truth holds true contents.

            Whiles a wedlock-hymn we sing,
            Feed yourselves with questioning,  
            That reason wonder may diminish,
            How thus we met, and these things finish.


                 Enter JAQUES de BOYS

  JAQUES de BOYS.

  JAQUES DE BOYS.
 Out of these convertites
    There is much matter to be heard and learn'd.

  JAQUES.
 To see no pastime I.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.

DUKE.

DUKE.
 Alas! too soon
  We came aboard.

  And this it was, for other means was none:
  The sailors sought for safety by our boat,
  And left the ship, then sinking-ripe, to us;
  My wife, more careful for the latter-born,
  Had fast'ned him unto a small spare mast,
  Such as sea-faring men provide for storms;
  To him one of the other twins was bound,
  Whilst I had been like heedful of the other.

  Therefore, merchant, I'll limit thee this day
  To seek thy help by beneficial hap.

  Gaoler, take him to thy custody.

  This very day a Syracusian merchant
  Is apprehended for arrival here;
  And, not being able to buy out his life,
  According to the statute of the town,
  Dies ere the weary sun set in the west.

  Get thee away.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

<Exit
ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.

  I to the world am like a drop of water
  That in the ocean seeks another drop,
  Who, falling there to find his fellow forth,
  Unseen, inquisitive, confounds himself.
 O-Sixpence that I had a Wednesday last
  To pay the saddler for my mistress' crupper?
  The saddler had it, sir; I kept it not.
 I am not in a sportive humour now;
  Tell me, and dally not, where is the money?
  We being strangers here, how dar'st thou trust
  So great a charge from thine own custody?
DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 I pray you jest, sir, as you sit at dinner.

  Methinks your maw, like mine, should be your clock,
  And strike you home without a messenger.
 Come on, sir knave, have done your foolishness,
  And tell me how thou hast dispos'd thy charge.
 My charge was but to fetch you from the mart
  Home to your house, the Phoenix, sir, to dinner.
 Now, as I am a Christian, answer me
  In what safe place you have bestow'd my money,
  Or I shall break that merry sconce of yours,
  That stands on tricks when I am undispos'd.

  If I should pay your worship those again,
  Perchance you will not bear them patiently.

<Exit
ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.

  They say this town is full of cozenage;
  As, nimble jugglers that deceive the eye,
  Dark-working sorcerers that change the mind,
  Soul-killing witches that deform the body,
  Disguised cheaters, prating mountebanks,
  And many such-like liberties of sin;
  If it prove so, I will be gone the sooner.
>>





ACT Il.
 Because their business still lies out o' door.

  There's nothing situate under heaven's eye
  But hath his bound, in earth, in sea, in sky.

LUCIANA.


Enter DROMIO OF EPHESUS

ADRIANA.
 Say, is your tardy master now at hand?
DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 Nay, he's at two hands with me, and that my two
  ears can witness.

  Beshrew his hand, I scarce could understand it.
 Why, mistress, sure my master is horn-mad.

  'Your meat doth burn' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he.

  'Where is the thousand marks I gave thee, villain?'
  'The pig' quoth I 'is burn'd'; 'My gold!' quoth he.

DROMIO OF EPHESUS.

  But, too unruly deer, he breaks the pale,
  And feeds from home; poor I am but his stale.

LUCIANA.

  You know no Centaur! You receiv'd no gold!
  Your mistress sent to have me home to dinner!
  My house was at the Phoenix! Wast thou mad,
  That thus so madly thou didst answer me?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 What answer, sir? When spake I such a word?
ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.

  What means this jest? I pray you, master, tell me.
 Because that I familiarly sometimes
  Do use you for my fool and chat with you,
  Your sauciness will jest upon my love,
  And make a common of my serious hours.

  When the sun shines let foolish gnats make sport,
  But creep in crannies when he hides his beams.

  If you will jest with me, know my aspect,
  And fashion your demeanour to my looks,
  Or I will beat this method in your sconce.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 Nothing, sir, but that I am beaten.
 Shall I tell you why?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 Ay, sir, and wherefore; for they say
  every why hath a wherefore.
 Why, first for flouting me; and then wherefore,
  For urging it the second time to me.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 But say, sir, is it dinnertime?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 No, sir; I think the meat wants that I have.
 In good time, sir, what's that?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Lest it make you choleric, and purchase me
  another dry basting.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Well, sir, learn to jest in good time;
  there's a time for all things.
 Let's hear it.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 Certain ones, then.
 Name them.
 Marry, and did, sir; namely, no time to recover
  hair lost by nature.
 But,
  soft, who wafts us yonder?

Enter ADRIANA and LUCIANA

ADRIANA.

  How comes it now, my husband, O, how comes it,
  That thou art then estranged from thyself?
  Thyself I call it, being strange to me,
  That, undividable, incorporate,
  Am better than thy dear self's better part.

  I am possess'd with an adulterate blot;
  My blood is mingled with the crime of lust;
  For if we two be one, and thou play false,
  I do digest the poison of thy flesh,
  Being strumpeted by thy contagion.
 Villain, thou liest; for even her very words
  Didst thou deliver to me on the mart.
 I never spake with her in all my life.

  Come, I will fasten on this sleeve of thine;
  Thou art an elm, my husband, I a vine,
  Whose weakness, married to thy stronger state,
  Makes me with thy strength to communicate.

  If aught possess thee from me, it is dross,
  Usurping ivy, brier, or idle moss;
  Who all, for want of pruning, with intrusion
  Infect thy sap, and live on thy confusion.

  What, was I married to her in my dream?
  Or sleep I now, and think I hear all this?
  What error drives our eyes and ears amiss?
  Until I know this sure uncertainty,
  I'll entertain the offer'd fallacy.
 O, for my beads! I cross me for sinner.

  This is the fairy land.
 O spite of spites!
  We talk with goblins, owls, and sprites.
 Nay, master, both in mind and in my shape.
 No, I am an ape.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 'Tis true; she rides me, and I long for grass.

  'Tis so, I am an ass; else it could never be
  But I should know her as well as she knows me.

ADRIANA.

  Come, sir, to dinner.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 Master, shall I be porter at the gate?
ADRIANA.

  Thou drunkard, thou, what didst thou mean by this?
DROMIO OF EPHESUS.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.
 Good meat, sir, is common; that every churl affords.

  But, soft, my door is lock'd; go bid them let us in.

  Dost thou conjure for wenches, that thou call'st for such store,
  When one is one too many? Go get thee from the door.

DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 What patch is made our porter?
  My master stays in the street.
  [Within]  Let him walk from whence he came,
    lest he catch cold on's feet.
  [Within]  Right, sir; I'll tell you when,
    an you'll tell me wherefore.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.
  [Within]  Nor to-day here you must not;
    come again when you may.
 What art thou that keep'st me out
    from the house I owe?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
  [Within]  What a coil is there, Dromio? Who are those at the gate?
DROMIO OF EPHESUS.

DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 O Lord, I must laugh!
  Have at you with a proverb: Shall I set in my staff?
LUCE.
  [Within]  Have at you with another: that's-when? can you tell?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
  [Within]  And you said no.
 SO, Come, help: well struck! there was blow for blow.

LUCE.

ANGELO.
 Here is neither cheer, sir, nor welcome; we would fain have either.

DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 You would say so, master, if your garments were thin.

  Your cake here is warm within; you stand here in the cold;
  It would make a man mad as a buck to be so bought and sold.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 Here's too much 'out upon thee!' pray thee let me in.
  [Within]  Ay, when fowls have no
    feathers and fish have no fin.

DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 Go get thee gone; fetch me an iron crow.
 You have prevail'd.
  [To ANGELO]  Get you home
  And fetch the chain; by this I know 'tis made.

  Bring it, I pray you, to the Porpentine;
  For there's the house.
 I'll meet you at that place some hour hence.
 And may it be that you have quite forgot
  A husband's office? Shall, Antipholus,
  Even in the spring of love, thy love-springs rot?
  Shall love, in building, grow so ruinous?
  If you did wed my sister for her wealth,
  Then for her wealth's sake use her with more kindness;
  Or, if you like elsewhere, do it by stealth;
  Muffle your false love with some show of blindness;
  Let not my sister read it in your eye;
  Be not thy tongue thy own shame's orator;
  Look sweet, speak fair, become disloyalty;
  Apparel vice like virtue's harbinger;
  Bear a fair presence, though your heart be tainted;
  Teach sin the carriage of a holy saint;
  Be secret-false.
 Sweet mistress-what your name is else, I know not,
  Nor by what wonder you do hit of mine-
  Less in your knowledge and your grace you show not
  Than our earth's wonder-more than earth, divine.

  Teach me, dear creature, how to think and speak;
  Lay open to my earthy-gross conceit,
  Smoth'red in errors, feeble, shallow, weak,
  The folded meaning of your words' deceit.

  Give me thy hand.

LUCIANA.


ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Thou art Dromio, thou art my
  man, thou art thyself.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
'
  I have but lean luck in the match, and yet is she a
  wondrous fat marriage.

  I warrant, her rags and the tallow in them will burn
  Poland winter.
 That's a fault that water will mend.
 No, sir, 'tis in grain; Noah's flood
  could not do it.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Then she bears some breadth?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 In what part of her body stands Ireland?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 Marry, sir, in her buttocks; I found it out by
  the bogs.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Where Scotland?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 I look'd for the chalky cliffs, but I
  could find no whiteness in them; but I guess it stood in her
  chin, by the salt rheum that ran between France and it.
 Faith, I saw it not, but I felt it hot in
  her breath.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Where America, the Indies?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 O, sir, upon her nose, an o'er embellished with
  rubies, carbuncles, sapphires, declining their rich aspect to the
  hot breath of Spain; who sent whole armadoes of caracks to be
  ballast at her nose.
 Where stood Belgia, the Netherlands?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

  If any bark put forth, come to the mart,
  Where I will walk till thou return to me.
 I know it well, sir.

  Go home with it, and please your wife withal;
  And soon at supper-time I'll visit you,
  And then receive my money for the chain.
 I pray you, sir, receive the money now,
  For fear you ne'er see chain nor money more.
 What I should think of this cannot tell:
  But this I think, there's no man is so vain
  That would refuse so fair an offer'd chain.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.

  Therefore make present satisfaction,
  Or I'll attach you by this officer.

ANGELO.

SECOND MERCHANT.
 You hear how he importunes me-the chain!
ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.

ANGELO.
 Fie, now you run this humour out of breath!
  Come, where's the chain? I pray you let me see it.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.
 The money that you owe me for the chain.

SECOND MERCHANT.
 Well, officer, arrest him at my suit.

OFFICER.
 This touches me in reputation.
 Sir, sir, I shall have law in Ephesus,
  To your notorious shame, I doubt it not.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.

  Thither I must, although against my will,
  For servants must their masters' minds fulfil.

<Exit


SCENE 2

The house of ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS

Enter ADRIANA and LUCIANA

ADRIANA.
 First he denied you had in him no right.

  First he did praise my beauty, then my speech.
 Didst speak him fair?
LUCIANA.

  Far from her nest the lapwing cries away;
  My heart prays for him, though my tongue do curse.
 No, he's in Tartar limbo, worse than hell.
 What, is he arrested? Tell me, at whose suit?
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

  Will you send him, mistress, redemption, the money in his desk?
ADRIANA.
 The hours come back! That did I never hear.
 O yes.
 Time is a very bankrupt, and owes
    more than he's worth to season.
 There's not a man I meet but doth salute me
  As if I were their well-acquainted friend;
  And every one doth call me by my name.
 What, have you got the picture of old Adam new-apparell'd?
ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Not that Adam that kept the Paradise,
  but that Adam that keeps the prison; he that goes in the
  calf's skin that was kill'd for the Prodigal; he that came behind
  you, sir, like an evil angel, and bid you forsake your liberty.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Marry, he must have a long spoon
  that must eat with the devil.
 Avoid then, fiend! What tell'st thou me of supping?
  Thou art, as you are all, a sorceress;
  I conjure thee to leave me and be gone.

COURTEZAN.
 Some devils ask but the parings of one's nail,
  A rush, a hair, a drop of blood, a pin,
  A nut, a cherry-stone;
  But she, more covetous, would have a chain.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
 Mistress, that you know.

  The reason that I gather he is mad,
  Besides this present instance of his rage,
  Is a mad tale he told to-day at dinner
  Of his own doors being shut against his entrance.

  My way is now to hie home to his house,
  And tell his wife that, being lunatic,
  He rush'd into my house and took perforce
  My ring away.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.
 Why, sir, I gave the money for the rope.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.
 To a rope's-end, sir; and to that end am I
  return'd.

DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 Thou art sensible in nothing but
  blows, and so is an ass.
 When I am cold he heats me with
  beating; when I am warm he cools me with beating.
'
ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.
 How say you now? Is not your husband mad?
ADRIANA.

PINCH.
 There is my hand, and let it feel your ear.

  I conjure thee by all the saints in heaven.
 O, that thou wert not, poor distressed soul!
ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.
 Sir, Sooth to say, you did not dine at home.
 Perdie, your doors were lock'd and you shut out.
 And did not she herself revile me there?
DROMIO OF EPHESUS.
 Certes, she did; the kitchen-vestal scorn'd you.
 Thou hast suborn'd the goldsmith to arrest me.

ADRIANA.
 O, bind him, bind him; let him not come near me.
 More company! The fiend is strong within him.

PINCH.
 He is my prisoner; if I let him go,
  The debt he owes will be requir'd of me.
 Master, I am here ent'red in bond for you.
 God help, poor souls, how idly do they talk!
ADRIANA.
 What is the sum he owes?
OFFICER.
 Two hundred ducats.

COURTEZAN.


LUCIANA.

OFFICER.
 I see these witches are afraid of swords.
 She that would be your wife now ran from you.
 Come to the Centaur; fetch our stuff from thence.

DROMIO OF SYRACUSE.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.
 How is the man esteem'd here in the city?
ANGELO.


Enter ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE and DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

ANGELO.
 I think I had; I never did deny it.

SECOND MERCHANT.
 Yes, that you did, sir, and forswore it too.
 These ears of mine, thou know'st, did hear thee.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.

<Exeunt ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE and DROMIO OF SYRACUSE to the priory

Enter the LADY ABBESS

ABBESS.

ANGELO.

SECOND MERCHANT.
 I am sorry now that I did draw on him.
 Hath he not lost much wealth by wreck of sea?
  Buried some dear friend? Hath not else his eye
  Stray'd his affection in unlawful love?
  A sin prevailing much in youthful men
  Who give their eyes the liberty of gazing.

ABBESS.
 As roughly as my modesty would let me.
 And thereof came it that the man was mad.

  The venom clamours of a jealous woman
  Poisons more deadly than a mad dog's tooth.
 Neither; he took this place for sanctuary,
  And it shall privilege him from your hands
  Till I have brought him to his wits again,
  Or lose my labour in assaying it.
 Be quiet, and depart; thou shalt not have him.
 Come, go; I will fall prostrate at his feet,
  And never rise until my tears and prayers
  Have won his Grace to come in person hither
  And take perforce my husband from the Abbess.
 By this, I think, the dial points at five;
  Anon, I'm sure, the Duke himself in person
  Comes this way to the melancholy vale,
  The place of death and sorry execution,
  Behind the ditches of the abbey here.
 Yet once again proclaim it publicly,
  If any friend will pay the sum for him,
  He shall not die; so much we tender him.
 She is a virtuous and a reverend lady;
  It cannot be that she hath done thee wrong.
 May it please your Grace, Antipholus, my husband,
  Who I made lord of me and all I had
  At your important letters-this ill day
  A most outrageous fit of madness took him,
  That desp'rately he hurried through the street,
  With him his bondman all as mad as he,
  Doing displeasure to the citizens
  By rushing in their houses, bearing thence
  Rings, jewels, anything his rage did like.
 Then they fled
  Into this abbey, whither we pursu'd them;
  And here the Abbess shuts the gates on us,
  And will not suffer us to fetch him out,
  Nor send him forth that we may bear him hence.

  Therefore, most gracious Duke, with thy command
  Let him be brought forth and borne hence for help.

MESSENGER.

  Even now we hous'd him in the abbey here,
  And now he's there, past thought of human reason.

ANTIPHOLUS OFEPHESUS.
 Justice, sweet Prince, against that woman there!
  She whom thou gav'st to me to be my wife,
  That hath abused and dishonoured me
  Even in the strength and height of injury.

  Beyond imagination is the wrong
  That she this day hath shameless thrown on me.
 So befall my soul
  As this is false he burdens me withal!
LUCIANA.
 Ne'er may I look on day nor sleep on night
  But she tells to your Highness simple truth!
ANGELO.
 O peflur'd woman! They are both forsworn.

  There did this perjur'd goldsmith swear me down
  That I this day of him receiv'd the chain,
  Which, God he knows, I saw not; for the which
  He did arrest me with an officer.

  I did obey, and sent my peasant home
  For certain ducats; he with none return'd.
 Along with them
  They brought one Pinch, a hungry lean-fac'd villain,
  A mere anatomy, a mountebank,
  A threadbare juggler, and a fortune-teller,
  A needy, hollow-ey'd, sharp-looking wretch,
  A living dead man.
 This pernicious slave,
  Forsooth, took on him as a conjurer,
  And gazing in mine eyes, feeling my pulse,
  And with no face, as 'twere, outfacing me,
  Cries out I was possess'd.
 My lord, in truth, thus far I witness with him,
  That he din'd not at home, but was lock'd out.
 Besides, I will be sworn these ears of mine
  Heard you confess you had the chain of him,
  After you first forswore it on the mart;
  And thereupon I drew my sword on you,
  And then you fled into this abbey here,
  From whence, I think, you are come by miracle.
 I never came within these abbey walls,
  Nor ever didst thou draw thy sword on me;
  I never saw the chain, so help me Heaven!
  And this is false you burden me withal.

COURTEZAN.
 Saw'st thou him enter at the abbey here?
COURTEZAN.
 Go call the Abbess hither.

  I think you are all mated or stark mad.

AEGEON.
 Ourselves we do remember, sir, by you;
  For lately we were bound as you are now.

  You are not Pinch's patient, are you, sir?
AEGEON.
 Why look you strange on me? You know me well.

AEGEON.
 I am sure thou dost.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.

  I see thy age and dangers make thee dote.
 I see two husbands, or mine eyes deceive me.
 One of these men is genius to the other;
  And so of these.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 O, my old master! who hath bound
ABBESS.
 Whoever bound him, I will loose his bonds,
  And gain a husband by his liberty.

  Antipholus, thou cam'st from Corinth first?
ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 No, sir, not I; I came from Syracuse.
 And I with him.
 I, gentle mistress.
 That is the chain, sir, which you had of me.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.

ANGELO.
 I think I did, sir; I deny it not.
 No, none by me.

ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE.
 Sir, I must have that diamond from you.

ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS.

ABBESS.
 He speaks to me.

  Embrace thy brother there; rejoice with him.

DROMIO OF EPHESUS.

Rome.

  FIRST CITIZEN.
 First, you know Caius Marcius is chief enemy to the
    people.
 Let us kill him, and we'll have corn at our own
    price.
 Would you proceed especially against Caius Marcius?
  FIRST CITIZEN.
 Very well, and could be content to give him good
    report for't but that he pays himself with being proud.
 What he cannot help in his nature you account a
    vice in him.
  [Shouts  
    within]  What shouts are these? The other side o' th' city is
    risen.

  FIRST CITIZEN.

  FIRST CITIZEN.
 Alack,
    You are transported by calamity
    Thither where more attends you; and you slander
    The helms o' th' state, who care for you like fathers,
    When you curse them as enemies.
 Care for us! True, indeed! They ne'er car'd for us
    yet.
 Sir, I shall tell you.

  FIRST CITIZEN.
 Your belly's answer- What?
    The kingly crowned head, the vigilant eye,
    The counsellor heart, the arm our soldier,
    Our steed the leg, the tongue our trumpeter,
    With other muniments and petty helps
    Is this our fabric, if that they-
  MENENIUS.
 What then?
    Fore me, this fellow speaks! What then? What then?
  FIRST CITIZEN.
 Should by the cormorant belly be restrain'd,
    Who is the sink o' th' body-
  MENENIUS.
 The former agents, if they did complain,
    What could the belly answer?  
  MENENIUS.
 I will tell you;
    If you'll bestow a small- of what you have little-
    Patience awhile, you'st hear the belly's answer.
 And though that all at once
    You, my good friends'- this says the belly; mark me.

  FIRST CITIZEN.
 'Though all at once cannot
    See what I do deliver out to each,
    Yet I can make my audit up, that all
    From me do back receive the flour of all,
    And leave me but the bran.
' What say you to' t?
  FIRST CITIZEN.
 It was an answer.
 Your virtue is
    To make him worthy whose offence subdues him,
    And curse that justice did it.
 He that depends
    Upon your favours swims with fins of lead,
    And hews down oaks with rushes.

  MARCIUS.
 Hang 'em!
    They said they were an-hungry; sigh'd forth proverbs-
    That hunger broke stone walls, that dogs must eat,
    That meat was made for mouths, that the gods sent not
    Corn for the rich men only.
 What is granted them?
  MARCIUS.
 What's the matter?
  MESSENGER.
 The news is, sir, the Volsces are in arms.

  MENENIUS.
 Nay, let them follow.
 But I do wonder
    His insolence can brook to be commanded
    Under Cominius.

  BRUTUS.
                                    Exeunt




SCENE II.
 Is it not yours?
    What ever have been thought on in this state
    That could be brought to bodily act ere Rome
    Had circumvention? 'Tis not four days gone
    Since I heard thence; these are the words- I think
    I have the letter here;.
yes, here it is:
    [Reads]  'They have press'd a power, but it is not known
    Whether for east or west.
'
  FIRST SENATOR.
 Our army's in the field;
    We never yet made doubt but Rome was ready
    To answer us.

  SECOND SENATOR.

  AUFIDIUS.
 Nay more,
    Some parcels of their power are forth already,  
    And only hitherward.

  ALL.
 Farewell.
 When yet
    he was but tender-bodied, and the only son of my womb; when youth
    with comeliness pluck'd all gaze his way; when, for a day of
    kings' entreaties, a mother should not sell him an hour from her
    beholding; I, considering how honour would become such a person-
    that it was no better than picture-like to hang by th' wall, if
    renown made it not stir- was pleas'd to let him seek danger where
    he was to find fame.

  VIRGILIA.
 Hear me profess sincerely: had I a dozen
    sons, each in my love alike, and none less dear than thine and my
    good Marcius, I had rather had eleven die nobly for their country
    than one voluptuously surfeit out of action.

  VOLUMNIA.
 Indeed you shall not.

    Methinks I see him stamp thus, and call thus:
    'Come on, you cowards! You were got in fear,
    Though you were born in Rome.
' His bloody brow
    With his mail'd hand then wiping, forth he goes,
    Like to a harvest-man that's task'd to mow
    Or all or lose his hire.


         Re-enter GENTLEWOMAN, With VALERIA and an usher

  VALERIA.
 My ladies both, good day to you.
 I am glad to see your ladyship.
 I thank your ladyship; well, good madam.
 He had rather see the swords and hear a drum than look  
    upon his schoolmaster.
 Indeed, la, 'tis a noble child.

  VIRGILIA.
 No, good madam; I will not out of doors.

  VALERIA.

  VALERIA.
 In truth, la, go with me; and I'll tell you excellent news
    of your husband.
 O, good madam, there can be none yet.
 Verily, I do not jest with you; there came news from him
    last night.
 Indeed, madam?
  VALERIA.

  VIRGILIA.
 I wish you much
    mirth.
 They lie in view, but have not spoke as yet.

  MARCIUS.

  MARCIUS.
 All the contagion of the south light on you,
    You shames of Rome! you herd of- Boils and plagues
    Plaster you o'er, that you may be abhorr'd
    Farther than seen, and one infect another
    Against the wind a mile! You souls of geese
    That bear the shapes of men, how have you run
    From slaves that apes would beat! Pluto and hell!
    All hurt behind! Backs red, and faces pale
    With flight and agued fear! Mend and charge home,
    Or, by the fires of heaven, I'll leave the foe
    And make my wars on you.
 Not I.
                    [MARCIUS is shut in]
  FIRST SOLDIER.

  ALL.
 A street

Enter certain Romans, with spoils

  FIRST ROMAN.
 See here these movers that do prize their hours
    At a crack'd drachma! Cushions, leaden spoons,
    Irons of a doit, doublets that hangmen would
    Bury with those that wore them, these base slaves,
    Ere yet the fight be done, pack up.
 To Aufidius thus
    I will appear, and fight.
 The citizens of Corioli have issued
    And given to Lartius and to Marcius battle;
    I saw our party to their trenches driven,
    And then I came away.
 Who's yonder
    That does appear as he were flay'd? O gods!
    He has the stamp of Marcius, and I have
    Before-time seen him thus.
 Ay, if you come not in the blood of others,
    But mantled in your own.

  COMINIUS.
 As with a man busied about decrees:
    Condemning some to death and some to exile;
    Ransoming him or pitying, threat'ning th' other;
    Holding Corioli in the name of Rome
    Even like a fawning greyhound in the leash,
    To let him slip at will.

  COMINIUS.
 But for our gentlemen,
    The common file- a plague! tribunes for them!
    The mouse ne'er shunn'd the cat as they did budge
    From rascals worse than they.

  COMINIUS.
 Marcius,
    We have at disadvantage fought, and did
    Retire to win our purpose.

  MARCIUS.
 Though I could wish
    You were conducted to a gentle bath
    And balms applied to you, yet dare I never
    Deny your asking: take your choice of those
    That best can aid your action.
 Fear not our care, sir.
 Hence, and shut your gates upon's.

    Our guider, come; to th' Roman camp conduct us.
       Exeunt




SCENE VIII.

  MARCIUS.


       Here they fight, and certain Volsces come in the aid
        of AUFIDIUS.
 If I should tell thee o'er this thy day's work,
    Thou't not believe thy deeds; but I'll report it
    Where senators shall mingle tears with smiles;
    Where great patricians shall attend, and shrug,
    I' th' end admire; where ladies shall be frighted
    And, gladly quak'd, hear more; where the dull tribunes,
    That with the fusty plebeians hate thine honours,
    Shall say against their hearts 'We thank the gods
    Our Rome hath such a soldier.

    Hadst thou beheld-
  MARCIUS.
 You shall not be
    The grave of your deserving; Rome must know
    The value of her own.
 They all cry 'Marcius, Marcius!'
   cast up their caps and lances.
 COMINIUS and LARTIUS stand bare

    May these same instruments which you profane
    Never sound more! When drums and trumpets shall
    I' th' field prove flatterers, let courts and cities be  
    Made all of false-fac'd soothing.

    Bear th' addition nobly ever!
                           [Flourish.
 Trumpets sound, and drums]
  ALL.
 I will go wash;
    And when my face is fair you shall perceive
    Whether I blush or no.
 Send us to Rome
    The best, with whom we may articulate
    For their own good and ours.
 I, that now
    Refus'd most princely gifts, am bound to beg  
    Of my Lord General.
 Marcius, his name?
  CORIOLANUS.
 By Jupiter, forgot!
    I am weary; yea, my memory is tir'd.
 Cornets.
 The town is ta'en.

  AUFIDIUS.
 Condition?
    What good condition can a treaty find
    I' th' part that is at mercy? Five times, Marcius,
    I have fought with thee; so often hast thou beat me;
    And wouldst do so, I think, should we encounter
    As often as we eat.
 Bolder, though not so subtle.
 Where I find him, were it
    At home, upon my brother's guard, even there,
    Against the hospitable canon, would I
    Wash my fierce hand in's heart.

  FIRST SOLDIER.

Rome.
 The augurer tells me we shall have news tonight.
 Ay, to devour him, as the hungry plebeians would the
    noble Marcius.
 Well, sir.
 In what enormity is Marcius poor in that you two have not
    in abundance?
  BRUTUS.

  BRUTUS.
 Because you talk of pride now- will you not be angry?
  BOTH TRIBUNES.
 We do it not alone, sir.

  MENENIUS.
 You talk of
    pride.
 O that you could turn your eyes toward the napes of your
    necks, and make but an interior survey of your good selves! O
    that you could!
  BOTH TRIBUNES.
 I am known to be a humorous patrician, and one that loves
    a cup of hot wine with not a drop of allaying Tiber in't; said to
    be something imperfect in favouring the first complaint, hasty
    and tinder-like upon too trivial motion; one that converses more
    with the buttock of the night than with the forehead of the
    morning.

    Meeting two such wealsmen as you are- I cannot call you
    Lycurguses- if the drink you give me touch my palate adversely, I
    make a crooked face at it.
 You are
    ambitious for poor knaves' caps and legs; you wear out a good
    wholesome forenoon in hearing a cause between an orange-wife and
    a fosset-seller, and then rejourn the controversy of threepence
    to a second day of audience.
 All
    the peace you make in their cause is calling both the parties
    knaves.
 Our very priests must become mockers, if they shall
    encounter such ridiculous subjects as you are.
 Yet you must be saying Marcius is proud; who, in a
    cheap estimation, is worth all your predecessors since Deucalion;  
    though peradventure some of the best of 'em were hereditary
    hangmen.
 Ha! Marcius coming home?
  VOLUMNIA.
  
  MENENIUS.
 A letter for me?
  VIRGILIA.
 Yes, certain, there's a letter for you; I saw't.

  VIRGILIA.
 O, no, no, no.
 Has he disciplin'd Aufidius soundly?
  VOLUMNIA.
 Titus Lartius writes they fought together, but Aufidius
    got off.

  VIRGILIA.
 The gods grant them true!
  VOLUMNIA.
 Where is he wounded?
    [To the TRIBUNES]  God save your good worships! Marcius is coming
    home; he has more cause to be proud.
 One i' th' neck and two i' th' thigh- there's nine that I
    know.

  VOLUMNIA.
 Know, Rome, that all alone Marcius did fight
    Within Corioli gates, where he hath won,
    With fame, a name to Caius Marcius; these
    In honour follows Coriolanus.

    Welcome to Rome, renowned Coriolanus!             [Flourish]
  ALL.
 Look, sir, your mother!  
  CORIOLANUS.
 My gracious silence, hail!
    Wouldst thou have laugh'd had I come coffin'd home,
    That weep'st to see me triumph? Ah, my dear,
    Such eyes the widows in Corioli wear,
    And mothers that lack sons.
 And live you yet?  [To VALERIA]  O my sweet lady,
    pardon.

  MENENIUS.

  CORIOLANUS.

    Ere in our own house I do shade my head,
    The good patricians must be visited;
    From whom I have receiv'd not only greetings,
    But with them change of honours.

  CORIOLANUS.
 Cornets.
 All tongues speak of him and the bleared sights
    Are spectacled to see him.

  SICINIUS.

  BRUTUS.
  
  BRUTUS.
 O, he would miss it rather
    Than carry it but by the suit of the gentry to him
    And the desire of the nobles.

  SICINIUS.

  BRUTUS.
 So it must fall out
    To him or our authorities.
 For an end,
    We must suggest the people in what hatred
    He still hath held them; that to's power he would  
    Have made them mules, silenc'd their pleaders, and
    Dispropertied their freedoms; holding them
    In human action and capacity
    Of no more soul nor fitness for the world
    Than camels in their war, who have their provand
    Only for bearing burdens, and sore blows
    For sinking under them.

  SICINIUS.
  
    I have seen the dumb men throng to see him and
    The blind to hear him speak; matrons flung gloves,
    Ladies and maids their scarfs and handkerchers,
    Upon him as he pass'd; the nobles bended
    As to Jove's statue, and the commons made
    A shower and thunder with their caps and shouts.

  BRUTUS.
                                Exeunt




SCENE II.

    Therefore, for Coriolanus neither to care whether they love or
    hate him manifests the true knowledge he has in their
    disposition, and out of his noble carelessness lets them plainly
    see't.

  FIRST OFFICER.

  SECOND OFFICER.


         A sennet.
 Enter the PATRICIANS and the TRIBUNES
         OF THE PEOPLE, LICTORS before them; CORIOLANUS,
            MENENIUS, COMINIUS the Consul.

                         CORIOLANUS stands

  MENENIUS.

    Leave nothing out for length, and make us think
    Rather our state's defective for requital
    Than we to stretch it out.

  MENENIUS.
 Your Honours' pardon.

  BRUTUS.

  CORIOLANUS.
 If it be,
    The man I speak of cannot in the world
    Be singly counterpois'd.
 His sword, death's stamp,
    Where it did mark, it took; from face to foot
    He was a thing of blood, whose every motion
    Was tim'd with dying cries.
 Alone he ent'red
    The mortal gate of th' city, which he painted
    With shunless destiny; aidless came off,
    And with a sudden re-enforcement struck
    Corioli like a planet.
 Worthy man!
  FIRST SENATOR.
 The Senate, Coriolanus, are well pleas'd
    To make thee consul.

  CORIOLANUS.
 I do beseech you
    Let me o'erleap that custom; for I cannot
    Put on the gown, stand naked, and entreat them
    For my wounds' sake to give their suffrage.
 Please you
    That I may pass this doing.

  SICINIUS.

    Pray you go fit you to the custom, and
    Take to you, as your predecessors have,
    Your honour with your form.

  BRUTUS.
 You see how he intends to use the people.
 We may, sir, if we will.

  FIRST CITIZEN.

  THIRD CITIZEN.
 To lose itself in a fog; where being three parts
   melted away with rotten dews, the fourth would return for
    conscience' sake, to help to get thee a wife.

    We are not to stay all together, but to come by him where he
    stands, by ones, by twos, and by threes.

  ALL.
                         Exeunt citizens
  MENENIUS.
 O sir, you are not right; have you not known
    The worthiest men have done't?
  CORIOLANUS.
 O me, the gods!
    You must not speak of that.
 Pray you speak to 'em, I pray you,
    In wholesome manner.
 So, here comes a brace.

    You know the cause, sir, of my standing here.
 How, not your own desire?
  CORIOLANUS.

  THIRD CITIZEN.
  
  CORIOLANUS.

  THIRD CITIZEN.
 But this is something odd.
 I will, sir, flatter my sworn
    brother, the people, to earn a dearer estimation of them; 'tis a
    condition they account gentle; and since the wisdom of their
    choice is rather to have my hat than my heart, I will practise
    the insinuating nod and be off to them most counterfeitly.
 We hope to find you our friend; and therefore give
    you our voices heartily.
 You have received many wounds for your country.
 I will not seal your knowledge with showing them.

  BOTH CITIZENS.

    Why in this wolvish toge should I stand here
    To beg of Hob and Dick that do appear
    Their needless vouches? Custom calls me to't.
 Rather than fool it so,
    Let the high office and the honour go
    To one that would do thus.
 Worthy voices!

             Re-enter MENENIUS with BRUTUS and SICINIUS

  MENENIUS.

    The people do admit you, and are summon'd
    To meet anon, upon your approbation.

  CORIOLANUS.
 You may, sir.

  MENENIUS.

  SICINIUS.
 Fare you well.

  BRUTUS.
 Amen, sir.

  THIRD CITIZEN.
 He should have show'd us
    His marks of merit, wounds receiv'd for's country.
 Thus to have said,
    As you were fore-advis'd, had touch'd his spirit
    And tried his inclination; from him pluck'd
    Either his gracious promise, which you might,  
    As cause had call'd you up, have held him to;
    Or else it would have gall'd his surly nature,
    Which easily endures not article
    Tying him to aught.

  BRUTUS.
 Get you hence instantly, and tell those friends
    They have chose a consul that will from them take
    Their liberties, make them of no more voice
    Than dogs, that are as often beat for barking
    As therefore kept to do so.
 Enforce his pride
    And his old hate unto you; besides, forget not
    With what contempt he wore the humble weed;
    How in his suit he scorn'd you; but your loves,
    Thinking upon his services, took from you
    Th' apprehension of his present portance,
    Which, most gibingly, ungravely, he did fashion
    After the inveterate hate he bears you.
 Say you ne'er had done't-
    Harp on that still- but by our putting on;
    And presently, when you have drawn your number,
    Repair to th' Capitol.
 will will so; almost all
    Repent in their election.
 To th' Capitol, come.
 Enter CORIOLANUS, MENENIUS, all the GENTRY, COMINIUS,
TITUS LARTIUS, and other SENATORS

  CORIOLANUS.

  CORIOLANUS.
 I wish I had a cause to seek him there,
    To oppose his hatred fully.
 Welcome home.
 Pass no further.
 What makes this change?  
  MENENIUS.
 Have I had children's voices?
  FIRST SENATOR.
 Tribunes, give way: he shall to th' market-place.

  BRUTUS.
 I say again,
    In soothing them we nourish 'gainst our Senate
    The cockle of rebellion, insolence, sedition,
    Which we ourselves have plough'd for, sow'd, and scatter'd,
    By mingling them with us, the honour'd number,
    Who lack not virtue, no, nor power, but that
    Which they have given to beggars.
 Shall remain!  
    Hear you this Triton of the minnows? Mark you
    His absolute 'shall'?
  COMINIUS.
 'Shall'!
    O good but most unwise patricians! Why,
    You grave but reckless senators, have you thus
    Given Hydra here to choose an officer
    That with his peremptory 'shall,' being but
    The horn and noise o' th' monster's, wants not spirit
    To say he'll turn your current in a ditch,
    And make your channel his? If he have power,
    Then vail your ignorance; if none, awake
    Your dangerous lenity.
 You are plebeians,
    If they be senators; and they are no less,
    When, both your voices blended, the great'st taste
    Most palates theirs.
 Well, on to th' market-place.

  CORIOLANUS.

  BRUTUS.
 They know the corn
    Was not our recompense, resting well assur'd
    They ne'er did service for't; being press'd to th' war  
    Even when the navel of the state was touch'd,
    They would not thread the gates.

  MENENIUS.

  CORIOLANUS.

  SICINIUS.
 Has spoken like a traitor and shall answer
    As traitors do.

  CORIOLANUS.
 This a consul? No.
 Obey, I charge thee,
    And follow to thine answer.

  SICINIUS.
 Hear me, people; peace!
  PLEBEIANS.

  SICINIUS.

  MENENIUS.

  BRUTUS.
 That is the way to lay the city flat,
    To bring the roof to the foundation,
    And bury all which yet distinctly ranges
    In heaps and piles of ruin.
 Therefore lay hold of him;
    Bear him to th' rock Tarpeian, and from thence
    Into destruction cast him.

  MENENIUS.

  AEDILES.
 Lay hands upon him
    And bear him to the rock.

                                    [CORIOLANUS draws his sword]
  CORIOLANUS.
 Down with him, down with him!
                      [In this mutiny the TRIBUNES, the AEDILES,
                                     and the people are beat in]
  MENENIUS.
 Go, get you to your house; be gone, away.

  COMINIUS.

  CORIOLANUS.

  COMINIUS.
 This man has marr'd his fortune.
 His nature is too noble for the world:
    He would not flatter Neptune for his trident,
    Or Jove for's power to thunder.
                 [A noise within]
    Here's goodly work!
  PATRICIANS.

  MENENIUS.
 Where is this viper
    That would depopulate the city and
    Be every man himself?
  MENENIUS.
 Peace!
  MENENIUS.
 Do not cry havoc, where you should but hunt  
    With modest warrant.

    As I do know the consul's worthiness,
    So can I name his faults.
 He consul!
  PLEBEIANS.
 Now the good gods forbid
    That our renowned Rome, whose gratitude
    Towards her deserved children is enroll'd
    In Jove's own book, like an unnatural dam
    Should now eat up her own!
  SICINIUS.
 He's a disease that must be cut away.
 The service of the foot,
    Being once gangren'd, is not then respected  
    For what before it was.
 If it were so-
  SICINIUS.

  MENENIUS.

  FIRST PATRICIAN.

  CORIOLANUS.

  VOLUMNIA.
 O, sir, sir, sir,
    I would have had you put your power well on
    Before you had worn it out.


                    Enter MENENIUS with the SENATORS

  MENENIUS.

  VOLUMNIA.

    I would dissemble with my nature where
    My fortunes and my friends at stake requir'd
    I should do so in honour.

  MENENIUS.

  MENENIUS.

  MENENIUS.
 He must and will.

  CORIOLANUS.

    To beg of thee, it is my more dishonour  
    Than thou of them.
 Come all to ruin.
 Let
    Thy mother rather feel thy pride than fear
    Thy dangerous stoutness; for I mock at death
    With as big heart as thou.
 Do as thou list.
 I'll return consul,
    Or never trust to what my tongue can do
    I' th' way of flattery further.

  VOLUMNIA.
 Arm yourself
    To answer mildly; for they are prepar'd
    With accusations, as I hear, more strong
    Than are upon you yet.

  CORIOLANUS.
 Ay, but mildly.
 Well, mildly be it then- mildly.
 I have; 'tis ready.
  
  SICINIUS.
 Very well.

  BRUTUS.
AEDILE,with the plebeians
  
  SICINIUS.

  BOTH TRIBUNES.
 Shall I be charg'd no further than this present?
    Must all determine here?
  SICINIUS.
 I am content.
 Scratches with briers,
    Scars to move laughter only.
 Consider further,
    That when he speaks not like a citizen,  
    You find him like a soldier; do not take
    His rougher accents for malicious sounds,
    But, as I say, such as become a soldier
    Rather than envy you.

  CORIOLANUS.

  CORIOLANUS.
 Say then; 'tis true, I ought so.
 Mark you this, people?
  PLEBEIANS.
 You!
  MENENIUS.
 Is this the promise that you made your mother?  
  COMINIUS.
 Then if I would
    Speak that-
  SICINIUS.

  PLEBEIANS.
 The people's enemy is gone, is gone!
                        [They all shout and throw up their caps]
  PLEBEIANS.
 Go see him out at gates, and follow him,  
    As he hath follow'd you, with all despite;
    Give him deserv'd vexation.
 Let a guard
    Attend us through the city.
 Before a gate of the city

Enter CORIOLANUS, VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, MENENIUS, COMINIUS,
with the young NOBILITY of Rome

  CORIOLANUS.
 The beast
    With many heads butts me away.

  VIRGILIA.
 O heavens! O heavens!
  CORIOLANUS.

    I'll do well yet.

  VIRGILIA.
 Fare ye well;
    Thou hast years upon thee, and thou art too full
    Of the wars' surfeits to go rove with one
    That's yet unbruis'd; bring me but out at gate.

    If I could shake off but one seven years
    From these old arms and legs, by the good gods,
    I'd with thee every foot.

    Come.
 A street near the gate

Enter the two Tribunes, SICINIUS and BRUTUS with the AEDILE

  SICINIUS.
 Now we have shown our power,
    Let us seem humbler after it is done
    Than when it was a-doing.

  BRUTUS.
 They say she's mad.

  VOLUMNIA.
 If that I could for weeping, you should hear-
    Nay, and you shall hear some.

  SICINIUS.
 Bastards and all.

  VOLUMNIA.
 Well, well, we'll leave you.

  SICINIUS.
 Take my prayers with you.

  MENENIUS.
 You have told them home,
    And, by my troth, you have cause.
 You'll sup with me?
  VOLUMNIA.

                                    Exeunt VOLUMNIA and VIRGILIA
  MENENIUS.

A highway between Rome and Antium

Enter a ROMAN and a VOLSCE, meeting

  ROMAN.

  VOLSCE.
 It is so, sir.
 I am a Roman; and my services are, as you are, against 'em.
 There hath been in Rome strange insurrections: the people
    against the senators, patricians, and nobles.
 Hath been! Is it ended, then? Our state thinks not so; they
    are in a most warlike preparation, and hope to come upon them in
    the heat of their division.

  VOLSCE.

  ROMAN.
 The day serves well for them now.
 I am most fortunate thus accidentally to
    encounter you; you have ended my business, and I will merrily
    accompany you home.
 A most royal one: the centurions and their charges,  
    distinctly billeted, already in th' entertainment, and to be on
    foot at an hour's warning.

  ROMAN.
 I have the most cause to be
    glad of yours.
 Well, let us go together.
 A goodly city is this Antium.
 City,
    'Tis I that made thy widows: many an heir
    Of these fair edifices fore my wars
    Have I heard groan and drop.


                           Enter A CITIZEN

    Save you, sir.
 Which is his house, beseech you?
  CITIZEN.
 Thank you, sir; farewell.
 I'll enter.

Antium.
 Wine, wine, wine! What service is here! I think our
    fellows are asleep.

    Cotus!                                                  Exit

                       Enter CORIOLANUS

  CORIOLANUS.
 The feast smells well, but I
    Appear not like a guest.


                 Re-enter the first SERVINGMAN

  FIRST SERVANT.
  
 Exit
  CORIOLANUS.

  CORIOLANUS.
 Now th' art troublesome.
 A strange one as ever I look'd on.
 True, so I am.
 Follow your function, go and batten on cold bits.

                                      [Pushes him away from him]
  THIRD SERVANT.
 And I shall.
 Under the canopy.

  THIRD SERVANT.
 I' th' city of kites and crows.

  THIRD SERVANT.

  AUFIDIUS.
 A name unmusical to the Volscians' ears,
    And harsh in sound to thine.
 Prepare thy brow to frown- know'st thou me yet?
  AUFIDIUS.
 The painful service,
    The extreme dangers, and the drops of blood
    Shed for my thankless country, are requited
    But with that surname- a good memory
    And witness of the malice and displeasure
    Which thou shouldst bear me.
 But if so be
    Thou dar'st not this, and that to prove more fortunes
    Th'art tir'd, then, in a word, I also am
    Longer to live most weary, and present
    My throat to thee and to thy ancient malice;
    Which not to cut would show thee but a fool,
    Since I have ever followed thee with hate,  
    Drawn tuns of blood out of thy country's breast,
    And cannot live but to thy shame, unless
    It be to do thee service.
 If Jupiter
    Should from yond cloud speak divine things,
    And say ''Tis true,' I'd not believe them more
    Than thee, all noble Marcius.
 O, come, go in,
    And take our friendly senators by th' hands,
    Who now are here, taking their leaves of me
    Who am prepar'd against your territories,
    Though not for Rome itself.

  CORIOLANUS.
 absolute sir, if thou wilt have  
    The leading of thine own revenges, take
    Th' one half of my commission, and set down-
    As best thou art experienc'd, since thou know'st
    Thy country's strength and weakness- thine own ways,
    Whether to knock against the gates of Rome,
    Or rudely visit them in parts remote
    To fright them ere destroy.
 But come in;
    Let me commend thee first to those that shall
    Say yea to thy desires.
 By my hand, I had thought to have strucken him with
    a cudgel; and yet my mind gave me his clothes made a false report
    of him.

  SECOND SERVANT.
 He is simply the rarest
    man i' th' world.

  FIRST SERVANT.
 Why do you say 'thwack our general'?
  THIRD SERVANT.
 He was ever too
    hard for him, I have heard him say so himself.

  FIRST SERVANT.

    But the bottom of the news is, our general is cut i' th' middle
    and but one half of what he was yesterday, for the other has half
    by the entreaty and grant of the whole table.
 He'll go, he says,
    and sowl the porter of Rome gates by th' ears; he will mow all
    down before him, and leave his passage poll'd.
 But when goes this forward?
  THIRD SERVANT.

    This peace is nothing but to rust iron, increase tailors, and
    breed ballad-makers.
 Let me have war, say I; it exceeds peace as far as
    day does night; it's spritely, waking, audible, and full of vent.

  THIRD SERVANT.
 I hope to see Romans as cheap as Volscians.

    His remedies are tame.
