    And prais'd be rashness for it; let us know,
    Our indiscretion sometime serves us well
    When our deep plots do pall; and that should learn us
    There's a divinity that shapes our ends,
    Rough-hew them how we will-
  Hor.
 Up from my cabin,
    My sea-gown scarf'd about me, in the dark
    Grop'd I to find out them; had my desire,
    Finger'd their packet, and in fine withdrew
    To mine own room again; making so bold  
    (My fears forgetting manners) to unseal
    Their grand commission; where I found, Horatio
    (O royal knavery!), an exact command,
    Larded with many several sorts of reasons,
    Importing Denmark's health, and England's too,
    With, hoo! such bugs and goblins in my life-
    That, on the supervise, no leisure bated,
    No, not to stay the finding of the axe,
    My head should be struck off.

  Hor.

  Ham.

  Hor.
 How was this seal'd?
  Ham.
 Why, what a king is this!
  Ham.
 I humbly thank you, sir.
 [Aside to Horatio] Dost know this
    waterfly?
  Hor.
 'Tis
    a chough; but, as I say, spacious in the possession of dirt.
  
  Osr.
 But yet methinks it is very sultry and hot for my complexion.
 Sir, this is the matter-
  Ham.

                           [Hamlet moves him to put on his hat.
]
  Osr.
 Nay, good my lord; for mine ease, in good faith.

  Ham.

    But, in the verity of extolment, I take him to be a soul of great
    article, and his infusion of such dearth and rareness as, to make
    true diction of him, his semblable is his mirror, and who else
    would trace him, his umbrage, nothing more.
 All's golden words are
    spent.
 Well, sir?  
  Osr.

  Ham.
 That's two of his weapons- but well.

  Osr.
 The King, sir, hath laid that, in a dozen passes between
    yourself and him, he shall not exceed you three hits; he hath
    laid on twelve for nine, and it would come to immediate trial
    if your lordship would vouchsafe the answer.

  Ham.
 Shall I redeliver you e'en so?
  Ham.
] He does well to commend it
    himself; there are no tongues else for's turn.

  Hor.
 My lord, his Majesty commended him to you by young Osric, who
    brings back to him, that you attend him in the hall.
]
  Hor.

  Hor.
 Not a whit, we defy augury; there's a special providence in
    the fall of a sparrow.
 Since no man knows aught of what he leaves,
    what is't to leave betimes? Let be.
 Come, Hamlet, come, and take this hand from me.
 I have done you wrong;
    But pardon't, as you are a gentleman.

    This presence knows,
    And you must needs have heard, how I am punish'd
    With sore distraction.
 What I have done
    That might your nature, honour, and exception
    Roughly awake, I here proclaim was madness.
 If't be so,
    Hamlet is of the faction that is wrong'd;
    His madness is poor Hamlet's enemy.

    Sir, in this audience,
    Let my disclaiming from a purpos'd evil
    Free me so far in your most generous thoughts  
    That I have shot my arrow o'er the house
    And hurt my brother.

  Ham.

    Give us the foils.

  Laer.
 Cousin Hamlet,
    You know the wager?
  Ham.

  King.
 I do not fear it, I have seen you both;
    But since he is better'd, we have therefore odds.

  Laer.

  Ham.
 No.
 Judgment!
  Osr.
 Well, again!
  King.
 Hamlet, this pearl is thine;
    Here's to thy health.
 What say you?
  Laer.
  
    The Queen carouses to thy fortune, Hamlet.
 Good madam!
  King.

  Ham.
 Come, let me wipe thy face.
 I do not think't.

  Laer.
 [aside] And yet it is almost against my conscience.
                               Play.

  Osr.

  Ham.
 Look to the Queen there, ho!
  Hor.

    I am justly kill'd with mine own treachery.

  Queen.
]
  Ham.
 O villany! Ho! let the door be lock'd.

    The treacherous instrument is in thy hand,
    Unbated and envenom'd.
 Lo, here I lie,
    Never to rise again.

    I can no more.
 Treason! treason!
  King.

  Ham.

  Laer.

    Exchange forgiveness with me, noble Hamlet.
 Let go! By heaven, I'll ha't.

    O good Horatio, what a wounded name
    (Things standing thus unknown) shall live behind me!
    If thou didst ever hold me in thy heart,
    Absent thee from felicity awhile,
    And in this harsh world draw thy breath in pain,
    To tell my story.
 Young Fortinbras, with conquest come from Poland,
    To the ambassadors of England gives
    This warlike volley.

    So tell him, with th' occurrents, more and less,
    Which have solicited- the rest is silence.
 Good night, sweet prince,
    And flights of angels sing thee to thy rest!
                                                 [March within.


  Fort.
 O proud Death,
    What feast is toward in thine eternal cell
    That thou so many princes at a shot
    So bloodily hast struck.

  Fort.
 Let us haste to hear it,  
    And call the noblest to the audience.

  Hor.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.

  Earl of Westmoreland.

  Thomas Percy, Earl of Worcester.

  Richard Scroop, Archbishop of York.

  Sir Richard Vernon.

  Gadshill
  Peto.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.
 So shaken as we are, so wan with care,
    Find we a time for frighted peace to pant
    And breathe short-winded accents of new broils
    To be commenc'd in stronds afar remote.

    No more the thirsty entrance of this soil
    Shall daub her lips with her own children's blood.
 Those opposed eyes
    Which, like the meteors of a troubled heaven,
    All of one nature, of one substance bred,
    Did lately meet in the intestine shock
    And furious close of civil butchery,
    Shall now in mutual well-beseeming ranks
    March all one way and be no more oppos'd
    Against acquaintance, kindred, and allies.
 Then let me hear
    Of you, my gentle cousin Westmoreland,
    What yesternight our Council did decree
    In forwarding this dear expedience.
 This, match'd with other, did, my gracious lord;
    For more uneven and unwelcome news
    Came from the North, and thus it did import:
    On Holy-rood Day the gallant Hotspur there,
    Young Harry Percy, and brave Archibald,
    That ever-valiant and approved Scot,
    At Holmedon met,
    Where they did spend a sad and bloody hour;  
    As by discharge of their artillery
    And shape of likelihood the news was told;
    For he that brought them, in the very heat
    And pride of their contention did take horse,
    Uncertain of the issue any way.

  King.

    But let him from my thoughts.

  West.
                                 Exeunt.


Enter Prince of Wales and Sir John Falstaff.
 What, none?
  Fal.
 No, by my troth; not so much as will serve to be prologue to  
    an egg and butter.
 As the honey of Hybla, my old lad of the castle- and is not
    a buff jerkin a most sweet robe of durance?  
  Fal.
 How now, how now, mad wag? What, in thy quips and thy
    quiddities? What a plague have I to do with a buff jerkin?
  Prince.

  Fal.

  Prince.
 No; thou shalt.
 Or an old lion, or a lover's lute.
 Zounds, where thou wilt, lad! I'll make one.

  Fal.


                             Enter Poins.


    Poins! Now shall we know if Gadshill have set a match.
 Good morrow, Ned.
 Sir John stands to his word, the devil shall have his
    bargain; for he was never yet a breaker of proverbs.
 Else he had been damn'd for cozening the devil.
 But, my lads, my lads, to-morrow morning, by four o'clock
    early, at Gadshill! There are pilgrims gong to Canterbury with
    rich offerings, and traders riding to London with fat purses.

  Prince.

  Fal.
 I will
    lay him down such reasons for this adventure that he shall go.

  Fal.

  Prince.

  Poins.

  Poins.
 There I'll sup.
 Farewell, my lord.

  Prince.

    If all the year were playing holidays,
    To sport would be as tedious as to work;
    But when they seldom come, they wish'd-for come,
    And nothing pleaseth but rare accidents.

London.
 The Palace.
 My blood hath been too cold and temperate,
    Unapt to stir at these indignities,
    And you have found me, for accordingly
    You tread upon my patience; but be sure
    I will from henceforth rather be myself,
    Mighty and to be fear'd, than my condition,
    Which hath been smooth as oil, soft as young down,
    And therefore lost that title of respect
    Which the proud soul ne'er pays but to the proud.
 My lord-
  King.
  
    O, sir, your presence is too bold and peremptory,
    And majesty might never yet endure
    The moody frontier of a servant brow.

    Tou have good leave to leave us.

    But I remember, when the fight was done,
    When I was dry with rage and extreme toll,
    Breathless and faint, leaning upon my sword,
    Came there a certain lord, neat and trimly dress'd,
    Fresh as a bridegroom; and his chin new reap'd  
    Show'd like a stubble land at harvest home.

    With many holiday and lady terms
    He questioned me, amongst the rest demanded
    My prisoners in your Majesty's behalf.

  King.

  Hot.
 Revolted Mortimer?
    He never did fall off, my sovereign liege,  
    But by the chance of war.

    Here comes your uncle.


                          Enter Worcester.
 Who struck this heat up after I was gone?
  Hot.
 Was not he proclaim'd
    By Richard that dead is, the next of blood?
  North.
 But soft, I pray you.
 I cry you mercy.
 Those same noble Scots
    That are your prisoners-
  Hot.
 Hear you, cousin, a word.
 All studies here I solemnly defy
    Save how to gall and pinch this Bolingbroke;
    And that same sword-and-buckler Prince of Wales-
    But that I think his father loves him not
    And would be glad he met with some mischance,
    I would have him poisoned with a pot of ale.

  Wor.

    In Richard's time- what do you call the place-
    A plague upon it! it is in GIoucestershire-  
    'Twas where the madcap Duke his uncle kept-
    His uncle York- where I first bow'd my knee
    Unto this king of smiles, this Bolingbroke-
    'S blood!
    When you and he came back from Ravenspurgh-
  North.
 [To Northumberland] You, my lord,
    Your son in Scotland being thus employ'd,
    Shall secretly into the bosom creep
    Of that same noble prelate well-belov'd,
    The Archbishop.

  Hot.
 Of York, is it not?
  Wor.
 Upon my life, it will do well.
 Why, it cannot choose but be a noble plot.
 And so they shall.
  
  Hot.
 No further go in this
    Than I by letters shall direct your course.

    When time is ripe, which will be suddenly,
    I'll steal to Glendower and Lord Mortimer,
    Where you and Douglas, and our pow'rs at once,
    As I will fashion it, shall happily meet,
    To bear our fortunes in our own strong arms,
    Which now we hold at much uncertainty.

  North.
 An inn yard.


  2.

  2.
 I think it be two o'clock.

  Gads.

  1.
 I pray thee lend me thine.
 Car.
 That's even as fair as- 'at hand, quoth the chamberlain'; for
    thou variest no more from picking of purses than giving direction
    doth from labouring: thou layest the plot how.
 I heard him tell it
    to one of his company last night at supper- a kind of auditor;  
    one that hath abundance of charge too, God knows what.

  Cham.
 I pray thee keep that for the hangman;
    for I know thou worshippest Saint Nicholas as truly as a man of
    falsehood may.
 What talkest thou to me of the hangman? If I hang, I'll make
    a fat pair of gallows; for if I hang, old Sir John hangs with me,
    and thou knowest he is no starveling.
 What, the commonwealth their boots? Will she hold out water
    in foul way?
  Gads.
 We steal as in
    a castle, cocksure.

  Cham.
 Nay, by my faith, I think you are more beholding to the night
    than to fernseed for your walking invisible.

  Gads.
 Give me thy hand.

  Gads.
 Go to; 'homo' is a common name to all men.
 Bid the ostler
    bring my gelding out of the stable.


  Poins.


  Fal.
 Poins! Poins, and be hang'd! Poins!
  Prince.
 I'll go seek him.

                                                  [Steps aside.
 If I travel but
    four foot by the squire further afoot, I shall break my wind.
 I have forsworn his company  
    hourly any time this two-and-twenty years, and yet I am bewitch'd
    with the rogue's company.
 If the rascal have not given me
    medicines to make me love him, I'll be hang'd.
 It could not be
    else.
 Eight yards of uneven ground is threescore and ten miles
    afoot with me, and the stony-hearted villains know it well
    enough.
 [comes forward] Peace, ye fat-guts! Lie down, lay thine ear
    close to the ground, and list if thou canst hear the tread of
    travellers.
 Have you any levers to lift me up again, being down? 'Sblood,
    I'll not bear mine own flesh so far afoot again for all the coin
    in thy father's exchequer.
 What a plague mean ye to colt me thus?
  Prince.
 Go hang thyself in thine own heir-apparent garters! If I be
    ta'en, I'll peach for this.


             Enter Gadshill, [Bardolph and Peto with him].

  Poins.
 [comes fortward] O, 'tis our setter.
 I know his voice.

  Gads.
 There's enough to make us all.

  Fal.
 To be hang'd.

  Prince.

  Peto.
 Zounds, will they not rob us?
  Prince.
 Stand close.


  Traveller.
 You are grandjurors, are ye? We'll jure ye,
    faith!
                            Here they rob and bind them.


            Enter the Prince and Poins [in buckram suits].

  Poins.


  Fal.
 Villains!

  Prince.
 Now merrily to horse.
 Falstaff sweats to death
    And lards the lean earth as he walks along.





Scene III.
 'But, for mine own part, my lord, I could be well contented to
    be there, in respect of the love I bear your house.
' Say you so, say you so?
    I say unto you again, you are a shallow, cowardly hind, and you
    lie.
 Is there not my father, my uncle, and
    myself; Lord Edmund Mortimer, my Lord of York, and Owen
    Glendower? Is there not, besides, the Douglas? Have I not all
    their letters to meet me in arms by the ninth of the next month,
    and are they not some of them set forward already? What a pagan
    rascal is this! an infidel! Ha! you shall see now, in very
    sincerity of fear and cold heart will he to the King and lay open
    all our proceedings.
 O, I could divide myself and go to buffets
    for moving such a dish of skim milk with so honourable an action!
    Hang him, let him tell the King! we are prepared.

  Lady.

    Thy spirit within thee hath been so at war,
    And thus hath so bestirr'd thee in thy sleep,
    That beads of sweat have stood upon thy brow
    Like bubbles ill a late-disturbed stream,
    And in thy face strange motions have appear'd,  
    Such as we see when men restrain their breath
    On some great sudden hest.
 O, what portents are these?
    Some heavy business hath my lord in hand,
    And I must know it, else he loves me not.
 What, ho!

                    [Enter a Servant.

  Hot.
 What horse? A roan, a crop-ear, is it not?
  Serv.
 It is, my lord.
 O esperance!
    Bid Butler lead him forth into the park.

                                                 [Exit Servant.
 What is it carries you away?
  Hot.
 Why, my horse, my love- my horse!
  Lady.
 Out, you mad-headed ape!
    A weasel hath not such a deal of spleen
    As you are toss'd with.

  Lady.

    Away, you trifler! Love? I love thee not;
    I care not for thee, Kate.

  Hot.
 How? so far?
  Hot.
 Not an inch further.
                                Exeunt.


Enter Prince and Poins.

  Poins.
 Francis!                                  [Exit Poins.

  Fran.
 Forsooth, five years, and as much as to-
  Poins.
 [within] Francis!
  Fran.
 O Lord, sir, I'll be sworn upon all the books in England I
    could find in my heart-
  Poins.
 [within] Francis!
  Fran.
 Anon, sir.

  Prince.
 How old art thou, Francis?
  Fran.
 Ask me when thou
    wilt, and, thou shalt have it.
 [within] Francis!
  Fran.
 Anon, Francis? No, Francis; but to-morrow, Francis; or,
    Francis, a Thursday; or indeed, Francis, when thou wilt.
 In Barbary,
    sir, it cannot come to so much.
 What, sir?
  Poins.
 The Drawer stands amazed,
                                    not knowing which way to go.


                         Enter Vintner.
 Let them alone awhile, and then open the door.
 Shall we be merry?
  Poins.
 I am now of all humours that have showed themselves humours
    since the old days of goodman Adam to the pupil age of this
    present this twelve o'clock at midnight.
                                 [Exit.
 Call in ribs, call
    in tallow.
 Welcome, Jack.
 Where hast thou been?
  Fal.
 Ere I lead this life long, I'll
    sew nether-stocks, and mend them and foot them too.
 A
    plague of all cowards I say still!
  Prince.
 A king's son! If I do not beat thee out of thy kingdom with a
    dagger of lath and drive all thy subjects afore thee like a flock
    of wild geese, I'll never wear hair on my face more.
 Are not you a coward? Answer me to that- and Poins there?
  Poins.

  Fal.
 O villain! thy lips are scarce wip'd since thou drunk'st
    last.
 All is one for that.
) A plague of all cowards
    still say I.
 Where is it, Taken from us it is.
 What, a hundred, man?
  Fal.
 How was it?
  Gads.

  Fal.
 What, fought you with them all?
  Fal.
 All? I know not what you call all, but if I fought not with
    fifty of them, I am a bunch of radish! If there were not two or
    three and fifty upon poor old Jack, then am I no two-legg'd
    creature.
 Nay, that's past praying for.
 I tell thee
    what, Hal- if I tell thee a lie, spit in my face, call me horse.

    Thou knowest my old ward.

    Four rogues in buckram let drive at me.
 I made me
    no more ado but took all their seven points in my target, thus.

  Prince.
 Seven, by these hilts, or I am a villain else.
 Dost thou hear me, Hal?
  Prince.
 So, two more already.

  Fal.
 These lies are like their father that begets them- gross as
    a mountain, open, palpable.
 Come, your reason, Jack, your reason.
 What, upon compulsion? Zounds, an I were at the strappado or
    all the racks in the world, I would not tell you on compulsion.

  Prince.
 'Sblood, you starveling, you elf-skin, you dried
    neat's-tongue, you bull's sizzle, you stockfish- O for breath to
    utter what is like thee!- you tailor's yard, you sheath, you
    bowcase, you vile standing tuck!
  Prince.
 I was now a coward on
    instinct.
 O Jesu, my lord the Prince!
  Prince.
 Give him as much as will make him a royal man, and send him
    back again to my mother.

  Fal.
 Faith, I ran when I saw others run.
 O villain! thou stolest a cup of sack eighteen years ago
    and wert taken with the manner, and ever since thou hast blush'd
    extempore.
 I do.
  
  Bard.
 Choler, my lord, if rightly taken.

  Prince.
 That same mad fellow of the North, Percy, and he of
    Wales that gave Amamon the bastinado, and made Lucifer cuckold,
    and swore the devil his true liegeman upon the cross of a Welsh
    hook- what a plague call you him?
  Poins.
 You have hit it.
 Yes, Jack, upon instinct.

  Fal.

  Prince.
 Well, here is my leg.

  Host.
 Weep not, sweet queen, for trickling tears are vain.
 O, the Father, how he holds his countenance!
  Fal.
 O Jesu, he doth it as like one of these harlotry players as
    ever I see!
  Fal.
 That thou art my son I have partly thy mother's
    word, partly my own opinion, but chiefly a villanous trick of
    thine eye and a foolish hanging of thy nether lip that doth
    warrant me.
 Shall the son of England prove a thief and take purses? A
    question to be ask'd.
 What manner of man, an it like your Majesty?
  Fal.
 My noble lord, from Eastcheap.
 The complaints I hear of thee are grievous.
 Swearest thou, ungracious boy? Henceforth ne'er look on me.
 I would your Grace would take me with you.

  Prince.

  Fal.
 That he is old (the more the pity) his white
    hairs do witness it; but that he is (saving your reverence) a
    whoremaster, that I utterly deny.
 O, my lord, my lord! the sheriff with a most monstrous watch
    is at the door.
 Out, ye rogue! Play out the play.

  Fal.
 I deny your major.
 If you will deny the sheriff, so; if not,
    let him enter.
 Call in the sheriff.

                            [Exeunt Manent the Prince and Peto.
 If he have robb'd these men,
    He shall be answerable; and so farewell.
 Good night, my noble lord.

                                            Exit [with Carrier].
 Go call him
    forth.
 .
 .
 .
 .
 .
 viii d.
 .
 I'll to
    the court in the morning .
 Be with me betimes
    in the morning, and so good morrow, Peto.
 These promises are fair, the parties sure,
    And our induction full of prosperous hope.

  Hot.
 Lord Mortimer, and cousin Glendower,
    Will you sit down?
    And uncle Worcester.

  Glend.
 I cannot blame him.
 At my nativity
    The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes
    Of burning cressets, and at my birth
    The frame and huge foundation of the earth  
    Shak'd like a coward.

  Hot.
 I say the earth did shake when I was born.

  Glend.

    These signs have mark'd me extraordinary,
    And all the courses of my life do show
    I am not in the roll of common men.
 Why, I can teach you, cousin, to command the devil.
 And I can teach thee, coz, to shame the devil-
    By telling truth.

    If thou have power to raise him, bring him hither,
    And I'll be sworn I have power to shame him hence.

  Glend.
 Home without boots, and in foul weather too?
    How scapes he agues, in the devil's name
  Glend.
 Shall we divide our right
    According to our threefold order ta'en?
  Mort.

    And our indentures tripartite are drawn;
    Which being sealed interchangeably
    (A business that this night may execute),
    To-morrow, cousin Percy, you and I
    And my good Lord of Worcester will set forth
    To meet your father and the Scottish bower,
    As is appointed us, at Shrewsbury.

    [To Glend.

  Glend.

  Glend.
 Not wind? It shall, it must! You see it doth.

  Mort.

  Glend.
 I can speak English, lord, as well as you;
    For I was train'd up in the English court,
    Where, being but young, I framed to the harp
    Many an English ditty lovely well,
    And gave the tongue a helpful ornament-
    A virtue that was never seen in you.
 Marry,
    And I am glad of it with all my heart!
    I had rather be a kitten and cry mew
    Than one of these same metre ballet-mongers.
 I had rather live
    With cheese and garlic in a windmill far
    Than feed on cates and have him talk to me
    In any summer house in Christendom).
 In faith, he is a worthy gentleman,
    Exceedingly well read, and profited
    In strange concealments, valiant as a lion,
    And wondrous affable, and as bountiful
    As mines of India.
 Faith, he does.

    But I will never be a truant, love,
    Till I have learnt thy language: for thy tongue
    Makes Welsh as sweet as ditties highly penn'd,
    Sung by a fair queen in a summer's bow'r,  
    With ravishing division, to her lute.

  Lady P.
 Go, ye giddy goose.

                                                The music plays.

  Lady P.

  Lady P.
 No.

  Lady P.
 To the Welsh lady's bed.
 Peace! she sings.

                               Here the Lady sings a Welsh song.

    Swear me, Kate, like a lady as thou art,
    A good mouth-filling oath; and leave 'in sooth'
    And such protest of pepper gingerbread
    To velvet guards and Sunday citizens.
 I will not sing.
 'Tis the next way to turn tailor or be redbreast-teacher.
 You are as slow
    As hot Lord Percy is on fire to go.

  Mort.

                                                         Exeunt.


  King.
 Lords, give us leave.

    Yet such extenuation let me beg
    As, in reproof of many tales devis'd,
    Which oft the ear of greatness needs must bear
    By, smiling pickthanks and base newsmongers,
    I may, for some things true wherein my youth
    Hath faulty wand'red and irregular,
    And pardon on lily true submission.

  King.
 God pardon thee! Yet let me wonder, Harry,
    At thy affections, which do hold a wing,
    Quite from the flight of all thy ancestors.

    By being seldom seen, I could not stir
    But, like a comet, I Was wond'red at;
    That men would tell their children, 'This is he!'
    Others would say, 'Where? Which is Bolingbroke?'
    And then I stole all courtesy from heaven,
    And dress'd myself in such humility
    That I did pluck allegiance from men's hearts,
    Loud shouts and salutations from their mouths
    Even in the presence of the crowned King.

    The skipping King, he ambled up and down
    With shallow jesters and rash bavin wits,
    Soon kindled and soon burnt; carded his state;
    Mingled his royalty with cap'ring fools;
    Had his great name profaned with their scorns
    And gave his countenance, against his name,
    To laugh at gibing boys and stand the push
    Of every beardless vain comparative;
    Grew a companion to the common streets,
    Enfeoff'd himself to popularity;
    That, being dally swallowed by men's eyes,
    They surfeited with honey and began
    To loathe the taste of sweetness, whereof a little
    More than a little is by much too much.

    Thrice hath this Hotspur, Mars in swathling clothes,
    This infant warrior, in his enterprises
    Discomfited great Douglas; ta'en him once,
    Enlarged him, and made a friend of him,  
    To fill the mouth of deep defiance up
    And shake the peace and safety of our throne.


    How now, good Blunt? Thy looks are full of speed.





Scene III.

  Bard.
 Thou art our
    admiral, thou bearest the lantern in the poop- but 'tis in the
    nose of thee.

  Fal.
 God reward me for
    it!
  Bard.
 Ye lie, hostess.
 He had his part of it; let him pay.

  Fal.
 How? the Prince is a Jack, a sneak-cup.


      Enter the Prince [and Poins], marching; and Falstaff meets
          them, playing upon his truncheon like a fife.
 Yea, two and two, Newgate fashion.

  Fal.
 The other night I fell asleep here behind the arras and had my
    pocket pick'd.

  Prince.
  
  Prince.
 There's neither faith, truth, nor womanhood in me else.

  Fal.

  Host.

  Fal.
 Setting thy womanhood aside, thou art a beast to say
    otherwise.

  Host.
 Say, what beast, thou knave, thou?
  Fal.
 What beast? Why, an otter.

  Prince.
 Why, she's neither fish nor flesh; a man knows not where to
    have her.
 So he doth you, my lord, and said this other day you ought
    him a thousand pound.

  Prince.

  Prince.
 It is all fill'd up with guts and midriff.
 Hostess, I forgive thee.
 [Exit Hostess.
] Now, Hal, to the
    news at court.

    The money is paid back again.

  Prince.

  Prince.
 My lord?
  Prince.





<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.

The rebel camp near Shrewsbury.


  Hot.

    Nay, task me to my word; approve me, lord.
 Thou art the king of honour.

  Hot.
 Letters from him? Why comes he not himself?
  Mess.

  Hot.
 He did, my lord, four days ere I set forth,
    And at the time of my departure thence
    He was much fear'd by his physicians.
 I would the state of time had first been whole
    Ere he by sickness had been visited.
 Sick now? droop now? This sickness doth infect
    The very lifeblood of our enterprise.
 Your father's sickness is a maim to us.

  Hot.
 Were it good
    To set the exact wealth of all our states
    All at one cast? to set so rich a man
    On the nice hazard of one doubtful hour?
    It were not good; for therein should we read
    The very bottom and the soul of hope,
    The very list, the very utmost bound
    Of all our fortunes.

  Doug.
 But yet I would your father had been here.

  Hot.
 Pray God my news be worth a welcome, lord.
 No more, no more! Worse than the sun in March,
    This praise doth nourish agues.

    Harry to Harry shall, hot horse to horse,
    Meet, and ne'er part till one drop down a corse.

    that Glendower were come!
  Ver.
 Forty let it be.
 Die all, die merrily.


  Fal.

  Bard.
 Will you give me money, Captain?
  Fal.
 Lay out, lay out.

  Fal.
 A mad fellow met me
    on the way, and told me I had unloaded all the gibbets and
    press'd the dead bodies.
 I'll
    not march through Coventry with them, that's flat.
 Nay, and the
    villains march wide betwixt the legs, as if they had gyves on;
    for indeed I had the most of them out of prison.
 There's but a
    shirt and a half in all my company; and the half-shirt is two  
    napkins tack'd together and thrown over the shoulders like a
    herald's coat without sleeves; and the shirt, to say the truth,
    stol'n from my host at Saint Alban's, or the red-nose innkeeper
    of Daventry.


  Prince.
 Tut, tut! good enough to toss; food for powder, food for
    powder.
 Ay, but, Sir John, methinks they are exceeding poor and bare-
    too beggarly.
 No, I'll be sworn, unless you call three fingers on the
    ribs bare.
 Percy 's already in the
    field.
 I fear we shall stay too long.
                  Exit.


Enter Hotspur, Worcester, Douglas, Vernon.
 We'll fight with him to-night.

  Doug.
 You give him then advantage.
 Why say you so? Looks he no for supply?
  Ver.

  Wor.

  Hot.

  Wor.
  

                 Enter Sir Walter Blunt.

  Blunt.
 The King hath sent to know
    The nature of your griefs; and whereupon
    You conjure from the breast of civil peace
    Such bold hostility, teaching his duteous land
    Audacious cruelty.

    But.
  
  Blunt.

  Blunt.
 Pray God you do.

  Sir M.

  Arch.
 But there is Mordake, Vernon, Lord Harry Percy,
    And there is my Lord of Worcester, and a head
    Of gallant warriors, noble gentlemen.

  Arch.
 Doubt not, my lord, they shall be well oppos'd.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
>>



ACT V.

The King's camp near Shrewsbury.
 The southern wind
    Doth play the trumpet to his purposes
    And by his hollow whistling in the leaves
    Foretells a tempest and a blust'ring day.
 Theft with the losers let it sympathize,
    For nothing can seem foul to those that win.
 Enter Worcester [and Vernon].

    This is not well, my lord; this is not well.

    What say you to it? Will you again unknit
    This churlish knot of all-abhorred war,
    And move in that obedient orb again
    Where you did give a fair and natural light,
    And be no more an exhal'd meteor,
    A prodigy of fear, and a portent
    Of broached mischief to the unborn times?
  Wor.

  King.

    To this we swore our aid.

    And never yet did insurrection want
    Such water colours to impaint his cause,
    Nor moody beggars, starving for a time
    Of pell-mell havoc and confusion.
  
    For my part, I may speak it to my shame,
    I have a truant been to chivalry;
    And so I hear he doth account me too.
 No, good Worcester, no!
    We love our people well; even those we love
    That are misled upon your cousin's part;
    And, will they take the offer of our grace,
    Both he, and they, and you, yea, every man
    Shall be my friend again, and I'll be his.
 But if he will not yield,
    Rebuke and dread correction wait on us,
    And they shall do their office.
 It will not be accepted, on my life.

  Prince.

    Say thy prayers, and farewell.
 I would be loath to pay him before his day.
 Yea, but how if honour prick  
    me off when I come on? How then? Can honor set to a leg? No.
 Or take away the grief of a wound? No.
 A trim reckoning! Who hath it? He that died a
    Wednesday.
 Doth he feel it? No.
 Therefore I'll
    none of it.





Scene II.
 'Twere best he did.

    My nephew's trespass may be well forgot;  
    It hath the excuse of youth and heat of blood,
    And an adopted name of privilege-
    A hare-brained Hotspur govern'd by a spleen.

    Deliver up my Lord of Westmoreland.

  Doug.

Exit.
 Did you beg any, God forbid!
  Wor.

  Wor.
 Cousin, I think thou art enamoured
    Upon his follies.
 My lord, prepare.
 The King comes on apace.

Plain between the camps.

  Blunt.
 Where?
  Doug.
 This, Douglas? No.
 A fool go with thy soul, whither it goes!
    A borrowed title hast thou bought too dear:
    Why didst thou tell me that thou wert a king?
  Hot.
 I have led my
    rag-of-muffins where they are pepper'd.
 I have paid  
    Percy; I have made him sure.
 He is indeed, and living to kill thee.

  Prince.

  King.
 I will do so.

  West.


  Doug.
 I have two boys  
    Seek Percy and thyself about the field;
    But, seeing thou fall'st on me so luckily,
    I will assay thee.


   They fight.


  Prince.

  King.
 Stay and breathe awhile.
 Make up to Clifton; I'll to Sir Nicholas Gawsey.
 Thou speak'st as if I would deny my name.

  Hot.


  Fal.


   Enter Douglas.
 He fighteth with Falstaff, who falls down as if  
      he were dead.
 O Harry, thou hast robb'd me of my youth!
    I better brook the loss of brittle life
    Than those proud titles thou hast won of me.
]
  Prince.
 For worms, brave Percy.

    Embowell'd will I see thee by-and-by;
    Till then in blood by noble Percy lie.

  
  Fal.
 To die is to be a
    counterfeit; for he is but the counterfeit of a man who hath not
    the life of a man; but to counterfeit dying when a man thereby
    liveth, is to be no counterfeit, but the true and perfect image
    of life indeed.
 Why may not he rise as well as I?
    Nothing confutes me but eyes, and nobody sees me.


   He takes up Hotspur on his hack.
 Come, brother John; full bravely hast thou flesh'd
    Thy maiden sword.

  Prince.
 I'll take it
    upon my death, I gave him this wound in the thigh.

  John.

  Prince.

                                           A retreat is sounded.

    Come, brother, let's to the highest of the field,
    To see what friends are living, who are dead.
 At my tent
    The Douglas is, and I beseech Your Grace
    I may dispose of him.

  King.
 With all my heart.

  Prince.

    You, son John, and my cousin Westmoreland,
    Towards York shall bend you with your dearest speed
    To meet Northumberland and the prelate Scroop,
    Who, as we hear, are busily in arms.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.
>>





1598


SECOND PART OF KING HENRY IV

by William Shakespeare



Dramatis Personae

  RUMOUR, the Presenter
  KING HENRY THE FOURTH

  HENRY, PRINCE OF WALES, afterwards HENRY
  PRINCE JOHN OF LANCASTER
  PRINCE HUMPHREY OF GLOUCESTER
  THOMAS, DUKE OF CLARENCE
    Sons of Henry IV

  EARL OF NORTHUMBERLAND
  SCROOP, ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
  LORD MOWBRAY
  LORD HASTINGS
  LORD BARDOLPH
  SIR JOHN COLVILLE
  TRAVERS and MORTON, retainers of Northumberland
    Opposites against King Henry IV

  EARL OF WARWICK
  EARL OF WESTMORELAND  
  EARL OF SURREY
  EARL OF KENT
  GOWER
  HARCOURT
  BLUNT
    Of the King's party

  LORD CHIEF JUSTICE
  SERVANT, to Lord Chief Justice

  SIR JOHN FALSTAFF
  EDWARD POINS
  BARDOLPH
  PISTOL
  PETO
    Irregular humourists

  PAGE, to Falstaff

  ROBERT SHALLOW and SILENCE, country Justices  
  DAVY, servant to Shallow

  FANG and SNARE, Sheriff's officers

  RALPH MOULDY
  SIMON SHADOW
  THOMAS WART
  FRANCIS FEEBLE
  PETER BULLCALF
    Country soldiers

  FRANCIS, a drawer

  LADY NORTHUMBERLAND
  LADY PERCY, Percy's widow
  HOSTESS QUICKLY, of the Boar's Head, Eastcheap
  DOLL TEARSHEET

  LORDS, Attendants, Porter, Drawers, Beadles, Grooms, Servants,
    Speaker of the Epilogue  

                       SCENE: England

INDUCTION
                         INDUCTION.

 Exit




<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.

Warkworth.
 Before NORTHUMBERLAND'S Castle

Enter LORD BARDOLPH

  LORD BARDOLPH.
 What shall I say you are?
  LORD BARDOLPH.
 Tell thou the Earl
    That the Lord Bardolph doth attend him here.

  NORTHUMBERLAND.
 O, such a day,
    So fought, so followed, and so fairly won,
    Came not till now to dignify the times,
    Since Cxsar's fortunes!
  NORTHUMBERLAND.
 I spake with one, my lord, that came from thence;  
    A gentleman well bred and of good name,
    That freely rend'red me these news for true.


                         Enter TRAVERS

  NORTHUMBERLAND.
 Here comes my servant Travers, whom I sent
    On Tuesday last to listen after news.
 Now, Travers, what good tidings comes with you?
  TRAVERS.
 Why should that gentleman that rode by Travers
    Give then such instances of loss?
  LORD BARDOLPH.
  

                        Enter Morton

  NORTHUMBERLAND.
 I ran from Shrewsbury, my noble lord;
    Where hateful death put on his ugliest mask
    To fright our party.
'
  MORTON.
 Yet, for all this, say not that Percy's dead.

  MORTON.

    In poison there is physic; and these news,
    Having been well, that would have made me sick,
    Being sick, have in some measure made me well;
    And as the wretch whose fever-weak'ned joints,
    Like strengthless hinges, buckle under life,
    Impatient of his fit, breaks like a fire
    Out of his keeper's arms, even so my limbs,
    Weak'ned with grief, being now enrag'd with grief,
    Are thrice themselves.
 Hence, therefore, thou nice crutch!
    A scaly gauntlet now with joints of steel
    Must glove this hand; and hence, thou sickly coif!
    Thou art a guard too wanton for the head
    Which princes, flesh'd with conquest, aim to hit.

    Now bind my brows with iron; and approach
    The ragged'st hour that time and spite dare bring
    To frown upon th' enrag'd Northumberland!
    Let heaven kiss earth! Now let not Nature's hand
    Keep the wild flood confin'd! Let order die!  
    And let this world no longer be a stage
    To feed contention in a ling'ring act;
    But let one spirit of the first-born Cain
    Reign in all bosoms, that, each heart being set
    On bloody courses, the rude scene may end
    And darkness be the burier of the dead!
  LORD BARDOLPH.

  MORTON.
' It was your pre-surmise
    That in the dole of blows your son might drop.
 And, my most noble lord,
    I hear for certain, and dare speak the truth:
    The gentle Archbishop of York is up
    With well-appointed pow'rs.

  NORTHUMBERLAND.

  FALSTAFF.
 Men of all sorts take a pride to gird at me.
 I am not only witty in myself, but the cause that wit is in
    other men.

    Where's Bardolph?
  PAGE.
 I bought him in Paul's, and he'll buy me a horse in
    Smithfield.
 An I could get me but a wife in the stews, I were
    mann'd, hors'd, and wiv'd.


              Enter the LORD CHIEF JUSTICE and SERVANT

  PAGE.

  FALSTAFF.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.

  SERVANT.
 Sir John!
  FALSTAFF.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.

  FALSTAFF.
 I
    am glad to see your lordship abroad.
 An't please your lordship, I hear his Majesty is return'd
    with some discomfort from Wales.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.
 Rather an't please you, it
    is the disease of not listening, the malady of not marking, that
    I am troubled withal.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.
 Your means are very slender, and your waste is
    great.
 I would it were otherwise; I would my means were greater
    and my waist slenderer.

  FALSTAFF.
 The young Prince hath misled me.
 I am the fellow with the
    great belly, and he my dog.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.

  FALSTAFF.

  FALSTAFF.
 I hear you are
    going with Lord John of Lancaster against the Archbishop and the
    Earl of Northumberland.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.
 If I do, fillip me with a three-man beetle.
 With him, we may.
 Yea, marry, there's the point;
    But if without him we be thought too feeble,
    My judgment is we should not step too far
    Till we had his assistance by the hand;
    For, in a theme so bloody-fac'd as this,
    Conjecture, expectation, and surmise
    Of aids incertain, should not be admitted.
 'Tis very true, Lord Bardolph; for indeed
    It was young Hotspur's case at Shrewsbury.

  LORD BARDOLPH.
 Yes, if this present quality of war-
    Indeed the instant action, a cause on foot-
    Lives so in hope, as in an early spring
    We see th' appearing buds; which to prove fruit
    Hope gives not so much warrant, as despair
    That frosts will bite them.
 What, is the King but five and twenty thousand?
  HASTINGS.
 So is the unfirm King
    In three divided; and his coffers sound
    With hollow poverty and emptiness.

  HASTINGS.
 What trust is in these times?
    They that, when Richard liv'd, would have him die
    Are now become enamour'd on his grave.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
 O Lord, ay! good Master Snare.
 Here, here.
 Yea, good Master Snare; I have ent'red him and all.

  SNARE.
 If I can close with him, I care not for his thrust.
 No, nor I neither; I'll be at your elbow.
 I am undone by his going; I warrant you, he's an
    infinitive thing upon my score.

    Good Master Snare, let him not scape.
 Throw me in the channel! I'll throw thee in the channel.


              Enter the LORD CHIEF JUSTICE and his men

  CHIEF JUSTICE.
 For what sum?
  HOSTESS.
 How comes this, Sir John? Fie! What man of good
    temper would endure this tempest of exclamation? Are you not
    ashamed to enforce a poor widow to so rough a course to come by
    her own?
  FALSTAFF.
 What is the gross sum that I owe thee?
  HOSTESS.
 Deny it, if thou
    canst.
 Sir John, Sir John, I am well acquainted with your
    manner of wrenching the true cause the false way.
 It is not a  
    confident brow, nor the throng of words that come with such more
    than impudent sauciness from you, can thrust me from a level
    consideration.
 Pray thee, peace.
 I say to you I do
    desire deliverance from these officers, being upon hasty
    employment in the King's affairs.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.
 Come hither, hostess.
 Now, Master Gower, what news?
  GOWER.
 By this heavenly ground I tread on, I must be fain to pawn
    both my plate and the tapestry of my dining-chambers.

  FALSTAFF.

  HOSTESS.
 Let it alone; I'll make other shift.
 You'll be a fool  
    still.
 Well, you shall have it, though I pawn my gown.
 Will you have Doll Tearsheet meet you at supper?
  FALSTAFF.
 I hope, my lord, all's well.
 My lord!
  CHIEF JUSTICE.
 This is the right fencing grace, my lord; tap for
    tap, and so part fair.

  CHIEF JUSTICE.

  PRINCE.

  PRINCE.
 Belike then my appetite was not-princely got; for, by my
    troth, I do now remember the poor creature, small beer.
 But
    indeed these humble considerations make me out of love with my
    greatness.

  POINS.

  POINS.
 Go to; I stand the push of your one thing that you will
    tell.
 Marry, I tell thee it is not meet that I should be sad, now
    my father is sick; albeit I could tell to thee- as to one it
    pleases me, for fault of a better, to call my friend- I could be
    sad and sad indeed too.
 It would be every man's thought; and thou art a blessed
    fellow to think as every man thinks.
 Never a man's thought in the
    world keeps the road-way better than thine.

  POINS.
 By this light, I am well spoke on; I can hear it with mine
    own ears.
 'A calls me e'en now, my lord, through a red lattice, and I
    could discern no part of his face from the window.
 Away, you whoreson upright rabbit, away!
  PAGE.
 Marry, the immortal part needs a physician; but that moves
    not him.
 Though that be sick, it dies not.
 I do allow this well to be as familiar with me as my dog;
    and he holds his place, for look you how he writes.

  PRINCE.
 He sure means brevity in breath, short-winded.
 Well, thus we play the fools with the time, and the spirits
    of the wise sit in the clouds and mock us.
 At the old place, my lord, in Eastcheap.

  PRINCE.
 Sup any women with him?
  PAGE.

  PRINCE.

  PRINCE.
 Sirrah, you boy, and Bardolph, no word to your master that
    I am yet come to town.

  PAGE.
 And for mine, sir, I will govern it.
 Fare you well; go.
 From a prince to a prentice? A low transformation! That
    shall be mine; for in everything the purpose must weigh with the
    folly.

                                                          Exeunt




SCENE III.
 Before the castle

Enter NORTHUMBERLAND, LADY NORTHUMBERLAND, and LADY PERCY

  NORTHUMBERLAND.
 Alas, sweet wife, my honour is at pawn;
    And but my going nothing can redeem it.

  LADY PERCY.

    He had no legs that practis'd not his gait;
    And speaking thick, which nature made his blemish,
    Became the accents of the valiant;
    For those who could speak low and tardily
    Would turn their own perfection to abuse
    To seem like him: so that in speech, in gait,
    In diet, in affections of delight,
    In military rules, humours of blood,
    He was the mark and glass, copy and book,
    That fashion'd others.
 Come, come, go in with me.
 'Tis with my mind
    As with the tide swell'd up unto his height,
    That makes a still-stand, running neither way.

    Fain would I go to meet the Archbishop,
    But many thousand reasons hold me back.
 The Prince once set a dish
    of apple-johns before him, and told him there were five more Sir
    Johns; and, putting off his hat, said 'I will now take my leave
    of these six dry, round, old, withered knights.
' It ang'red him
    to the heart; but he hath forgot that.

  FRANCIS.
 Why, then, cover and set them down; and see if thou canst
    find out Sneak's noise; Mistress Tearsheet would fain hear some
    music.
 Dispatch! The room where they supp'd is too hot;
    they'll come in straight.
 Bardolph hath brought word.

  THIRD DRAWER.

    Lo, here comes Sir John.
  [Exit FRANCIS]- [Singing]  'And was a worthy king'- How
    now, Mistress Doll!
  HOSTESS.
 So is all her sect; and they be once in a calm, they are
    sick.

  DOLL.
 By my troth, this is the old fashion; you two never meet
    but you fall to some discord.
 Sir, Ancient Pistol's below and would speak with you.

  DOLL.

  HOSTESS.
 I am in good
    name and fame with the very best.
 Pray ye, pacify yourself, Sir John; there comes no
    swaggerers here.
 Tilly-fally, Sir John, ne'er tell me; and your ancient
    swagg'rer comes not in my doors.
 Receive' says he 'no swaggering
    companions.
 No, I'll no swagg'rers.

                                                    Exit FRANCIS
  HOSTESS.

  DOLL.
 I
    cannot abide swagg'rers.

  DOLL.
 I know you, Mistress Dorothy.
 Away, you bottle-ale rascal! you
    basket-hilt stale juggler, you! Since when, I pray you, sir?
    God's light, with two points on your shoulder? Much!
  PISTOL.
 No more, Pistol; I would not have you go off here.

  BARDOLPH.

  PISTOL.
 These be good humours, indeed! Shall packhorses,
    And hollow pamper'd jades of Asia,
    Which cannot go but thirty mile a day,
    Compare with Caesars, and with Cannibals,
    And Troiant Greeks? Nay, rather damn them with
    King Cerberus; and let the welkin roar.
 Be gone, good ancient; this will grow to a brawl anon.

  PISTOL.

                                         [Laying down his sword]
    Come we to full points here, and are etceteras nothings?
  FALSTAFF.
 Quoit him down, Bardolph, like a shove-groat shilling.
 Give me my rapier, boy.

  DOLL.
 Here's a goodly tumult! I'll forswear keeping house afore
    I'll be in these tirrits and frights.
 Have you turn'd him out a doors?
  BARDOLPH.
 You have hurt him, sir, i'
    th' shoulder.
 A rascal! to brave me!
  DOLL.
 Come on, you whoreson
    chops.
 Do, an thou dar'st for thy heart.
 Peace, good Doll! Do not speak like a death's-head; do
    not bid me remember mine end.
 Sirrah, what humour's the Prince of?
  FALSTAFF.

  FALSTAFF.
  
  DOLL.
 Why does the Prince love him so, then?
  FALSTAFF.

  PRINCE.
 Saturn and Venus this year in conjunction! What says th'
    almanac to that?  
  POINS.

  FALSTAFF.
 I am old, I am old.
 What stuff wilt have a kirtle of? I shall receive money a
    Thursday.

  DOLL.
 By my troth, thou't set me a-weeping, an thou say'st so.

  PRINCE & POINS.
  
  PRINCE.
 O, the Lord preserve thy Grace! By my troth, welcome to
    London.
 Now the Lord bless that sweet face of thine.
 Thou whoreson mad compound of majesty, by this light
    flesh and corrupt blood, thou art welcome.
 My lord, he will drive you out of your revenge and turn all
    to a merriment, if you take not the heat.

  PRINCE.

  FALSTAFF.
 You knew I was at your back, and spoke it on purpose to
    try my patience.
 No, no, no; not so; I did not think thou wast within
    hearing.
  
  PRINCE.

  PRINCE.
 See now, whether pure fear and entire cowardice doth not
    make thee wrong this virtuous gentlewoman to close with us? Is
    she of the wicked? Is thine hostess here of the wicked? Or is thy
    boy of the wicked? Or honest Bardolph, whose zeal burns in his
    nose, of the wicked?
  POINS.
 For the boy- there is a good angel about him;
    but the devil outbids him too.
 What's a joint of mutton or two in a
    whole Lent?
  PRINCE.
 Peto, how now! What news?
  PETO.
 By heaven, Poins, I feel me much to blame
    So idly to profane the precious time,
    When tempest of commotion, like the south,
    Borne with black vapour, doth begin to melt
    And drop upon our bare unarmed heads.
 Falstaff, good night.


                        Exeunt PRINCE, POINS, PETO, and BARDOLPH

  FALSTAFF.
  [Knocking within]  More
    knocking at the door!

                      Re-enter BARDOLPH

    How now! What's the matter?
  BARDOLPH.
 O, run Doll, run, run, good Come.

Westminster.
 Make good speed.
 Why then, good morrow to you all, my lords.

  KING.

    'Tis not ten years gone
    Since Richard and Northumberland, great friends,
    Did feast together, and in two years after
    Were they at wars.

  WARWICK.
 There is a history in all men's lives,
    Figuring the natures of the times deceas'd;
    The which observ'd, a man may prophesy,
    With a near aim, of the main chance of things
    As yet not come to life, who in their seeds
    And weak beginning lie intreasured.

    Rumour doth double, like the voice and echo,
    The numbers of the feared.
 Come on, come on, come on; give me your hand, sir; give me
    your hand, sir.
 Good morrow, good cousin Shallow.
 Alas, a black ousel, cousin Shallow!
  SHALLOW.
 By yea and no, sir.
 I dare say my cousin William is become
    a good scholar; he is at Oxford still, is he not?
  SILENCE.
 You were call'd 'lusty Shallow' then, cousin.
 Dead, sir.
  
  SHALLOW.
 Jesu, Jesu, dead! drew a good bow; and dead! 'A shot a
    fine shoot.
 John a Gaunt loved him well, and betted much money on
    his head.
 Thereafter as they be- a score of good ewes may be worth
    ten pounds.
 My captain, sir, commends him to you; my captain, Sir
    John Falstaff- a tall gentleman, by heaven, and a most gallant  
    leader.

  SHALLOW.
 He greets me well, sir; I knew him a good back-sword man.
 'Better accommodated!' It is good; yea, indeed, is it.

  BARDOLPH.
 Welcome, good Sir
    John.
 Good Master Silence, it well befits you should be of the
    peace.
 Fie! this is hot weather.
 Let me see them, I beseech you.

  SHALLOW.
 Where's the roll? Where's the roll? Where's the roll? Let
    me see, let me see, let me see.
 So, so, so, so,- so, so- yea,
    marry, sir.
 Rafe Mouldy! Let them appear as I call; let them do
    so, let them do so.
 Yea, an't please you.
 Very singular good! In faith, well said, Sir
    John; very well said.

  FALSTAFF.
 You need not to have prick'd me; there are
    other men fitter to go out than I.

  FALSTAFF.
 Shadow will serve for summer.

  SHALLOW.
 Is thy name Wart?
  WART.
 Ha, ha, ha! You can do it, sir; you can do it.
 Wilt thou make as many holes in an enemy's battle as
    thou hast done in a woman's petticoat?
  FEEBLE.
 I would thou wert a man's tailor, that thou mightst mend
    him and make him fit to go.

  FEEBLE.
 Here, sir.
 Come, thou shalt go to the wars in a gown.
 You must have
    but four here, sir; and so, I pray you, go in with me to dinner.
 I am glad to see you, by my troth, Master Shallow.
 O, Sir John, do you remember since we lay all night in the
    windmill in Saint George's Field?
  FALSTAFF.
 Never, never; she would always say she could not abide
    Master Shallow.

  SHALLOW.
 She was then
    a bona-roba.

  SHALLOW.

  SHALLOW.
 In very
    truth, sir, I had as lief be hang'd, sir, as go.
 And, good Master Corporal Captain, for my old dame's sake,
    stand my friend.
 You shall have
    forty, sir.
 Faith, I'll bear no base mind.

  FALSTAFF.
 He
    presents no mark to the enemy; the foeman may with as great aim
    level at the edge of a penknife.
 Put me a caliver into
    Wart's hand, Bardolph.
 Traverse- thus, thus, thus.
 Come, manage me your caliver.
 He is not his craft's master, he doth not do it right.
 These fellows will do well.

  FALSTAFF.
 God keep you.
 I do see the bottom of
    justice Shallow.

  ARCHBISHOP.
 West of this forest, scarcely off a mile,
    In goodly form comes on the enemy;
    And, by the ground they hide, I judge their number
    Upon or near the rate of thirty thousand.
 Health and fair greeting from our general,
    The Prince, Lord John and Duke of Lancaster.
 Wherefore do I this? So the question stands.

    I have in equal balance justly weigh'd  
    What wrongs our arms may do, what wrongs we suffer,
    And find our griefs heavier than our offences.

  WESTMORELAND.
 Why not to him in part, and to us all
    That feel the bruises of the days before,
    And suffer the condition of these times
    To lay a heavy and unequal hand
    Upon our honours?
  WESTMORELAND.
 Were you not restor'd
    To all the Duke of Norfolk's signiories,
    Your noble and right well-rememb'red father's?
  MOWBRAY.
 you overween to take it so.
 That argues but the shame of your offence:
    A rotten case abides no handling.
  
    I muse you make so slight a question.
 This will I show the general.
 Please you, lords,
    In sight of both our battles we may meet;
    And either end in peace- which God so frame!-
    Or to the place of diff'rence call the swords
    Which must decide it.
 My lord, we will do so.

  MOWBRAY.
 Note this: the King is weary
    Of dainty and such picking grievances;
    For he hath found to end one doubt by death
    Revives two greater in the heirs of life;
    And therefore will he wipe his tables clean,
    And keep no tell-tale to his memory
    That may repeat and history his los
    To new remembrance.
 'Tis very true;
    And therefore be assur'd, my good Lord Marshal,
    If we do now make our atonement well,
    Our peace will, like a broken limb united,
    Grow stronger for the breaking.
 Who hath not heard it spoken
    How deep you were within the books of God?
    To us the speaker in His parliament,
    To us th' imagin'd voice of God himself,
    The very opener and intelligencer
    Between the grace, the sanctities of heaven,
    And our dull workings.
 O, who shall believe
    But you misuse the reverence of your place,
    Employ the countenance and grace of heav'n
    As a false favourite doth his prince's name,
    In deeds dishonourable? You have ta'en up,
    Under the counterfeited zeal of God,
    The subjects of His substitute, my father,
    And both against the peace of heaven and him
    Have here up-swarm'd them.
 Good my Lord of Lancaster,
    I am not here against your father's peace;
    But, as I told my Lord of Westmoreland,
    The time misord'red doth, in common sense,
    Crowd us and crush us to this monstrous form  
    To hold our safety up.
 I sent your Grace
    The parcels and particulars of our grief,
    The which hath been with scorn shov'd from the court,
    Whereon this hydra son of war is born;
    Whose dangerous eyes may well be charm'd asleep
    With grant of our most just and right desires;
    And true obedience, of this madness cur'd,
    Stoop tamely to the foot of majesty.

    If they miscarry, theirs shall second them;
    And so success of mischief shall be born,
    And heir from heir shall hold this quarrel up
    Whiles England shall have generation.

  ARCHBISHOP.
 I give it you, and will maintain my word;
    And thereupon I drink unto your Grace.
 Let them have pay, and part.

                                                    Exit Officer
  ARCHBISHOP.
 To you, my noble Lord of Westmoreland.
 I am glad of it.

                                                 [Shouts within]
  PRINCE JOHN.
 My lord, our army is dispers'd already.

  WESTMORELAND.
 Will you thus break your faith?
  PRINCE JOHN.

    Most shallowly did you these arms commence,
    Fondly brought here, and foolishly sent hence.
  
    Strike up our drums, pursue the scatt'red stray.
          Exeunt




SCENE III.
 Enter FALSTAFF and COLVILLE, meeting

  FALSTAFF.
 My womb, my womb, my womb undoes me.
 Do you
    think me a swallow, an arrow, or a bullet? Have I, in my poor and
    old motion, the expedition of thought? I have speeded hither with
    the very extremest inch of possibility; I have found'red nine
    score and odd posts; and here, travel tainted as I am, have, in  
    my pure and immaculate valour, taken Sir John Colville of the
    Dale,a most furious knight and valorous enemy.
 Here he is, and here I yield him; and I
    beseech your Grace, let it be book'd with the rest of this day's
    deeds; or, by the Lord, I will have it in a particular ballad
    else, with mine own picture on the top on't, Colville kissing my
    foot; to the which course if I be enforc'd, if you do not all
    show like gilt twopences to me, and I, in the clear sky of fame,
    o'ershine you as much as the full moon doth the cinders of the
    element, which show like pins' heads to her, believe not the word
    of the noble.

  PRINCE JOHN.
 Let it shine, then.
 Let it do something, my good lord, that may do me good,
    and call it what you will.

  PRINCE JOHN.
 Is thy name Colville?  
  COLVILLE.

  PRINCE JOHN.

  PRINCE JOHN.

                                         Exeunt BLUNT and others
    And now dispatch we toward the court, my lords.
 They
    are generally fools and cowards-which some of us should be too,
    but for inflammation.
 The second property of
    your excellent sherris is the warming of the blood; which before,
    cold and settled, left the liver white and pale, which is the
    badge of pusillanimity and cowardice; but the sherris warms it,
    and makes it course from the inwards to the parts extremes.
 It
    illumineth the face, which, as a beacon, gives warning to all the
    rest of this little kingdom, man, to arm; and then the vital
    commoners and inland petty spirits muster me all to their
    captain, the heart, who, great and puff'd up with this retinue,
    doth any deed of courage- and this valour comes of sherris.


                           Enter BARDOLPH

    How now, Bardolph!
  BARDOLPH.
 The army is discharged all and gone.
                                  Exeunt




SCENE IV.

    Only we want a little personal strength;
    And pause us till these rebels, now afoot,
    Come underneath the yoke of government.

  KING.

  KING.
 Is not his brother, Thomas of Clarence, with him?
  PRINCE HUMPHREY.

    He hath a tear for pity and a hand
    Open as day for melting charity;
    Yet notwithstanding, being incens'd, he is flint;
    As humorous as winter, and as sudden  
    As flaws congealed in the spring of day.
  
  KING.

  HARCOURT.
 From enemies heaven keep your Majesty;
    And, when they stand against you, may they fall
    As those that I am come to tell you of!
    The Earl Northumberland and the Lord Bardolph,
    With a great power of English and of Scots,
    Are by the shrieve of Yorkshire overthrown.
 And wherefore should these good news make me sick?
    Will Fortune never come with both hands full,
    But write her fair words still in foulest letters?
    She either gives a stomach and no food-
    Such are the poor, in health- or else a feast,  
    And takes away the stomach- such are the rich
    That have abundance and enjoy it not.
 O my royal father!
  WESTMORELAND.

  WARWICK.
 Be patient, Princes; you do know these fits
    Are with his Highness very ordinary.
 Another chamber

The KING lying on a bed; CLARENCE, GLOUCESTER, WARWICK,
and others in attendance

  KING.
 Call for the music in the other room.
 How now! Rain within doors, and none abroad!
    How doth the King?
  PRINCE HUMPHREY.
 Exceeding ill.

  PRINCE.
 If he be sick with joy, he'll recover without physic.
 Not so much noise, my lords.
 Doth the King call?  
  WARWICK.

  KING.
 The Prince of Wales! Where is he? Let me see him.

  WARWICK.
 This door is open; he is gone this way.
 See, sons, what things you are!
    How quickly nature falls into revolt
    When gold becomes her object!
    For this the foolish over-careful fathers  
    Have broke their sleep with thoughts,
    Their brains with care, their bones with industry;
    For this they have engrossed and pil'd up
    The cank'red heaps of strange-achieved gold;
    For this they have been thoughtful to invest
    Their sons with arts and martial exercises;
    When, like the bee, tolling from every flower
    The virtuous sweets,
    Our thighs with wax, our mouths with honey pack'd,
    We bring it to the hive, and, like the bees,
    Are murd'red for our pains.
 This bitter taste
    Yields his engrossments to the ending father.
 Come hither to me, Harry.

    What, canst thou not forbear me half an hour?
    Then get thee gone, and dig my grave thyself;
    And bid the merry bells ring to thine ear
    That thou art crowned, not that I am dead.

    England shall double gild his treble guilt;
    England shall give him office, honour, might;
    For the fifth Harry from curb'd license plucks
    The muzzle of restraint, and the wild dog
    Shall flesh his tooth on every innocent.

    Peopled with wolves, thy old inhabitants!
  PRINCE.
 There is your crown,
    And he that wears the crown immortally
    Long guard it yours!  [Kneeling]  If I affect it more
    Than as your honour and as your renown,
    Let me no more from this obedience rise,
    Which my most inward true and duteous spirit
    Teacheth this prostrate and exterior bending!
    God witness with me, when I here came in
    And found no course of breath within your Majesty,
    How cold it struck my heart! If I do feign,
    O, let me in my present wildness die,
    And never live to show th' incredulous world
    The noble change that I have purposed!
    Coming to look on you, thinking you dead-
    And dead almost, my liege, to think you were-
    I spake unto this crown as having sense,
    And thus upbraided it: 'The care on thee depending
    Hath fed upon the body of my father;
    Therefore thou best of gold art worst of gold.
 God knows, my son,
    By what by-paths and indirect crook'd ways
    I met this crown; and I myself know well
    How troublesome it sat upon my head:
    To thee it shall descend with better quiet,
    Better opinion, better confirmation;
    For all the soil of the achievement goes
    With me into the earth.
 And now my death
    Changes the mood; for what in me was purchas'd
    Falls upon thee in a more fairer sort;  
    So thou the garland wear'st successively.

    Yet, though thou stand'st more sure than I could do,
    Thou art not firm enough, since griefs are green;
    And all my friends, which thou must make thy friends,
    Have but their stings and teeth newly ta'en out;
    By whose fell working I was first advanc'd,
    And by whose power I well might lodge a fear
    To be again displac'd; which to avoid,
    I cut them off; and had a purpose now
    To lead out many to the Holy Land,
    Lest rest and lying still might make them look
    Too near unto my state.
 Therefore, my Harry,
    Be it thy course to busy giddy minds
    With foreign quarrels, that action, hence borne out,
    May waste the memory of the former days.

    More would I, but my lungs are wasted so
    That strength of speech is utterly denied me.

    How I came by the crown, O God, forgive;
    And grant it may with thee in true peace live!
  PRINCE.


       Enter PRINCE JOHN OF LANCASTER, WARWICK, LORDS, and others

  KING.
 Upon thy sight
    My worldly business makes a period.
 SHALLOW'S house

Enter SHALLOW, FALSTAFF, BARDOLPH, and PAGE

  SHALLOW.
 You must excuse me, Master Robert Shallow.
 Why, Davy!

                            Enter DAVY

  DAVY.
 With red wheat, Davy.

  SHALLOW.
 Doth the man of war stay all night, sir?
  SHALLOW.

  SHALLOW.

  DAVY.

  DAVY.
 I grant your worship that he is a knave, sir; but yet God
    forbid, sir, but a knave should have some countenance at his
    friend's request.
 Come, Sir John.

    [Exit SHALLOW]  Bardolph, look to our horses.
 It is
    certain that either wise bearing or ignorant carriage is caught,
    as men take diseases, one of another; therefore let men take heed
    of their company.
 O, it is much that a lie with a slight
    oath, and a jest with a sad brow will do with a fellow that never
    had the ache in his shoulders! O, you shall see him laugh till
    his face be like a wet cloak ill laid up!
  SHALLOW.
 Exceeding well; his cares are now all ended.
 He's walk'd the way of nature;
    And to our purposes he lives no more.

  WARWICK.
 Here comes the heavy issue of dead Harry.

    O that the living Harry had the temper
    Of he, the worst of these three gentlemen!
    How many nobles then should hold their places
    That must strike sail to spirits of vile sort!
  CHIEF JUSTICE.

  GLOUCESTER & CLARENCE.

  PRINCE JOHN.
 We meet like men that had forgot to speak.
 Peace be with us, lest we be heavier!
  PRINCE HUMPHREY.
 This new and gorgeous garment, majesty,
    Sits not so easy on me as you think.

    Sorrow so royally in you appears
    That I will deeply put the fashion on,
    And wear it in my heart.

    For me, by heaven, I bid you be assur'd,
    I'll be your father and your brother too;
    Let me but bear your love, I'll bear your cares.
 You all look strangely on me; and you most.
 I am assur'd, if I be measur'd rightly,
    Your Majesty hath no just cause to hate me.

    Question your royal thoughts, make the case yours;
    Be now the father, and propose a son;
    Hear your own dignity so much profan'd,
    See your most dreadful laws so loosely slighted,
    Behold yourself so by a son disdain'd;
    And then imagine me taking your part
    And, in your power, soft silencing your son.

    After this cold considerance, sentence me;
    And, as you are a king, speak in your state
    What I have done that misbecame my place,
    My person, or my liege's sovereignty.
               Exeunt




SCENE III.

  FALSTAFF.

  SHALLOW.
 Barren, barren, barren; beggars all, beggars all, Sir John
    -marry, good air.
 By the mass, I have drunk too much sack at supper.
 Now sit down, now sit down; come, cousin.
 There's a merry heart! Good Master Silence, I'll give you
    a health for that anon.

 Exit
  SHALLOW.
  

  FALSTAFF.
 I did not think Master Silence had been a man of this
    mettle.
 Who, I? I have been merry twice and once ere now.


                          Re-enter DAVY

  DAVY.
  [To BARDOLPH]
    A cup of wine, sir?
  SILENCE.
  [Singing]

         A cup of wine that's brisk and fine,
         And drink unto the leman mine;
           And a merry heart lives long-a.
 An I might see you there, Davy!
  SHALLOW.


    Is't not so?
  FALSTAFF.
 'Tis so.
 Sweet knight,
    thou art now one of the greatest men in this realm.
 By'r lady, I think 'a be, but goodman Puff of Barson.
 Puff!
    Puff in thy teeth, most recreant coward base!
    Sir John, I am thy Pistol and thy friend,
    And helter-skelter have I rode to thee;
    And tidings do I bring, and lucky joys,
    And golden times, and happy news of price.
  [Singing]  And Robin Hood, Scarlet, and John.
 Honest gentleman, I know not your breeding.
 Under which king, Bezonian? Speak, or die.

  SHALLOW.
 Under King Harry.

  PISTOL.

  FALSTAFF.

  PISTOL.
 Blessed are
    they that have been my friends; and woe to my Lord Chief Justice!
  PISTOL.
 No, thou arrant knave; I would to God that I might die,
    that I might have thee hang'd.
 Thou hast drawn my shoulder out of
    joint.
 The constables have delivered her over to me; and she
    shall have whipping-cheer enough, I warrant her.
 Come, I charge you both go with me; for
    the man is dead that you and Pistol beat amongst you.
 O God, that right should thus overcome might!
    Well, of sufferance comes ease.
                                Exeunt




SCENE V.
 More rushes, more rushes!
  SECOND GROOM.

  THIRD GROOM.
 'Twill be two o'clock ere they come from the
    coronation.
 Dispatch, dispatch.
 Stand here by me, Master Robert Shallow; I will make the
    King do you grace.

  PISTOL.
 Come here, Pistol; stand behind me.
 My devotion-
  SHALLOW.
 As it were, to ride day and night; and not to deliberate,
    not to remember, not to have patience to shift me-
  SHALLOW.
' 'Tis all in
    every part.
 'Tis so, indeed.
 I will deliver her.
 God save thy Grace, King Hal; my royal Hal!
  PISTOL.

    Make less thy body hence, and more thy grace;
    Leave gormandizing; know the grave doth gape
    For thee thrice wider than for other men-
    Reply not to me with a fool-born jest;
    Presume not that I am the thing I was,
    For God doth know, so shall the world perceive,
    That I have turn'd away my former self;
    So will I those that kept me company.
 Yea, marry, Sir John; which I beseech you to let me have
    home with me.

  FALSTAFF.
 Go, carry Sir John Falstaff to the Fleet;
    Take all his company along with him.

  PRINCE JOHN.


  First my fear, then my curtsy, last my speech.

  If my tongue cannot entreat you to acquit me, will you command me to
use my legs? And yet that were but light payment-to dance out of
your debt.

   Suppose within the girdle of these walls  
   Are now confin'd two mighty monarchies,
   Whose high upreared and abutting fronts
   The perilous narrow ocean parts asunder.
 SCENE I.
 My lord, I'll tell you: that self bill is urg'd
   Which in th' eleventh year of the last king's reign
   Was like, and had indeed against us pass'd
   But that the scambling and unquiet time
   Did push it out of farther question.

 ELY.

 ELY.

 CANTERBURY.

 ELY.

   The breath no sooner left his father's body  
   But that his wildness, mortified in him,
   Seem'd to die too; yea, at that very moment,
   Consideration like an angel came
   And whipp'd th' offending Adam out of him,
   Leaving his body as a paradise
   T'envelop and contain celestial spirits.
 We are blessed in the change.

 CANTERBURY.
 It must be so; for miracles are ceas'd;
   And therefore we must needs admit the means  
   How things are perfected.

 ELY.
 The French ambassador upon that instant
   Crav'd audience; and the hour, I think, is come  
   To give him hearing: is it four o'clock?
 ELY.
 Where is my gracious Lord of Canterbury?
  EXETER.
 Not here in presence.
 Send for him, good uncle.

  WESTMORELAND.

    My learned lord, we pray you to proceed,
    And justly and religiously unfold  
    Why the law Salique, that they have in France,
    Or should or should not bar us in our claim;
    And God forbid, my dear and faithful lord,
    That you should fashion, wrest, or bow your reading,
    Or nicely charge your understanding soul
    With opening titles miscreate whose right
    Suits not in native colours with the truth;
    For God doth know how many, now in health,
    Shall drop their blood in approbation
    Of what your reverence shall incite us to.

    Under this conjuration speak, my lord;
    For we will hear, note, and believe in heart,  
    That what you speak is in your conscience wash'd
    As pure as sin with baptism.
 Then hear me, gracious sovereign, and you peers,
    That owe yourselves, your lives, and services,
    To this imperial throne.

    Hugh Capet also, who usurp'd the crown
    Of Charles the Duke of Lorraine, sole heir male  
    Of the true line and stock of Charles the Great,
    To find his title with some shows of truth-
    Though in pure truth it was corrupt and naught-
    Convey'd himself as th' heir to th' Lady Lingare,
    Daughter to Charlemain, who was the son
    To Lewis the Emperor, and Lewis the son
    Of Charles the Great.
 Also King Lewis the Tenth,
    Who was sole heir to the usurper Capet,
    Could not keep quiet in his conscience,
    Wearing the crown of France, till satisfied
    That fair Queen Isabel, his grandmother,
    Was lineal of the Lady Ermengare,
    Daughter to Charles the foresaid Duke of Lorraine;
    By the which marriage the line of Charles the Great
    Was re-united to the Crown of France.
  
    O noble English, that could entertain
    With half their forces the full pride of France,
    And let another half stand laughing by,
    All out of work and cold for action!
  ELY.
 We must not only arm t' invade the French,
    But lay down our proportions to defend
    Against the Scot, who will make road upon us
    With all advantages.
 They of those marches, gracious sovereign,
    Shall be a wall sufficient to defend
    Our inland from the pilfering borderers.

    While that the armed hand doth fight abroad,
    Th' advised head defends itself at home;
    For government, though high, and low, and lower,
    Put into parts, doth keep in one consent,
    Congreeing in a full and natural close,
    Like music.
 Call in the messengers sent from the Dauphin.

  AMBASSADOR.
 May't please your Majesty to give us leave
    Freely to render what we have in charge;
    Or shall we sparingly show you far of
    The Dauphin's meaning and our embassy?
  KING HENRY.
 This the Dauphin speaks.
 Tennis-balls, my liege.

    When we have match'd our rackets to these balls,  
    We will in France, by God's grace, play a set
    Shall strike his father's crown into the hazard.

    Tell him he hath made a match with such a wrangler
    That all the courts of France will be disturb'd
    With chaces.

    But this lies all within the will of God,
    To whom I do appeal; and in whose name,
    Tell you the Dauphin, I am coming on,
    To venge me as I may and to put forth
    My rightful hand in a well-hallow'd cause.

    Therefore, my lords, omit no happy hour  
    That may give furth'rance to our expedition;
    For we have now no thought in us but France,
    Save those to God, that run before our business.
                 Exit




SCENE I.

  BARDOLPH.
 It is certain, Corporal, that he is married to Nell
    Quickly; and certainly she did you wrong, for you were
    troth-plight to her.
 I cannot tell; things must be as they may.
 Good Corporal, be
    patient here.

  BARDOLPH.
 Pish!  
  PISTOL.

  PISTOL.
 'Solus,' egregious dog? O viper vile!
    The 'solus' in thy most mervailous face;
    The 'solus' in thy teeth, and in thy throat,
    And in thy hateful lungs, yea, in thy maw, perdy;
    And, which is worse, within thy nasty mouth!
    I do retort the 'solus' in thy bowels;
    For I can take, and Pistol's cock is up,
    And flashing fire will follow.
 I thee defy again.

    O hound of Crete, think'st thou my spouse to get?
    No; to the spital go,
    And from the powd'ring tub of infamy
    Fetch forth the lazar kite of Cressid's kind,
    Doll Tearsheet she by name, and her espouse.
 Good Bardolph, put
    thy face between his sheets, and do the office of a warming-pan.
 By my troth, he'll yield the crow a pudding one of these
    days: the King has kill'd his heart.
 Good husband, come home
    presently.
                            Exeunt HOSTESS and BOY
  BARDOLPH.
 Come, shall I make you two friends? We must to France
    together; why the devil should we keep knives to cut one
    another's throats?
  PISTOL.
 You'll pay me the eight shillings I won of you at betting?
  PISTOL.
 That now I will have; that's the humour of it.
 As manhood shall compound: push home.

  PISTOL.
 A noble shalt thou have, and present pay;
    And liquor likewise will I give to thee,
    And friendship shall combine, and brotherhood.
 As ever you come of women, come in quickly to Sir John.
 A council-chamber

Enter EXETER, BEDFORD, and WESTMORELAND

  BEDFORD.
 Fore God, his Grace is bold, to trust these traitors.
 They shall be apprehended by and by.

  WESTMORELAND.
 The King hath note of all that they intend,
    By interception which they dream not of.
 Enter the KING, SCROOP,
                  CAMBRIDGE, GREY, and attendants

  KING HENRY.

  SCROOP.
 We consider
    It was excess of wine that set him on;
    And on his more advice we pardon him.

  KING HENRY.

  KING HENRY.
 I one, my lord.
 So did you me, my liege.
 I do confess my fault,
    And do submit me to your Highness' mercy.

  KING HENRY.

    You must not dare, for shame, to talk of mercy;
    For your own reasons turn into your bosoms
    As dogs upon their masters, worrying you.

    See you, my princes and my noble peers,
    These English monsters! My Lord of Cambridge here-
    You know how apt our love was to accord
    To furnish him with an appertinents
    Belonging to his honour; and this man
    Hath, for a few light crowns, lightly conspir'd,
    And sworn unto the practices of France
    To kill us here in Hampton; to the which
    This knight, no less for bounty bound to us  
    Than Cambridge is, hath likewise sworn.
 Or are they spare in diet,
    Free from gross passion or of mirth or anger,  
    Constant in spirit, not swerving with the blood,
    Garnish'd and deck'd in modest complement,
    Not working with the eye without the ear,
    And but in purged judgment trusting neither?
    Such and so finely bolted didst thou seem;
    And thus thy fall hath left a kind of blot
    To mark the full-fraught man and best indued
    With some suspicion.
 I arrest thee of high treason, by the name of Richard Earl
      of Cambridge.
 Never did faithful subject more rejoice
    At the discovery of most dangerous treason
    Than I do at this hour joy o'er myself,
    Prevented from a damned enterprise.
 God quit you in his mercy! Hear your sentence.

                     Exeunt CAMBRIDGE, SCROOP, and GREY, guarded
    Now, lords, for France; the enterprise whereof
    Shall be to you as us like glorious.

    We doubt not of a fair and lucky war,
    Since God so graciously hath brought to light
    This dangerous treason, lurking in our way
    To hinder our beginnings; we doubt not now
    But every rub is smoothed on our way.

  HOSTESS.
 Ay, that 'a did.

  BARDOLPH.
 And of women.

  HOSTESS.
 Well, the fuel is gone that maintain'd that fire: that's
    all the riches I got in his service.
'
    Trust none;
    For oaths are straws, men's faiths are wafer-cakes,
    And Holdfast is the only dog, my duck.

  HOSTESS.

  DAUPHIN.
 O peace, Prince Dauphin!
    You are too much mistaken in this king.

  FRENCH KING.
 Ambassadors from Harry King of England
    Do crave admittance to your Majesty.
 Or else what follows?
  EXETER.
 For us, we will consider of this further;
    To-morrow shall you bear our full intent
    Back to our brother of England.

  FRENCH KING.
  
    A night is but small breath and little pause
    To answer matters of this consequence.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.


Flourish.
 Thus with imagin'd wing our swift scene flies,
    In motion of no less celerity
    Than that of thought.
, AND IS
