 Come, sir, what letters had you late from France?  
  Reg.
 To whose hands have you sent the lunatic King?
     Speak.
 Because I would not see thy cruel nails
     Pluck out his poor old eyes; nor thy fierce sister
     In his anointed flesh stick boarish fangs.

     Yet, poor old heart, he holp the heavens to rain.
 How now, you dog?
  1.
 Serv.
 What do you mean?
  Corn.

  1.
 Lest it see more, prevent it.
 All dark and comfortless! Where's my son Edmund?
     Edmund, enkindle all the sparks of nature
     To quit this horrid act.
 Out, treacherous villain!
     Thou call'st on him that hates thee.
 O my follies! Then Edgar was abus'd.

     Kind gods, forgive me that, and prosper him!
  Reg.
  
                                     Exit [one] with Gloucester.
 Follow me, lady.

     Turn out that eyeless villain.
 Throw this slave
     Upon the dunghill.
 Regan, I bleed apace.
 Go thou.


Enter Edgar.
 To be worst,
     The lowest and most dejected thing of fortune,
     Stands still in esperance, lives not in fear.
 Welcome then,
     Thou unsubstantial air that I embrace!
     The wretch that thou hast blown unto the worst
     Owes nothing to thy blasts.


                 Enter Gloucester, led by an Old Man.


     But who comes here?
     My father, poorly led? World, world, O world!
     But that thy strange mutations make us hate thee,
     Life would not yield to age.
 [aside] O gods! Who is't can say 'I am at the worst'?
     I am worse than e'er I was.
 The worst is not
     So long as we can say 'This is the worst.
'
  Old Man.

  Edg.

  Glou.
 Alack, sir, he is mad!  
  Glou.
 'Tis the time's plague when madmen lead the blind.

     Do as I bid thee, or rather do thy pleasure.
 [Aside] I cannot daub it further.
 Here, take this Purse, thou whom the heavens' plagues
     Have humbled to all strokes.
 Ay, master.


  Gon.
 Welcome, my lord.


     Now, where's your master?
  Osw.
' Of Gloucester's treachery
     And of the loyal service of his son
     When I inform'd him, then he call'd me sot
     And told me I had turn'd the wrong side out.

     What most he should dislike seems pleasant to him;
     What like, offensive.
 [to Edmund] Then shall you go no further.
 He'll not feel wrongs
     Which tie him to an answer.
 Back, Edmund, to my brother.

     Hasten his musters and conduct his pow'rs.
 This trusty servant
     Shall pass between us.

  Edm.

  Gon.
 My most dear Gloucester!
     O, the difference of man and man!
     To thee a woman's services are due;
     My fool usurps my body.
                          Exit.

  Alb.
 O vain fool!
  Alb.
 O, my good lord, the Duke of Cornwall 's dead,
     Slain by his servant, going to put out
     The other eye of Gloucester.
 A servant that he bred, thrill'd with remorse,
     Oppos'd against the act, bending his sword
     To his great master; who, thereat enrag'd,
     Flew on him, and amongst them fell'd him dead;
     But not without that harmful stroke which since
     Hath pluck'd him after.

  Alb.

The French camp near Dover.


Enter Kent and a Gentleman.
 Something he left imperfect in the state, which since his
     coming forth is thought of, which imports to the kingdom so much
     fear and danger that his personal return was most required and
     necessary.

  Kent.
 Did your letters pierce the Queen to any demonstration of
     grief?
  Gent.
 Then away she started
     To deal with grief alone.

  Kent.

  Gent.
 Why, good sir?
  Kent.

  Gent.





Scene IV.


  Cor.

     Therefore great France
     My mourning and important tears hath pitied.

Gloucester's Castle.
 But are my brother's pow'rs set forth?
  Osw.

  Reg.
 What might import my sister's letter to him?
  Osw.
 Our troops set forth to-morrow.

     My lady charg'd my duty in this business.

  Osw.
 Y'are! I know't.

     If you do find him, pray you give him this;  
     And when your mistress hears thus much from you,
     I pray desire her call her wisdom to her.

     So farewell.

     If you do chance to hear of that blind traitor,
     Preferment falls on him that cuts him off.
 Fare thee well.





Scene VI.
 You do climb up it now.
 Horrible steep.

  Edg.

  Glou.
 With all my heart.
 O you mighty gods!                            He kneels.
 Away, and let me die.
 From the dread summit of this chalky bourn.

  Glou.

  Edg.
  
  Glou.
 I do remember now.

  Edg.


         Enter Lear, mad, [fantastically dressed with weeds].

  
     But who comes here?
     The safer sense will ne'er accommodate
     His master thus.

  Edg.
 I know that voice.
 To say 'ay' and 'no' to everything I said! 'Ay' and
     'no' too was no good divinity.

     I pardon that man's life.

     The wren goes to't, and the small gilded fly
     Does lecher in my sight.

     Behold yond simp'ring dame,
     Whose face between her forks presageth snow,
     That minces virtue, and does shake the head
     To hear of pleasure's name.

  Glou.
 O ruin'd piece of nature! This great world
     Shall so wear out to naught.
 Read thou this
     challenge; mark but the penning of it.
 Were all the letters suns, I could not see one.

  Edg.
 [aside] I would not take this from report.
 It is,
     And my heart breaks at it.
 O, ho, are you there with me? No eyes in your head, nor no
     money in your purse? Your eyes are in a heavy case, your purse
     in a light.

  Glou.

     Look with thine ears.
 And the creature run from the cur? There thou mightst behold
     the great image of authority: a dog's obeyed in office.

     Thou hotly lusts to use her in that kind
     For which thou whip'st her.
 Plate sin with gold,  
     And the strong lance of justice hurtless breaks;
     Arm it in rags, a pygmy's straw does pierce it.

     None does offend, none- I say none! I'll able 'em.

  Edg.
 O, matter and impertinency mix'd!
     Reason, in madness!
  Lear.
 We came crying hither;
     Thou know'st, the first time that we smell the air
     We wawl and cry.

     It were a delicate stratagem to shoe
     A troop of horse with felt.


  Gent.
 O, here he is! Lay hand upon him.

  Lear.
 What!
     I will be jovial.
 A sight most pitiful in the meanest wretch,
     Past speaking of in a king! Thou hast one daughter
     Who redeems nature from the general curse
     Which twain have brought her to.
 But, by your favour,
     How near's the other army?
  Gent.
 You ever-gentle gods, take my breath from me;
     Let not my worser spirit tempt me again
     To die before you please!
  Edg.
 Now let thy friendly hand
     Put strength enough to't.
 Wherefore, bold peasant,
     Dar'st thou support a publish'd traitor? Hence!
     Lest that th' infection of his fortune take
     Like hold on thee.

  Osw.
 Let go, slave, or thou diest!
  Edg.
]  
  Osw.
 Slave, thou hast slain me.
 Villain, take my purse.
 A serviceable villain,
     As duteous to the vices of thy mistress
     As badness would desire.

     Leave, gentle wax; and, manners, blame us not.
 You have many
     opportunities to cut him off.
 Then am I the prisoner, and his bed my
     jail; from the loathed warmth whereof deliver me, and supply the
     place for your labour.

           'Your (wife, so I would say) affectionate servant,
                                                          'Goneril.
 How stiff is my vile sense,
     That I stand up, and have ingenious feeling
     Of my huge sorrows! Better I were distract.

                                                A drum afar off.

  Edg.

     Come, father, I'll bestow you with a friend.
        Exeunt.





Scene VII.

A tent in the French camp.


Enter Cordelia, Kent, Doctor, and Gentleman.
 O thou good Kent, how shall I live and work
     To match thy goodness? My life will be too short
     And every measure fail me.

  Cor.

     My boon I make it that you know me not
     Till time and I think meet.
 Then be't so, my good lord.
 In the heaviness of sleep
     We put fresh garments on him.

  Cor.

                                                          Music.

  Doct.

  Doct.
 Madam, do you; 'tis fittest.
 Where have I been? Where am I? Fair daylight,
     I am mightily abus'd.
 Let's see.
 Would I were assur'd
     Of my condition!
  Cor.

     No, sir, you must not kneel.

     If you have poison for me, I will drink it.

     You have some cause, they have not.
 In your own kingdom, sir.

  Lear.
 Do not abuse me.
 You must bear with me.

  Gent.
 Who is conductor of his people?
  Kent.
                                 [Exit.





<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.
 I am doubtful that you have been conjunct  
     And bosom'd with her, as far as we call hers.
 No, by mine honour, madam.
 Dear my lord,
     Be not familiar with her.

     Sir, this I hear: the King is come to his daughter,
     With others whom the rigour of our state
     Forc'd to cry out.
 For this business,
     It toucheth us as France invades our land,
     Not bolds the King, with others whom, I fear,
     Most just and heavy causes make oppose.
 Let's then determine
     With th' ancient of war on our proceeding.

  Reg.
 Pray you go with us.

  Gon.


          [As they are going out,] enter Edgar [disguised].


  Edg.
 I'll overtake you.
- Speak.

  Edg.
 If you miscarry,
     Your business of the world hath so an end,
     And machination ceases.
 The enemy 's in view; draw up your powers.
                             Exit.


Alarum within.
 What, in ill thoughts again? Men must endure
     Their going hence, even as their coming hither;
     Ripeness is all.

The British camp, near Dover.


  Edm.
 Some officers take them away.

     Shall we not see these daughters and these sisters?
  Lear.

     When thou dost ask me blessing, I'll kneel down
     And ask of thee forgiveness.

  Capt.


  Alb.
 Sir, you have show'd to-day your valiant strain,
     And fortune led you well.
 Sir, I thought it fit
     To send the old and miserable King
     To some retention and appointed guard;
     Whose age has charms in it, whose title more,  
     To pluck the common bosom on his side
     And turn our impress'd lances in our eyes
     Which do command them.

     The question of Cordelia and her father
     Requires a fitter place.

     Methinks our pleasure might have been demanded
     Ere you had spoke so far.
 Not so hot!
     In his own grace he doth exalt himself
     More than in your addition.
 In my rights
     By me invested, he compeers the best.

  Reg.

  Reg.

  Reg.

     If you will marry, make your loves to me;
     My lady is bespoke.
 There's my exchange [throws down a glove].

  Reg.
 She is not well.
 Let the trumpet sound,
     And read out this.


    Enter Edgar, armed, at the third sound, a Trumpet before him.
 Which is that adversary?
  Edg.
 [Edmund falls.
 Save him, save him!
  Gon.

     By th' law of arms thou wast not bound to answer
     An unknown opposite.
]
  Edm.
- But what art thou
     That hast this fortune on me? If thou'rt noble,
     I do forgive thee.

  Edm.
 Worthy prince, I know't.

  Edm.

  Edg.
 What means that bloody knife?
  Gent.
 Your lady, sir, your lady! and her sister
     By her is poisoned; she hath confess'd it.

  Edm.


  Edg.
 Here comes Kent.

  Alb.
  
     Is he not here?
  Alb.

  Edm.

  Alb.
 To who, my lord? Who has the office? Send
     Thy token of reprieve.


  Lear.
 She's gone for ever!
     I know when one is dead, and when one lives.
 Is this the promis'd end?
  Edg.
 Did I not, fellow?
     I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion
     I would have made them skip.
 I'll tell you straight.

  Kent.
 If fortune brag of two she lov'd and hated,  
     One of them we behold.

  Kent.
 Very bootless.

     You lords and noble friends, know our intent.

     What comfort to this great decay may come
     Shall be applied.
 Vex not his ghost.

  Edg.

     He but usurp'd his life.
>>






1595

LOVE'S LABOUR'S LOST

by William Shakespeare



Dramatis Personae.


  FERDINAND, King of Navarre
  BEROWNE,    lord attending on the King
  LONGAVILLE,  "      "      "   "   "
  DUMAIN,      "      "      "   "   "
  BOYET,   lord attending on the Princess of France
  MARCADE,   "     "       "  "     "      "    "
  DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO, fantastical Spaniard
  SIR NATHANIEL, a curate
  HOLOFERNES, a schoolmaster
  DULL, a constable
  COSTARD, a clown
  MOTH, page to Armado
  A FORESTER

  THE PRINCESS OF FRANCE
  ROSALINE, lady attending on the Princess
  MARIA,      "     "       "  "     "
  KATHARINE, lady attending on the Princess
  JAQUENETTA, a country wench
  
  Lords, Attendants, etc.

    You three, Berowne, Dumain, and Longaville,
    Have sworn for three years' term to live with me
    My fellow-scholars, and to keep those statutes  
    That are recorded in this schedule here.

    If you are arm'd to do as sworn to do,
    Subscribe to your deep oaths, and keep it too.

    Fat paunches have lean pates; and dainty bits
    Make rich the ribs, but bankrupt quite the wits.

  BEROWNE.

  KING.
 These be the stops that hinder study quite,
    And train our intellects to vain delight.

    These earthly godfathers of heaven's lights
    That give a name to every fixed star
    Have no more profit of their shining nights
    Than those that walk and wot not what they are.

  KING.

  BEROWNE.
 Well, sit out; go home, Berowne; adieu.
 Marry, that did I.
 A dangerous law against gentility.

    But is there no quick recreation granted?
  KING.

    This child of fancy, that Armado hight,
    For interim to our studies shall relate,
    In high-born words, the worth of many a knight
    From tawny Spain lost in the world's debate.

  LONGAVILLE.
 Costard the swain and he shall be our sport;
    And so to study three years is but short.
 What wouldst?
  DULL.

  DULL.

  KING.
 A letter from the magnificent Armado.

  COSTARD.
 In what manner?
  COSTARD.
 As we would hear an oracle.

  KING.
 [Reads] 'Great deputy, the welkin's vicegerent and sole
    dominator of Navarre, my soul's earth's god and body's fost'ring
    patron'-
  COSTARD.
 Not a word of Costard yet.
 [Reads] 'So it is'-
  COSTARD.
 [Reads] 'So it is, besieged with sable-coloured melancholy, I
    did commend the black oppressing humour to the most wholesome
    physic of thy health-giving air; and, as I am a gentleman, betook
    myself to walk.
 With a wench.
 'with a child of our grandmother Eve, a female; or, for thy
    more sweet understanding, a woman.
'
  DULL.

  KING.
 I do confess much of the hearing it, but little of the
    marking of it.

  COSTARD.

  KING.
 Well, it was proclaimed damsel.

  KING.
 It is so varied too, for it was proclaimed virgin.
 This 'maid' not serve your turn, sir.

  COSTARD.

  KING.

  COSTARD.
 I'll lay my head to any good man's hat
    These oaths and laws will prove an idle scorn.
 A great sign, sir, that he will look sad.

  ARMADO.

  ARMADO.
 I spoke it, tender juvenal, as a congruent epitheton
    appertaining to thy young days, which we may nominate tender.

  ARMADO.
 And therefore apt, because quick.
 In thy condign praise.

  MOTH.
 How many is one thrice told?
  ARMADO.
 You are a gentleman and a gamester, sir.
  
  MOTH.

  MOTH.
 True.

  ARMADO.
 If drawing
    my sword against the humour of affection would deliver me from
    the reprobate thought of it, I would take Desire prisoner, and
    ransom him to any French courtier for a new-devis'd curtsy.
 Hercules, master.
 Samson, master; he was a man of good carriage, great
    carriage, for he carried the town gates on his back like a
    porter; and he was in love.
 A woman, master.

  ARMADO.
 Of the sea-water green, sir.

  ARMADO.
 Most maculate thoughts, master, are mask'd under such
    colours.
 My father's wit my mother's tongue assist me!
  ARMADO.
 Sweet invocation of a child; most pretty, and pathetical!
  MOTH.

  ARMADO.
 Boy, I do love  
    that country girl that I took in the park with the rational hind
    Costard; she deserves well.
 Forbear till this company be past.
 Sir, the Duke's pleasure is that you keep Costard safe; and
    you must suffer him to take no delight nor no penance; but 'a
    must fast three days a week.

  ARMADO.

  ARMADO.

  JAQUENETTA.
 Come, Jaquenetta, away.
 Well, sir, I hope when I do it I shall do it on a full
    stomach.

  MOTH.

  COSTARD.
 I thank God I have as little patience as
    another man, and therefore I can be quiet.
 Adieu, valour; rust, rapier; be still, drum;
    for your manager is in love; yea, he loveth.

 Exit




<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.

The park

Enter the PRINCESS OF FRANCE, with three attending ladies,
ROSALINE, MARIA, KATHARINE, BOYET, and two other LORDS

  BOYET.

    Consider who the King your father sends,
    To whom he sends, and what's his embassy:
    Yourself, held precious in the world's esteem,
    To parley with the sole inheritor
    Of all perfections that a man may owe,
    Matchless Navarre; the plea of no less weight
    Than Aquitaine, a dowry for a queen.

    But now to task the tasker: good Boyet,
    You are not ignorant all-telling fame
    Doth noise abroad Navarre hath made a vow,
    Till painful study shall outwear three years,
    No woman may approach his silent court.

    Therefore to's seemeth it a needful course,
    Before we enter his forbidden gates,
    To know his pleasure; and in that behalf,
    Bold of your worthiness, we single you
    As our best-moving fair solicitor.
  
                                                      Exit BOYET
    Who are the votaries, my loving lords,
    That are vow-fellows with this virtuous duke?
  FIRST LORD.

    The only soil of his fair virtue's gloss,
    If virtue's gloss will stain with any soil,
    Is a sharp wit match'd with too blunt a will,
    Whose edge hath power to cut, whose will still wills
    It should none spare that come within his power.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.

  ROSALINE.
 God bless my ladies! Are they all in love,
    That every one her own hath garnished
    With such bedecking ornaments of praise?
  FIRST LORD.
 Here comes Boyet.
 The roof of this court is too high to be yours, and
    welcome to the wide fields too base to be mine.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.

  BEROWNE.

  KATHARINE.
 Your wit 's too hot, it speeds too fast, 'twill tire.

  KATHARINE.

  BEROWNE.
 Fair fall the face it covers!  
  BEROWNE.
 Nay, then will I be gone.
 You do the King my father too much wrong,
    And wrong the reputation of your name,
    In so unseeming to confess receipt
    Of that which hath so faithfully been paid.
 Satisfy me so.

    You may not come, fair Princess, within my gates;
    But here without you shall be so receiv'd
    As you shall deem yourself lodg'd in my heart,
    Though so denied fair harbour in my house.

                                            Exit with attendants
  BEROWNE.

  BEROWNE.
 I would you heard it groan.

  ROSALINE.

  BEROWNE.
 Would that do it good?
  ROSALINE.
'
  BEROWNE.
 The heir of Alencon, Katharine her name.
 She hath but one for herself; to desire that were a shame.

  LONGAVILLE.

  BOYET.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 It was well done of you to take him at his
    word.
 Two hot sheeps, marry!
  BOYET.
 Not so, gentle beast;
    My lips are no common, though several they be.
 Good wits will be jangling; but, gentles,
      agree;
    This civil war of wits were much better used
    On Navarre and his book-men, for here 'tis abused.

  BOYET.
 With that which we lovers entitle 'affected.

    His face's own margent did quote such amazes
    That all eyes saw his eyes enchanted with gazes.
 Then was Venus like her mother; for her father is but
    grim.

  BOYET.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.

                                         [MOTH sings Concolinel]
  ARMADO.
 No, my complete master; but to jig off a tune at the tongue's
    end, canary to it with your feet, humour it with turning up your
    eyelids, sigh a note and sing a note, sometime through the
    throat, as if you swallowed love with singing love, sometime
    through the nose, as if you snuff'd up love by smelling love,
    with your hat penthouse-like o'er the shop of your eyes, with
    your arms cross'd on your thin-belly doublet, like a rabbit on a
    spit, or your hands in your pocket, like a man after the old
    painting; and keep not too long in one tune, but a snip and away.

  ARMADO.
 By my penny of observation.
 And out of heart, master; all those three I will prove.
 By heart you love her, because your heart cannot come by
    her; in heart you love her, because your heart is in love with
    her; and out of heart you love her, being out of heart that you
    cannot enjoy her.
  
  MOTH.
 Minime, honest master; or rather, master, no.
    Until the goose came out of door,
           And stay'd the odds by adding four.

  ARMADO.
  Until the goose came out of door,
           Staying the odds by adding four.
 True, and I for a plantain.

  ARMADO.

    I, Costard, running out, that was safely within,
    Fell over the threshold and broke my shin.

  COSTARD.
 O, Marry me to one Frances! I smell some l'envoy, some
    goose, in this.
 I give thee thy liberty, set thee from durance; and, in  
    lieu thereof, impose on thee nothing but this: bear this
    significant [giving a letter] to the country maid Jaquenetta;
    there is remuneration, for the best ward of mine honour is
    rewarding my dependents.

    'What's the price of this inkle?'- 'One penny.
'- 'No, I'll give
    you a remuneration.
 I will never buy and sell out of
    this word.
 Pray you, sir, how much carnation ribbon may a man buy for
    a remuneration?
  BEROWNE.
 What is a remuneration?  
  COSTARD.

  BEROWNE.
 Why, then, three-farthing worth of silk.
 Well, I will do it, sir; fare you well.
 Thou knowest not what it is.
 I will come to your worship to-morrow morning.

  BEROWNE.
 Gardon, O sweet gardon! better than remuneration; a
    'leven-pence farthing better; most sweet gardon! I will do it,
    sir, in print.
 And I, forsooth, in love; I, that have been love's whip;
    A very beadle to a humorous sigh;
    A critic, nay, a night-watch constable;
    A domineering pedant o'er the boy,
    Than whom no mortal so magnificent!
    This wimpled, whining, purblind, wayward boy,
    This senior-junior, giant-dwarf, Dan Cupid;
    Regent of love-rhymes, lord of folded arms,
    Th' anointed sovereign of sighs and groans,
    Liege of all loiterers and malcontents,
    Dread prince of plackets, king of codpieces,
    Sole imperator, and great general
    Of trotting paritors.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 What, what? First praise me, and again say no?
    O short-liv'd pride! Not fair? Alack for woe!  
  FORESTER.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Nothing but fair is that which you inherit.

    O heresy in fair, fit for these days!
    A giving hand, though foul, shall have fair praise.
 Now mercy goes to kill,
    And shooting well is then accounted ill;
    Thus will I save my credit in the shoot:
    Not wounding, pity would not let me do't;
    If wounding, then it was to show my skill,
    That more for praise than purpose meant to kill.
 Do not curst wives hold that self-sovereignty
    Only for praise sake, when they strive to be
    Lords o'er their lords?
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.

  COSTARD.

    Stand aside, good bearer.
 Boyet, you can carve.

    This letter is mistook; it importeth none here.
 The
    magnanimous and most illustrate king Cophetua set eye upon the
    pernicious and indubitate beggar Zenelophon; and he it was that
    might rightly say, 'Veni, vidi, vici'; which to annothanize in
    the vulgar,- O base and obscure vulgar!- videlicet, He came, saw,  
    and overcame.

    To whom came he?- to the beggar.
 The captive is enrich'd; on whose side?- the
    beggar's.

                  Thine in the dearest design of industry,
                                           DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO.


    'Thus dost thou hear the Nemean lion roar
    'Gainst thee, thou lamb, that standest as his prey;
    Submissive fall his princely feet before,
    And he from forage will incline to play.
 I am much deceived but I remember the style.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Come, lords,  
      away.
 Shall I teach you to know?
  BOYET.

    Finely put off!
  BOYET.

    Finely put on!
  ROSALINE.
 And who is your deer?
  ROSALINE.
 Have I hit her now?
  ROSALINE.
 So I may answer thee with one as old, that was a woman when
    Queen Guinever of Britain was a little wench, as touching the hit
    it.
 [Singing]
            Thou canst not hit it, hit it, hit it,
            Thou canst not hit it, my good man.

  BOYET.
 A mark marvellous well shot; for they both did hit it.

  COSTARD.
 She's too hard for you at pricks, sir; challenge her to
    bowl.

  HOLOFERNES.
 The moon was a month old when Adam was no more,
    And raught not to five weeks when he came to five-score.

  NATHANIEL.
 I Will something affect the letter, for it argues
    facility.

  
    The preyful Princess pierc'd and prick'd a pretty pleasing
      pricket.
 A rare talent!
  DULL.
 But the gift is good in
    those in whom it is acute, and I am thankful for it.

  HOLOFERNES.
 Ah, good old Mantuan! I may speak of thee as
    the traveller doth of Venice:
                   Venetia, Venetia,
                   Chi non ti vede, non ti pretia.

    Old Mantuan, old Mantuan! Who understandeth thee not,
    loves thee not-
                      Ut, re, sol, la, mi, fa.

  NATHANIEL.

    If knowledge be the mark, to know thee shall suffice;  
    Well learned is that tongue that well can thee commend;
    All ignorant that soul that sees thee without wonder;
    Which is to me some praise that I thy parts admire.
 I will overglance the superscript: 'To the snow-white
    hand of the most beauteous Lady Rosaline.

  JAQUENETTA.
 Good Costard, go with me.
 Sir, God save your life!
  COSTARD.
 Have with thee, my girl.
 Marvellous well for the pen.

  NATHANIEL.

    [To DULL] Sir, I do invite you too; you shall not say me nay:
    pauca verba.
                                       Exeunt




SCENE III.

The park

Enter BEROWNE, with a paper his band, alone

  BEROWNE.
 The King he is hunting the deer: I am coursing myself.
 By the Lord, this love is as mad as Ajax: it kills
    sheep; it kills me- I a sheep.
 Well proved again o' my side.
 I' faith, I will not.
 Well, she hath one o' my sonnets already; the
    clown bore it, the fool sent it, and the lady hath it: sweet
    clown, sweeter fool, sweetest lady! By the world, I would not
    care a pin if the other three were in.
 Here comes one with a
    paper; God give him grace to groan!
                                            [Climbs into a tree]  

                      Enter the KING, with a paper

  KING.

      O queen of queens! how far dost thou excel
      No thought can think nor tongue of mortal tell.
 Who is he comes here?
                                                   [Steps aside]

                  Enter LONGAVILLE, with a paper

    What, Longaville, and reading! Listen, car.

  BEROWNE.
          [He reads the sonnet]
      'Did not the heavenly rhetoric of thine eye,
      'Gainst whom the world cannot hold argument,
      Persuade my heart to this false perjury?
      Vows for thee broke deserve not punishment.

      A woman I forswore; but I will prove,
      Thou being a goddess, I forswore not thee:
      My vow was earthly, thou a heavenly love;
      Thy grace being gain'd cures all disgrace in me.
 'All hid, all hid'- an old infant play.
 O most divine Kate!
  BEROWNE.
 By earth, she is not, corporal: there you lie.
good Lord!
  BEROWNE.
 I would forget her; but a fever she
    Reigns in my blood, and will rememb'red be.

        Do not call it sin in me
        That I am forsworn for thee;
        Thou for whom Jove would swear
        Juno but an Ethiope were;
        And deny himself for Jove,
        Turning mortal for thy love.

    O, would the King, Berowne and Longaville,
    Were lovers too! Ill, to example ill,
    Would from my forehead wipe a perjur'd note;
    For none offend where all alike do dote.
 'O Jove!' the other cries.

    What will Berowne say when that he shall hear
    Faith infringed which such zeal did swear?  
    How will he scorn, how will he spend his wit!
    How will he triumph, leap, and laugh at it!
    For all the wealth that ever I did see,
    I would not have him know so much by me.


                 Enter JAQUENETTA and COSTARD

  JAQUENETTA.
 God bless the King!
  KING.
 Some certain treason.
 Berowne, read it over.

  KING.
 It is Berowne's writing, and here is his name.

                                       [Gathering up the pieces]
  BEROWNE.
 Now the number is even.

  BEROWNE.

  KING.
 What, did these rent lines show some love of thine?
  BEROWNE.
  
  BEROWNE.

  BEROWNE.

  LONGAVILLE.
 And since her time are colliers counted bright.
 Dark needs no candles now, for dark is light.

  BEROWNE.
 Your mistresses dare never come in rain
    For fear their colours should be wash'd away.

  KING.

                                              [Showing his shoe]
  BEROWNE.

  KING.
 Ay, marry, there; some flattery for this evil.

  BEROWNE.

    For valour, is not Love a Hercules,
    Still climbing trees in the Hesperides?
    Subtle as Sphinx; as sweet and musical
    As bright Apollo's lute, strung with his hair.

    Never durst poet touch a pen to write
    Until his ink were temp'red with Love's sighs;
    O, then his lines would ravish savage ears,  
    And plant in tyrants mild humility.

    They sparkle still the right Promethean fire;
    They are the books, the arts, the academes,
    That show, contain, and nourish, all the world,
    Else none at all in aught proves excellent.

    For wisdom's sake, a word that all men love;
    Or for Love's sake, a word that loves all men;
    Or for men's sake, the authors of these women;
    Or women's sake, by whom we men are men-
    Let us once lose our oaths to find ourselves,
    Or else we lose ourselves to keep our oaths.

    It is religion to be thus forsworn;
    For charity itself fulfils the law,
    And who can sever love from charity?
  KING.
 Saint Cupid, then! and, soldiers, to the field!
  BEROWNE.
 Advance your standards, and upon them, lords;
    Pell-mell, down with them! be first advis'd,  
    In conflict, that you get the sun of them.

  BEROWNE.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
>>



ACT V.
 SCENE I.

  NATHANIEL.

    He clepeth a calf 'cauf,' half 'hauf'; neighbour vocatur
    'nebour'; 'neigh' abbreviated 'ne.

  NATHANIEL.
 Quare 'chirrah,' not 'sirrah'?
  ARMADO.

  HOLOFERNES.
 [Aside to COSTARD] They have been at a great feast of
    languages and stol'n the scraps.
  
  COSTARD.

  MOTH.
 Quis, quis, thou consonant?
  MOTH.

  MOTH.
 Lend me your horn to make one, and I will whip about your
    infamy circum circa- a gig of a cuckold's horn.
 O, I smell false Latin; 'dunghill' for unguem.
 Or mons, the hill.

  ARMADO.

  ARMADO.
 Joshua, yourself; myself, Alexander; this gallant
    gentleman, Judas Maccabaeus; this swain, because of his great
    limb or joint, shall pass Pompey the Great; the page, Hercules.
 An excellent device! So, if any of the audience hiss, you may
    cry 'Well done, Hercules; now thou crushest the snake!' That is
    the way to make an offence gracious, though few have the grace to
    do it.

  DULL.
 Nor understood none neither, sir.

  HOLOFERNES.

                                                          Exeunt




SCENE II.
 Madam, came nothing else along with that?
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 That was the way to make his godhead wax;
    For he hath been five thousand year a boy.

  ROSALINE.
 A light condition in a beauty dark.
 We need more light to find your meaning out.

  ROSALINE.

  KATHARINE.
 Indeed, I weigh not you; and therefore light.
 Well bandied both; a set of wit well play'd.

    An if my face were but as fair as yours,
    My favour were as great: be witness this.

  KATHARINE.
 Did he not send you twain?
  KATHARINE.
 I think no less.
 We are wise girls to mock our lovers so.

    That same Berowne I'll torture ere I go.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 The blood of youth burns not with such excess  
    As gravity's revolt to wantonness.

    Their herald is a pretty knavish page,
    That well by heart hath conn'd his embassage.

    With that they all did tumble on the ground,
    With such a zealous laughter, so profound,
    That in this spleen ridiculous appears,
    To check their folly, passion's solemn tears.
 But, in this changing, what is your intent?
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 The effect of my intent is to cross theirs.
 But shall we dance, if they desire us to't?
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Their eyes, villain, their eyes.
 True; out indeed.
 Once to behold, rogue.

  MOTH.
 They will not answer to that epithet;
    You were best call it 'daughter-beamed eyes.

                                                       Exit MOTH
  ROSALINE.
 What would you with the Princess?
  BEROWNE.
 What would they, say they?  
  BOYET.

  ROSALINE.

  BEROWNE.
 We number nothing that we spend for you;
    Our duty is so rich, so infinite,  
    That we may do it still without accompt.

  ROSALINE.
 Then in our measure do but vouchsafe one change.

  KING.
 Will you not dance? How come you thus estranged?
  ROSALINE.
 You took the moon at full; but now she's changed.
 Yet still she is the Moon, and I the Man.

  ROSALINE.
 We will not dance.

  ROSALINE.

  KING.
 Price you yourselves.
 That can never be.

  BEROWNE.
 Seventh sweet, adieu!  
    Since you can cog, I'll play no more with you.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Gall! bitter.
                 [They converse apart]
  DUMAIN.

  LONGAVILLE.

  KATHARINE.
  
                             Exeunt KING, LORDS, and BLACKAMOORS
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 O poverty in wit, kingly-poor flout!
    Will they not, think you, hang themselves to-night?
    Or ever but in vizards show their faces?
    This pert Berowne was out of count'nance quite.

  ROSALINE.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Berowne did swear himself out of all suit.
 Lord Longaville said I came o'er his heart;
    And trow you what he call'd me?
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Qualm, perhaps.
 Yes, in good faith.
 Go, sickness as thou art!
  ROSALINE.

  MARIA.
 Dumain is mine, as sure as bark on tree.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Ladies, withdraw; the gallants are at hand.
 Fair sir, God save you! Where's the Princess?
  BOYET.
 That she vouchsafe me audience for one word.
 I will; and so will she, I know, my lord.
 See where it comes! Behaviour, what wert thou
    Till this man show'd thee? And what art thou now?
  KING.
 All hail, sweet madam, and fair time of day!
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 How, madam! Russians!
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 This jest is dry to me.
 I am a fool, and full of poverty.

  ROSALINE.
 We were descried; they'll mock us now downright.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Thus pour the stars down plagues for perjury.

    Can any face of brass hold longer out?
    Here stand I, lady- dart thy skill at me,
    Bruise me with scorn, confound me with a flout,
    Thrust thy sharp wit quite through my ignorance,
    Cut me to pieces with thy keen conceit;
    And I will wish thee never more to dance,
    Nor never more in Russian habit wait.

    O, never will I trust to speeches penn'd,
    Nor to the motion of a school-boy's tongue,
    Nor never come in vizard to my friend,
    Nor woo in rhyme, like a blind harper's song.

  BEROWNE.

    These lords are visited; you are not free,
    For the Lord's tokens on you do I see.
 Our states are forfeit; seek not to undo us.
 Nor shall not, if I do as I intend.

  BEROWNE.

    Were not you here but even now, disguis'd?
  KING.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.

  KING.
 By heaven, you did; and, to confirm it plain,
    You gave me this; but take it, sir, again.

    What, will you have me, or your pearl again?
 BEROWNE.
 Neither of either; I remit both twain.

    Now, to our perjury to add more terror,
    We are again forsworn in will and error.
 O Lord, sir, they would know
     Whether the three Worthies shall come in or no?
  BEROWNE.
 Not so, sir; under correction, sir,
    I hope it is not so.
 Is not nine.

  BEROWNE.
 Art thou one of the Worthies?
  COSTARD.
 Go, bid them prepare.

  COSTARD.
 Berowne, they will shame us; let them not approach.
 We are shame-proof, my lord, and 'tis some policy
    To have one show worse than the King's and his company.
 I say they shall not come.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.

  BEROWNE.
 'A speaks not like a man of God his making.

  BEROWNE.
 There is five in the first show.

  BEROWNE.
 The ship is under sail, and here she comes amain.
 You lie, you are not he.
 I Pompey am-
  BOYET.

  BEROWNE.
 My hat to a halfpenny, Pompey proves the best Worthy.
 When in the world I liv'd, I was the world's commander;
    By east, west, north, and south, I spread my conquering might.
 Your nose says, no, you are not; for it stands to right.
 Proceed, good
    Alexander.
 When in the world I liv'd, I was the world's commander-
  BOYET.
 Your servant, and Costard.

  COSTARD.
 Judas Maccabaeus clipt is plain Judas.
 I will not be put out of countenance.

  HOLOFERNES.

  DUMAIN.

  BEROWNE.

  LONGAVILLE.
  
    And so adieu, sweet Jude! Nay, why dost thou stay?
  DUMAIN.

  DUMAIN.

  KING.
 But is this Hector?
  DUMAIN.
 His leg is too big for Hector's.
  
  ARMADO.
 The armipotent Mars, of lances the almighty,
    Gave Hector a gift-
  DUMAIN.

  DUMAIN.
 No, cloven.
 That columbine.
 Ay, and Hector's a greyhound.

  DUMAIN.
 Dost thou infamonize me among potentates? Thou shalt die.

  COSTARD.

  BEROWNE.
 Room for the incensed Worthies!
  COSTARD.
 Do you not see
    Pompey is uncasing for the combat? What mean you? You will lose
    your reputation.
 Gentlemen and soldiers, pardon me; I will not combat in my  
    shirt.
 The naked truth of it is: I have no shirt; I go woolward
    for penance.
 God save you, madam!
  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.
 Madam, not so; I do beseech you stay.
 Farewell, worthy lord.

    And though the mourning brow of progeny
    Forbid the smiling courtesy of love
    The holy suit which fain it would convince,
    Yet, since love's argument was first on foot,
    Let not the cloud of sorrow justle it
    From what it purpos'd; since to wail friends lost
    Is not by much so wholesome-profitable
    As to rejoice at friends but newly found.
 We have receiv'd your letters, full of love;
    Your favours, the ambassadors of love;
    And, in our maiden council, rated them
    At courtship, pleasant jest, and courtesy,
    As bombast and as lining to the time;
    But more devout than this in our respects  
    Have we not been; and therefore met your loves
    In their own fashion, like a merriment.
 Now, at the latest minute of the hour,
    Grant us your loves.

  PRINCESS OF FRANCE.

  KING.
 I'll serve thee true and faithfully till then.
 Oft have I heard of you, my Lord Berowne,
    Before I saw you; and the world's large tongue
    Proclaims you for a man replete with mocks,
    Full of comparisons and wounding flouts,
    Which you on all estates will execute
    That lie within the mercy of your wit.
 Was not that not Hector?
  DUMAIN.
 I will kiss thy royal finger, and take leave.
 I am a
    votary: I have vow'd to Jaquenetta to hold the plough for her
    sweet love three year.
 But, most esteemed greatness, will you
    hear the dialogue that the two learned men have compiled in
    praise of the Owl and the Cuckoo? It should have followed in the
    end of our show.

  ARMADO.


         When all aloud the wind doth blow,
         And coughing drowns the parson's saw,
         And birds sit brooding in the snow,
         And Marian's nose looks red and raw,
         When roasted crabs hiss in the bowl,  
         Then nightly sings the staring owl:
              'Tu-who;
         Tu-whit, To-who'- A merry note,
         While greasy Joan doth keel the pot.
  PROHIBITED COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION INCLUDES BY ANY
SERVICE THAT CHARGES FOR DOWNLOAD TIME OR FOR MEMBERSHIP.
 When the hurlyburly's done,
    When the battle's lost and won.

  THIRD WITCH.
 That will be ere the set of sun.
 Where the place?
  SECOND WITCH.
 Upon the heath.

  FIRST WITCH.
 What bloody man is that? He can report,
    As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt
    The newest state.

  MALCOLM.

    If I say sooth, I must report they were
    As cannons overcharged with double cracks,
    So they
    Doubly redoubled strokes upon the foe.

                                        Exit Sergeant, attended.

  DUNCAN.
 Great happiness!
  ROSS.
 Go pronounce his present death,
    And with his former title greet Macbeth.
 I'll see it done.

  DUNCAN.

A heath.
 Thunder.

    Her husband's to Aleppo gone, master the Tiger;
    But in a sieve I'll thither sail,
    And, like a rat without a tail,
    I'll do, I'll do, and I'll do.
 Thou'rt kind.
 And I another.
 Show me, show me.
 A drum, a drum!
    Macbeth doth come.
  

                 Enter Macbeth and Banquo.

  BANQUO.
 You should be women,
    And yet your beards forbid me to interpret
    That you are so.
 All hail, Macbeth, hail to thee, Thane of Cawdor!
  THIRD WITCH.
 Good sir, why do you start, and seem to fear
    Things that do sound so fair? I' the name of truth,
    Are ye fantastical or that indeed  
    Which outwardly ye show? My noble partner
    You greet with present grace and great prediction
    Of noble having and of royal hope,
    That he seems rapt withal.
 Hail!
  FIRST WITCH.

    By Sinel's death I know I am Thane of Glamis;
    But how of Cawdor? The Thane of Cawdor lives,
    A prosperous gentleman; and to be King  
    Stands not within the prospect of belief,
    No more than to be Cawdor.
 Were such things here as we do speak about?
    Or have we eaten on the insane root
    That takes the reason prisoner?
  MACBETH.

  MACBETH.
 And Thane of Cawdor too.

  MACBETH.

    [Aside to Banquo] Do you not hope your children shall be kings,
    When those that gave the Thane of Cawdor to me
    Promised no less to them?
  BANQUO.

    [Aside.
 [Aside.
] If chance will have me King, why, chance may
      crown me
    Without my stir.
 Worthy Macbeth, we stay upon your leisure.

  BANQUO.
 Come, friends.





SCENE IV.
 Enter Duncan, Malcolm, Donalbain, Lennox, and Attendants.
 Nothing in his life
    Became him like the leaving it; he died
    As one that had been studied in his death,
    To throw away the dearest thing he owed
    As 'twere a careless trifle.
 The service and the loyalty lowe,
    In doing it, pays itself.

  DUNCAN.

  DUNCAN.
 Sons, kinsmen, thanes,
    And you whose places are the nearest, know
    We will establish our estate upon
    Our eldest, Malcolm, whom we name hereafter
    The Prince of Cumberland; which honor must
    Not unaccompanied invest him only,
    But signs of nobleness, like stars, shall shine
    On all deservers.
 The rest is labor, which is not used for you.

  DUNCAN.
 Let's after him,
    Whose care is gone before to bid us welcome.
 The King comes here tonight.
                        Exit Messenger.
 My dearest love,
    Duncan comes here tonight.

  MACBETH.
                            Exeunt.





SCENE VI.


  DUNCAN.
 This castle hath a pleasant seat; the air
    Nimbly and sweetly recommends itself
    Unto our gentle senses.
 No jutty, frieze,
    Buttress, nor coign of vantage, but this bird
    Hath made his pendant bed and procreant cradle;
    Where they most breed and haunt, I have observed
    The air is delicate.


  DUNCAN.
 Herein I teach you
    How you shall bid God 'ield us for your pains,
    And thank us for your trouble.
 Fair and noble hostess,
    We are your guest tonight.
 We love him highly,
    And shall continue our graces towards him.
                              Exeunt.





SCENE VII
Macbeth's castle.


Enter a Sewer and divers Servants with dishes and service, who pass over
the stage.
  Then enter Macbeth.


  MACBETH.
 Why have you left the chamber?
  MACBETH.
 We will proceed no further in this business:
    He hath honor'd me of late, and I have bought
    Golden opinions from all sorts of people,
    Which would be worn now in their newest gloss,
    Not cast aside so soon.
 Art thou afeard
    To be the same in thine own act and valor
    As thou art in desire? Wouldst thou have that
    Which thou esteem'st the ornament of life
    And live a coward in thine own esteem,
    Letting "I dare not" wait upon "I would"
    Like the poor cat i' the adage?
  MACBETH.

  LADY MACBETH.
 What beast wast then  
    That made you break this enterprise to me?
    When you durst do it, then you were a man,
    And, to be more than what you were, you would
    Be so much more the man.
 When Duncan is asleep-
    Whereto the rather shall his day's hard journey
    Soundly invite him- his two chamberlains
    Will I with wine and wassail so convince
    That memory, the warder of the brain,  
    Shall be a fume and the receipt of reason
    A limbeck only.
 Who dares receive it other,
    As we shall make our griefs and clamor roar
    Upon his death?
  MACBETH.
 I am settled and bend up
    Each corporal agent to this terrible feat.

Inverness.


Enter Banquo and Fleance, bearing a torch before him.
 Take thee that too.
 A friend.

    This diamond he greets your wife withal,
    By the name of most kind hostess, and shut up
    In measureless content.

  BANQUO.
 All's well.

  MACBETH.
 If you shall cleave to my consent, when 'tis,
    It shall make honor for you.

  BANQUO.
 Good repose the while.

                                     Exeunt Banquo.

    I have thee not, and yet I see thee still.

    Art thou not, fatal vision, sensible
    To feeling as to sight? Or art thou but
    A dagger of the mind, a false creation,
    Proceeding from the heat-oppressed brain?
    I see thee yet, in form as palpable
    As this which now I draw.

    Thou marshal'st me the way that I was going,
    And such an instrument I was to use.
 There's no such thing:
    It is the bloody business which informs
    Thus to mine eyes.

                                                   A bell rings.

    I go, and it is done; the bell invites me.


Enter Lady Macbeth.
 Hark! Peace!
    It was the owl that shriek'd, the fatal bellman,
    Which gives the stern'st good night.

  MACBETH.
 Hark! I laid their daggers ready;
    He could not miss 'em.
 Hark!
    Who lies i' the second chamber?
  LADY MACBETH.

  LADY MACBETH.
 I stood and heard them,
    But they did say their prayers and address'd them
    Again to sleep.
 There are two lodged together.

  MACBETH.
 But wherefore could not I pronounce "Amen"?
    I had most need of blessing, and "Amen"
    Stuck in my throat.

    I am afraid to think what I have done;
    Look on't again I dare not.
 The sleeping and the dead
    Are but as pictures; 'tis the eye of childhood
    That fears a painted devil.


  LADY MACBETH.
] I hear knocking
    At the south entry.
] Hark, more knocking.

  MACBETH.

The same.
 Come
    in time! Have napkins enow about you; here you'll sweat fort.

                                                 Opens the gate.
 Therefore much drink may be said to be an
    equivocator with lechery: it makes him, and it mars him; it sets
    him on, and it takes him off; it persuades him and disheartens
    him; makes him stand to and not stand to; in conclusion,
    equivocates him in a sleep, and giving him the lie, leaves him.
 That it did, sir, i' the very throat on me; but requited
    him for his lie, and, I think, being too strong for him, though  
    he took up my legs sometime, yet I made shift to cast him.

  LENNOX.

  MACBETH.

  MACBETH.

    This is the door.
 My young remembrance cannot parallel
    A fellow to it.


                      Re-enter Macduff.
 Mean you his Majesty?
  MACDUFF.


                     Enter Lady Macbeth.


  LADY MACBETH.

    Dear Duff, I prithee, contradict thyself,
    And say it is not so.
 You are, and do not know't.

   MALCOLM.

    They stared, and were distracted; no man's life
    Was to be trusted with them.
  
  MACBETH.
 O, yet I do repent me of my fury,
    That I did kill them.
 Wherefore did you so?
  MACBETH.
 Help me hence, ho!
  MACDUFF.

  BANQUO.
 Look to the lady.
 Let's briefly put on manly readiness
    And meet i' the hall together.

                           Exeunt all but Malcolm and Donalbain.
  
  MALCOLM.
 Where we are
    There's daggers in men's smiles; the near in blood,
    The nearer bloody.
 This murtherous shaft that's shot
    Hath not yet lighted, and our safest way
    Is to avoid the aim.
 There's warrant in that theft
    Which steals itself when there's no mercy left.





SCENE IV.

Outside Macbeth's castle.


  OLD MAN.
 Ah, good father,
    Thou seest the heavens, as troubled with man's act,
    Threaten his bloody stage.

  OLD MAN.


    Here comes the good Macduff.
 Is't known who did this more than bloody deed?
  MACDUFF.
 Alas, the day!
    What good could they pretend?
  MACDUFF.
 Well, may you see things well done there.

    Adieu,
    Lest our old robes sit easier than our new!
  ROSS.
 SCENE I.
 Here's our chief guest.

  MACBETH.
 We should have else desired your good advice,
    Which still hath been both grave and prosperous
    In this day's council; but we'll take tomorrow.

  MACBETH.

  BANQUO.
                                       Exit Banquo.

    Let every man be master of his time
    Till seven at night; to make society
    The sweeter welcome, we will keep ourself
    Till supper time alone.
 While then, God be with you!
                        Exeunt all but Macbeth and an Attendant.
 Attend those men
    Our pleasure?
  ATTENDANT.
                 Exit Attendant.
 Our fears in Banquo.


    Now go to the door, and stay there till we call.
 You made it known to us.
 Do you find
    Your patience so predominant in your nature,
    That you can let this go? Are you so gospel'd,
    To pray for this good man and for his issue,
    Whose heavy hand hath bow'd you to the grave
    And beggar'd yours forever?
  FIRST MURTHERER.
 We are men, my liege.
 The valued file
    Distinguishes the swift, the slow, the subtle,
    The housekeeper, the hunter, every one
    According to the gift which bounteous nature
    Hath in him closed, whereby he does receive
    Particular addition, from the bill
    That writes them all alike; and so of men.

  MACBETH.
 I'll call upon you straight.
 Abide within.
           Exit.
 Nought's had, all's spent,
    Where our desire is got without content.


                    Enter Macbeth.
 Duncan is in his grave;
    After life's fitful fever he sleeps well.

    Treason has done his worst; nor steel, nor poison,
    Malice domestic, foreign levy, nothing,
    Can touch him further.

  MACBETH.
 So shall I, love, and so, I pray, be you.

    Let your remembrance apply to Banquo;
    Present him eminence, both with eye and tongue:  
    Unsafe the while, that we
    Must lave our honors in these flattering streams,
    And make our faces vizards to our hearts,
    Disguising what they are.
 You must leave this.
 But in them nature's copy's not eterne.

A park near the palace.


Enter three Murtherers.

  FIRST MURTHERER.

  THIRD MURTHERER.

  FIRST MURTHERER.

  THIRD MURTHERER.
 Almost a mile, but he does usually-  
    So all men do -from hence to the palace gate
    Make it their walk.

  BANQUO.
 Fleance escapes.
 Wast not the way?
  THIRD MURTHERER.
 A banquet prepared.


  MACBETH.

  LORDS.
 Thanks to your Majesty.
 Pronounce it for me, sir, to all our friends,
    For my heart speaks they are welcome.

    Both sides are even; here I'll sit i' the midst.

  MURTHERER.

  MACBETH.
 If thou didst it,
    Thou art the nonpareil.

  MURTHERER.
 I had else been perfect,
    Whole as the marble, founded as the rock,
    As broad and general as the casing air;
    But now I am cabin'd, cribb'd, confin'd, bound in
    To saucy doubts and fears -But Banquo's safe?
  MURTHERER.
 My royal lord,
    You do not give the cheer.


      The Ghost of Banquo enters and sits in Macbeth's place.

  MACBETH.
 What is't that moves your Highness?
  MACBETH.
 Gentlemen, rise; his Highness is well.

  LADY MACBETH.
 Sit, worthy friends; my lord is often thus,
    And hath been from his youth.

    The fit is momentary; upon a thought
    He will again be well.

  LADY MACBETH.

    Why, so, being gone,
    I am a man again.
 Pray you sit still.

  ROSS.
 I am in blood
    Stepp'd in so far that, should I wade no more,
    Returning were as tedious as go o'er.
 You lack the season of all natures, sleep.

    We are yet but young in deed.
 Why, how now, Hecate? You look angerly.
  
    Your vessels and your spells provide,
    Your charms and everything beside.

    He shall spurn fate, scorn death, and bear
    His hopes 'bove wisdom, grace, and fear.
 The gracious Duncan
    Was pitied of Macbeth; marry, he was dead.

    And the right valiant Banquo walk'd too late,
    Whom, you may say, if't please you, Fleance kill'd,
    For Fleance fled.
 Men must not walk too late.
 So that, I say,
    He has borne all things well; and I do think  
    That, had he Duncan's sons under his key-
    As, an't please heaven, he shall not -they should find
    What 'twere to kill a father; so should Fleance.

    But, peace! For from broad words, and 'cause he fail'd
    His presence at the tyrant's feast, I hear,
    Macduff lives in disgrace.
 The son of Duncan,
    From whom this tyrant holds the due of birth,
    Lives in the English court and is received
    Of the most pious Edward with such grace
    That the malevolence of fortune nothing
    Takes from his high respect.

  LENNOX.
"
  LENNOX.
 Some holy angel
    Fly to the court of England and unfold
    His message ere he come, that a swift blessing
    May soon return to this our suffering country
    Under a hand accursed!
  LORD.
 I'll send my prayers with him.
  ELECTRONIC AND MACHINE READABLE COPIES MAY BE
DISTRIBUTED SO LONG AS SUCH COPIES (1) ARE FOR YOUR OR OTHERS
PERSONAL USE ONLY, AND (2) ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED OR USED
COMMERCIALLY.
 SCENE I.
 Thrice and once the hedge-pig whined.

  THIRD WITCH.
 Double, double, toil and trouble;
    Fire burn and cauldron bubble.

    And now about the cauldron sing,
    Like elves and fairies in a ring,
    Enchanting all that you put in.
 How now, you secret, black, and midnight hags?
    What is't you do?
  ALL.
 A deed without a name.

  FIRST WITCH.
 Enough.
 But one word more-
  FIRST WITCH.
 Here's another,
    More potent than the first.


          Thunder.
 That will never be.
 Yet my heart
    Throbs to know one thing: tell me, if your art
    Can tell so much, shall Banquo's issue ever
    Reign in this kingdom?
  ALL.


  MACBETH.
 Filthy hags!
    Why do you show me this? A fourth! Start, eyes!
    What, will the line stretch out to the crack of doom?
    Another yet! A seventh! I'll see no more!
    And yet the eighth appears, who bears a glass
    Which shows me many more; and some I see
    That twofold balls and treble sceptres carry.
 What, is this so?
  FIRST WITCH.

    I'll charm the air to give a sound,
    While you perform your antic round,
    That this great King may kindly say
    Our duties did his welcome pay.
 The Witches dance and
                                        then vanish with Hecate.
 No, my lord.
 'Tis two or three, my lord, that bring you word
    Macduff is fled to England.
 No boasting like a fool;
    This deed I'll do before this purpose cool.
  
    But no more sights! -Where are these gentlemen?
    Come, bring me where they are.





SCENE II.
 When our actions do not,
    Our fears do make us traitors.

  ROSS.
 My dearest coz,  
    I pray you, school yourself.
 I dare not speak much further;
    But cruel are the times when we are traitors
    And do not know ourselves; when we hold rumor
    From what we fear, yet know not what we fear,
    But float upon a wild and violent sea
    Each way and move.
 My pretty cousin,
    Blessing upon you!
  LADY MACDUFF.

  ROSS.
 As birds do, Mother.
 What, with worms and flies?  
  SON.

  LADY MACDUFF.

    My father is not dead, for all your saying.
 Thou speak'st with all thy wit, and yet, i' faith,
    With wit enough for thee.

  SON.
 Poor prattler, how thou talk'st!

                    Enter a Messenger.
 Heaven preserve you!  
    I dare abide no longer.
 Why then, alas,
    Do I put up that womanly defense,
    To say I have done no harm -What are these faces?

                      Enter Murtherers.

                            Exit Lady Macduff, crying "Murther!"
                               Exeunt Murtherers, following her.
 Let us seek out some desolate shade and there
    Weep our sad bosoms empty.
 Let us rather
    Hold fast the mortal sword, and like good men
    Bestride our downfall'n birthdom.
 You have loved him well;
    He hath not touch'd you yet.

  MALCOLM.
 Be not offended;
    I speak not as in absolute fear of you.

  MACDUFF.
 But there's no bottom, none,
    In my voluptuousness.
 Your wives, your daughters,
    Your matrons, and your maids could not fill up
    The cestern of my lust, and my desire
    All continent impediments would o'erbear
    That did oppose my will.
 Yet do not fear;
    Scotland hath foisons to fill up your will
    Of your mere own.
 All these are portable,
    With other graces weigh'd.
 But I have none.
 O nation miserable!  
    With an untitled tyrant bloody-scepter'd,
    When shalt thou see thy wholesome days again,
    Since that the truest issue of thy throne
    By his own interdiction stands accursed
    And does blaspheme his breed? Thy royal father
    Was a most sainted king; the queen that bore thee,
    Oftener upon her knees than on her feet,
    Died every day she lived.
 Devilish Macbeth
    By many of these trains hath sought to win me
    Into his power, and modest wisdom plucks me
    From over-credulous haste.
 But God above
    Deal between thee and me! For even now
    I put myself to thy direction and  
    Unspeak mine own detraction; here abjure
    The taints and blames I laid upon myself,
    For strangers to my nature.
 What's the disease he means?
  MALCOLM.
 How he solicits heaven,
    Himself best knows; but strangely-visited people,
    All swol'n and ulcerous, pitiful to the eye,
    The mere despair of surgery, he cures,
    Hanging a golden stamp about their necks
    Put on with holy prayers; and 'tis spoken,
    To the succeeding royalty he leaves
    The healing benediction.

  MACDUFF.
 The tyrant has not batter'd at their peace?
  ROSS.

    Now is the time of help; your eye in Scotland  
    Would create soldiers, make our women fight,
    To doff their dire distresses.

  ROSS.

  MACDUFF.
 Let not your ears despise my tongue forever,  
    Which shall possess them with the heaviest sound
    That ever yet they heard.
 Your castle is surprised; your wife and babes
    Savagely slaughter'd.
 To relate the manner
    Were, on the quarry of these murther'd deer,
    To add the death of you.
 The grief that does not speak
    Whispers the o'erfraught heart, and bids it break.
 Wife, children, servants, all
    That could be found.
 I have said.

    Let's make us medicines of our great revenge,
    To cure this deadly grief.
 He has no children.
 Dispute it like a man.
 I shall do so,
    But I must also feel it as a man.

    Come, go we to the King; our power is ready,
    Our lack is nothing but our leave.





<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.
 Since his Majesty went into the field, have seen her
    rise from her bed, throw her nightgown upon her, unlock her
    closet, take forth paper, fold it, write upon't, read it,
    afterwards seal it, and again return to bed; yet all this while
    in a most fast sleep.


                Enter Lady Macbeth with a taper.
 Why, it stood by her.
 She has light by her
     continually; 'tis her command.

  GENTLEWOMAN.

  GENTLEWOMAN.
 It is an accustomed action with her, to seem thus
    washing her hands.

  LADY MACBETH.

  LADY MACBETH.

  DOCTOR.
 Come,
    come, come, come, give me your hand.
What's done cannot be undone.
 Unnatural deeds
    Do breed unnatural troubles; infected minds
    To their deaf pillows will discharge their secrets.

                                                         Exeunt.

The country near Dunsinane.
 Drum and colors.
 Near Birnam Wood
    Shall we well meet them; that way are they coming.
 There is Seward's son
    And many unrough youths that even now
    Protest their first of manhood.

    Some say he's mad; others, that lesser hate him,
    Do call it valiant fury; but, for certain,
    He cannot buckle his distemper'd cause  
    Within the belt of rule.
 Now does he feel
    His secret murthers sticking on his hands,
    Now minutely revolts upbraid his faith-breach;
    Those he commands move only in command,
    Nothing in love.
 Well, march we on
    To give obedience where 'tis truly owed.

    Make we our march towards Birnam.


Enter Macbeth, Doctor, and Attendants.
 Bring me no more reports; let them fly all!
    Till Birnam Wood remove to Dunsinane
    I cannot taint with fear.
" Then fly, false Thanes,
    And mingle with the English epicures!
    The mind I sway by and the heart I bear
    Shall never sag with doubt nor shake with fear.


    The devil damn thee black, thou cream-faced loon!
    Where got'st thou that goose look?
  SERVANT.
 There is ten thousand-
  MACBETH.
 Go prick thy face and over-red thy fear,
    Thou lily-liver'd boy.
 I'll put it on.
 Give me mine armor.

  MACBETH.
 Throw physic to the dogs, I'll none of it.

    Come, put mine armor on; give me my staff.
 Ay, my good lord, your royal preparation
    Makes us hear something.
] Were I from Dunsinane away and clear,
    Profit again should hardly draw me here.





SCENE IV.
 Drum and colors.
 We doubt it nothing.
 It shall be done.

  SIWARD.

  MALCOLM.

  MACDUFF.


  MACBETH.
 It is the cry of women, my good lord.

  MACBETH.

  MACBETH.

  MACBETH.
 If thou speak'st false,
    Upon the next tree shalt thou hang alive,
    Till famine cling thee; if thy speech be sooth,
    I care not if thou dost for me as much.


  MALCOLM.
 Worthy Macduff and we
    Shall take upon 's what else remains to do,
    According to our order.





SCENE VII.
  Before the castle.
  Alarums.


Enter Macbeth.
 What's he
    That was not born of woman? Such a one
    Am I to fear, or none.

  YOUNG SIWARD.
 No, though thou call'st thyself a hotter name
    Than any is in hell.
 No, nor more fearful.
              Exit.
 That way the noise is.

    I cannot strike at wretched kerns, whose arms
    Are hired to bear their staves.
 Either thou, Macbeth,
    Or else my sword, with an unbatter'd edge,
    I sheathe again undeeded.
 We have met with foes
    That strike beside us.

  SIWARD.


Enter Macbeth.


                      Enter Macduff.

  MACDUFF.
 I have no words.

    My voice is in my sword, thou bloodier villain
    Than terms can give thee out!                    They fight.
 I will not yield,
    To kiss the ground before young Malcolm's feet,
    And to be baited with the rabble's curse.
 Your son, my lord, has paid a soldier's debt.
 Ay, and brought off the field.

  SIWARD.
 Why then, God's soldier be he!
    Had I as many sons as I have hairs,  
    I would not wish them to a fairer death.
 He's worth more sorrow,
    And that I'll spend for him.


             Re-enter Macduff, with Macbeth's head.
 My Thanes and kinsmen,  
    Henceforth be Earls, the first that ever Scotland
    In such an honor named.
 What's more to do,
    Which would be planted newly with the time,
    As calling home our exiled friends abroad
    That fled the snares of watchful tyranny,
    Producing forth the cruel ministers
    Of this dead butcher and his fiend-like queen,
    Who, as 'tis thought, by self and violent hands
    Took off her life; this, and what needful else
    That calls upon us, by the grace of Grace
    We will perform in measure, time, and place.
>>





1605


MEASURE FOR MEASURE

by William Shakespeare



DRAMATIS PERSONAE

  VINCENTIO, the Duke
  ANGELO, the Deputy
  ESCALUS, an ancient Lord
  CLAUDIO, a young gentleman
  LUCIO, a fantastic
  Two other like Gentlemen
  VARRIUS, a gentleman, servant to the Duke
  PROVOST
  THOMAS, friar
  PETER, friar
  A JUSTICE
  ELBOW, a simple constable
  FROTH, a foolish gentleman
  POMPEY, a clown and servant to Mistress Overdone
  ABHORSON, an executioner
  BARNARDINE, a dissolute prisoner

  ISABELLA, sister to Claudio
  MARIANA, betrothed to Angelo
  JULIET, beloved of Claudio  
  FRANCISCA, a nun
  MISTRESS OVERDONE, a bawd

  Lords, Officers, Citizens, Boy, and Attendants




<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION OF THE COMPLETE WORKS OF WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE IS COPYRIGHT 1990-1993 BY WORLD LIBRARY, INC.
, AND IS
PROVIDED BY PROJECT GUTENBERG ETEXT OF ILLINOIS BENEDICTINE COLLEGE
WITH PERMISSION.
